email_chain.subject: Freight Inquiry: 7,500 MT Oil Seed Cake - St. Petersburg to Seoul
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Lewis,

Could you please provide rates for shipping approximately 7,500 MT of oil seed cake from Saint Petersburg to Seoul?

Please include details regarding the length of the laycan for each rate option and any additional costs associated with accelerated discharge. 

Thank you for your time.

Regards,
Katherine Brown

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry: 7,500 MT Oil Seed Cake - St. Petersburg to Seoul
email_chain.body:
Hi Katherine,

Thank you for your inquiry. Please find below our rate options for the St. Petersburg to Seoul route:

- **Spot:** $50 per MT over 20% IFM + 30/5/20 (Laycan: 7-10 days)
- **Extended:** $40 per MT over 20% IFM + 30/10/20 (Laycan: 10-14 days)
- **Longer:** $30 per MT over 20% IFM + 30/15/20 (Laycan: 14-21 days)

The above rates include a fixed delay rate (FDR) of $5 per day for the first 7 days, then $10 per day for each day exceeding the initial 7 days. This is payable upon arrival. For example, if the vessel is delayed by 8 days, the FDR would be $45: ($5 x 7) + ($10 x 1) = $45.

I will send a follow up email regarding additional costs associated with accelerated discharge.

Regards,
Robert Lewis

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry: 7,500 MT Oil Seed Cake - St. Petersburg to Seoul
email_chain.body:
Hello Katherine,

Further to my previous email, please consider the following points:

*   **Additional Charges:** The above rates do *not* include accelerated discharge charges for cargo discharged in over 35 days. These charges are to be borne by the Seller.
*   **Vessel Availability:** Please be aware that vessel availability in this trade lane may be limited during April-May 2023 due to peak season. We currently have limited vessels available at the rates provided. These vessels are presently loaded on previous trades and will require a ballast leg to return to Russia after discharging. Therefore, we require 20-30 days' notice to accommodate this. We recommend booking a vessel as soon as possible if you wish to proceed at these rates.

Please let me know if you have any further questions.

Regards,
Robert Lewis

email_chain.body:
Are there any legal grounds on which we could refuse delivery of non-owned goods originating from Non-U.S. Ports to foreign countries at U.S. terminals? The owners are unwilling to transfer Title to us.

In this scenario, is it possible for us to refuse delivery? The carriers will eventually take possession of the goods and likely sell them to a salvage company. However, this process could take several weeks, possibly months.

Are there any U.S. regulations that would expedite this process, forcing the carriers to assume possession and transport the goods out of the country more quickly?

Thank you for your assistance.

The load is ex Qatar, not Fujairah, if you are thinking Qatar but the loading will last one or two days only. Moreover, the figure of 7,000 MT seems low for a voyage like this. Please provide further clarification and confirm the loading port.

Ciao,
Gent.

email_chain.subject: Montevideo Timber Project - Nailing/Lashing Flexibility
email_chain.body:
Hello Min,

How flexible are you on the nailing and lashing requirements at Montevideo?

Thanks,
Scott

email_chain.subject: Re: Montevideo Timber Project - Nailing/Lashing Flexibility
email_chain.body:
Dear Scott,

Montevideo is flexible on this issue provided the requirements of the Church History Museum are met. The museum is constructing a rock wall with hand-hewn timbers as a base to hold up the rocks. This entire wall will be constructed inside the museum to display this room. They will then hang two of our timbers from the inside of this rock wall with chain.

The nailing requirement for these timbers will be strictly adhered to in the construction of the display. The museum has asked that the side facing the rock wall be prepared to display it, potentially with some sort of protective material. However, the museum will decide on the type of protective coating. The only nailing that would have to be done is at the Museum.

Regards,
Min

email_chain.subject: Timber Shipment to Denmark
email_chain.body:

Bob

email_chain.subject: Re: Timber Shipment to Denmark
email_chain.body:
We would recommend that you bring the timbers. We have included some additional information below in hopes of answering some of the questions you have sent us in email. We need to know if you are interested in the display materials we have available for your timber and also the additional display material that your representative from us in Denmark has recommended.

You can find our current brochure at the following website. This has all of the prices and descriptions. Also in the attachments you will find a form you can fill out and return to us with payment. One of the timbers can be sent via FedEx which will cost approximately 1,000 Danish Kron.

Regards,
Min

email_chain.subject: LPG Tanker Inquiry: Dahej to Busan
email_chain.body:
Hi Ken,

We are looking to ship a tanker of approximately 80,000 MT of LPG from Dahej, India to Busan, Korea. We are targeting a laycan around May 15th, and have some flexibility on cargo specifications within standard LPG grades.

Please let me know if this is something you can assist with.

Regards,
Anthony

email_chain.subject: Re: LPG Tanker Inquiry: Dahej to Busan
email_chain.body:
Hi Anthony,

Thanks for the inquiry. We'd be happy to explore vessel options for this shipment. 

To help us narrow down suitable candidates, could you please clarify a few points?

*   Is your client looking for a newbuild or are they open to secondhand tonnage?
*   Are they interested in a voyage charter (firm charter) or a time charter?
*   Would they prefer a FOB or CIF arrangement?
*   Does your client have any preference regarding vessel registry (e.g., Chinese registry or open to others)?

I'll also reach out to our Singapore office to see what options they might have available.

Thank you,
Ken

email_chain.subject: Re: LPG Tanker Inquiry: Dahej to Busan
email_chain.body:
Hi Ken,

Thank you for your prompt reply. I've received further details from our client:

*   The vessel must have a valid Certificate of Compliance.
*   They prefer a newbuild vessel if possible.
*   They require a voyage charter (firm charter).
*   For the charter party, they would like to use the Norwegian Shipbrokers' Association (NSA) standard form.

Regards,
Anthony

email_chain.subject: Draft of preprint on Relative Freeness
email_chain.body:
Hi Denis and Michael,

Please find attached a draft of our preprint concerning relative freeness and Voiculescu's transferral principle. I've incorporated the feedback we discussed last week.

Best,
Raphael

email_chain.subject: Re: Draft of preprint on Relative Freeness
email_chain.body:
Raphael,

Thanks for sending this over. I've had a preliminary look, and it seems good. I'll need a bit more time to go through it thoroughly.

Denis

email_chain.subject: Preprint: Essential Theorems for Relative Freeness and Voiculescu's Transferral Principle
email_chain.body:
Dear Denis, Michael,

Following up on our discussion, I've made a few minor edits and submitted a new version of our preprint. 

## Introduction

The following is a pre-print for a joint paper with Denis Cavenagh, Michael Skeide and Raphael Ponge.

It is currently under review at Ann. Pol. Math. (with a new version from May 13, 2019) and can be accessed here (after a short registration). (Previous version here.)

The aim of this article is to fill in some significant gaps in the proofs of two fundamental theorems for (non-commutative) freeness, namely Theorem 4.1 and Theorem 5.1 by Voiculescu, in the context of non self-adjoint operator algebras and relative fre

email_chain.subject: Re: Preprint: Essential Theorems for Relative Freeness and Voiculescu's Transferral Principle
email_chain.body:
Raphael and Denis,

Thanks for the update and the link. I will register and review the updated version. Let's aim to finalize it soon.

Best,
Michael

LPG Tanker Inquiry - Ningbo to Baton Rouge
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Olsen,

I am looking for an LPG tanker to carry approximately 15,000 MT of LPG (equivalent to 60,000 DWT when fully loaded) from Ningbo, China to Baton Rouge, LA. Could you please let me know if you have any suitable options?

Regards,
Lukas

email_chain.subject: Re: LPG Tanker Inquiry - Ningbo to Baton Rouge
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Olsen,

Thank you for your prompt reply.

Our availability is tight; we would like the vessel to depart Ningbo, China on September 7, 2020. Therefore, we need to finalize arrangements by September 1st. Please confirm if you have a suitable vessel available during that timeframe for our 15,000 MT (60,000 DWT equivalent) loading.

Regards,
Lukas

email_chain.subject: Re: LPG Tanker Inquiry - Ningbo to Baton Rouge
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Olsen,

We are not interested in the vessel you provided. It is too large for our needs. We are looking for a smaller vessel.

Regards,
Lukas

email_chain.subject: Re: LPG Tanker Inquiry - Ningbo to Baton Rouge
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Olsen,

Thank you for your response.

If you have a vessel with a carrying capacity of around 50,000 DWT available between September 1st and September 5th for a 7,000 DWT loading, please send me the preliminary vessel specifications and pricing information. 

We are willing to consider purchasing the cargo at CBOT prices.

Please also send me the vessel's layout, as the number of ballast tanks is of particular interest to us. Fuel consumption is also an important factor.

A price around $17/MT would be preferable. We estimate the ETA to Baton Rouge to be approximately 35 days. If the price is closer to $20/MT, we would likely not proceed. Could you please confirm these estimated dates and provide pricing based on a partial loading (7000 DWT) and a full loading (15,000 MT, 60,000 DWT eq.)?

Regards,
Lukas

email_chain.body:
Hi Matthew,

Peter forwarded me Sebastian's latest email about discounts on steel billets. He essentially wants me to tell him 'no' as well. What's the most polite way to phrase this in an email? Should I use 'No.', 'no', or something else? Should I sign with my full name and title, or just 'Rachel'? Rachel

email_chain.subject: Re: Advice on replying to Sebastian
email_chain.body:
Hello Rachel,

You phrased it perfectly in your previous email. Sign it 'Dear Sebastian,

No, we don't offer those discounts.

Kind Regards,

Rachel [Your Full Name/Title]'

Always use your full name and title in official correspondence. Include the original email thread.

Best,

Matthew

email_chain.subject: Palm Kernel Oil Shipment - Port Klang to Male
email_chain.body:
Hi James,

We're looking to move 5,800 MT of palm kernel oil from Port Klang to Male. Could you advise on how temperature control is handled within the holds of your vessels?

Cheers,
Mona

email_chain.subject: Re: Palm Kernel Oil Shipment - Port Klang to Male
email_chain.body:
Dear Mona,

Thank you for your inquiry. Our vessels utilize a ventilation system that draws air through seawater to cool it. This cooled air is then circulated within the holds to maintain the desired temperature. We do not have dedicated refrigeration units within the holds themselves.

We also have rooms specifically designed for packaged bulk goods. The PKE could potentially be loaded into one or two of these rooms. The estimated loading rate would be approximately 7-8 MT per hour.

If you are packaging the PKE, please note the maximum weight per package should not exceed 1,500 kg, as our handling equipment is limited to this weight.

To prevent damage to the PKE during loading, we have implemented special procedures. We recommend ensuring the outer shell of the packaging is securely closed after loading and suggest using a sealing material. We can send you a sample of the material we recommend if you wish.

Please let me know if you have any further questions.

Best regards,
James

email_chain.subject: Re: Palm Kernel Oil Shipment - Port Klang to Male
email_chain.body:
Hi James,

That sounds promising. We can arrange for the product to be delivered in 20ft containers. The maximum dimensions are 140cm x 75cm x 37cm, and the heaviest container will weigh 1270kg. We anticipate needing 5 containers in total.

We can source the sealing material ourselves. Could you please provide the approximate dimensions of the rooms you mentioned?

Thanks again for your help.

Mona

email_chain.subject: Re: Palm Kernel Oil Shipment - Port Klang to Male
email_chain.body:
Dear Mona,

The rooms are approximately 8.5m long, 2.9m wide, and 2.8m high. This should be sufficient for your needs. Transporting the PKE in containers is the preferred method. We have made provisions for handling ISO containers.

If you encounter any difficulties arranging container transport, we can also load the goods at our port in Port Klang and transport them to the vessel using our own trucks.

Please do not hesitate to contact me if you have any further questions.

Best regards,
James Kleine
Managing Director, Kleine Business Consultancy
Maritima Massey Building
41 Massey Road
Sandton
2196
Johannesburg
+27 (11) 684-3387
+27 (83) 322-5294 (mobile)
kleine@net

email_chain.subject: Freight Quote Request - Pyrophyllite Ore Aqaba to Mombasa
email_chain.body:
Matthieu,

We'd like to ship 8,000 MT of pyrophyllite ore from Aqaba to Mombasa next month. Could you please let us know your best freight rate and vessel name for this shipment?

Best regards,
Ralph Anderson

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote Request - Pyrophyllite Ore Aqaba to Mombasa
email_chain.body:
Hi Ralph,

Thanks for your inquiry. I've passed this request on to Phil for quotation. He'll be in touch shortly.

Best regards,
Matthieu

email_chain.subject: RE: Freight Quote Request - Pyrophyllite Ore Aqaba to Mombasa
email_chain.body:
Hi Ralph,

Thanks for your inquiry. We are pleased to quote for this shipment as follows (based on potential transshipment via Qingdao due to direct vessel availability):

Vessel: XING LING
Sailing from: Qingdao on or about March 28, 2009
ETA: Mombasa on or about April 11, 2009

US$ 200/MT for a container load on FOB basis
US$ 180/MT for a container load on CIF basis

Above rate includes:
 a) The freighting by vessel
 b) Cost of berthing of vessel at Mombasa
 c) Payment of standard port charges (for clearance and handling of goods in Mombasa)
 d) Payment of cost of container
 e) Our usual agency fee

Please note that the rate above does *not* include the following charges:
 a) Cost of shipment of goods from Aqaba to Qingdao
 b) Cost of shipment of goods from Qingdao port to final destination.

Best regards,
Phil Jones

email_chain.subject: RE: Freight Quote Request - Pyrophyllite Ore Aqaba to Mombasa
email_chain.body:
Hi Phil,

Thanks for your reply.

This is what the customer requires:

*   We prefer to ship to Mombasa in containers. We can buy these in Qingdao.
*   We require door-to-door service. Our agent will take care of all port handling in China, the inland transportation of the containers to the door in Mombasa, and collection of goods at the door after discharge.
*   We prefer to arrange shipment and freight payment ourselves for Aqaba-Qingdao leg. We are only interested in Qingdao-Mombasa door to door.
*   Can you arrange the above service on a CIF basis, i.e., we would pay at Qingdao for delivery to our door in Mombasa?

Could you please quote the total price for the above, specifically covering shipment from Qingdao to our door in Mombasa?

Thanks,
Ralph

email_chain.subject: RE: Freight Quote Request - Pyrophyllite Ore Aqaba to Mombasa
email_chain.body:
Dear Ralph,

I'm pleased to submit the following quote:

The total cost to Mombasa (door to door, from Qingdao) is USD $250/MT.

This includes all port charges, inland transport in Mombasa to your door, and assumes your agent in Qingdao handles the loading and container purchase. 

Please let me know if you have any further questions.

Best regards,
Phil Jones

email_chain.subject: Grammar Notes
email_chain.body:
Dear Madame/Sir
We are looking for a voyage from October 25th to 28th for 26,000MT.

To be looking for a voyage

To do something, the subject is doing the action.

Compare:
To be waiting for a friend.

We are looking for a voyage means that they need someone to buy their product.

One must use the passive for this sentence.
We have the object in the sentence - voyage. This can be changed to object of the preposition for - voyage for.
This change turns the whole sentence into the passive sentence.

The subject will be the preposition.
We know this because the preposition for comes before the subject. We can make it a voyage.

We are looking for a voyage

The question is
Who are looking for a voyage

Answer They are looking for a voyage.

Common mistake in student papers

1. Using the active form for these sentences.

We do not use the active form when there is a preposition after the subject.
It should be
He is looking for a house.
We have the active form He is looking, but for comes after it.
We change the active form to the passive form, thus creating the passive form.

There is looking for a house.

2. Removing the article.

The article a is required to make the sentence active.
He is looking for a house.
If you remove a, you have created a passive sentence.

Who is looking

email_chain.subject: Re: Voyage Inquiry - 26,000 MT
email_chain.body: Who is looking?

email_chain.body:

email_chain.subject: GDDT-101 Cargo Discrepancy - Guangzhou Shipment
email_chain.body:
Dear Mrs. Carter,

I'm writing regarding a discrepancy in the cargo volume for the GDDT-101 vessel. Our agreement stated a shipment of 3,000 tons of Liquefied Petroleum Gas (LPG) and 5,000 tons of oil, totaling 8,000 tons. However, I understand the GDDT-101 has a cargo capacity of only 7,800 tons.

How did you manage to load so much cargo? Furthermore, the remaining space was intended for a rice shipment, which is not visible in the photos you sent.

Please weigh the hull immediately and contact me with the updated figures. What is your estimated vessel draft? Are you considering removing some of the oil to comply with the vessel's capacity? This vessel is considerably large for the LPGs, the last time I was in an all-oil ship was in 2003, and I have concerns for stability

Best regards,

Camille Leclerc

email_chain.subject: Why I Chose This Career
email_chain.body:
Hey,

So, you asked about why I got into this shipping gig. It's a bit of a story, but I'll keep it short.

Basically, I've always been fascinated by how things move around the world. I mean, think about it – everything you own, from your phone to your coffee, probably spent some time on a ship. That's pretty cool.

I started out as an intern at a freight forwarding company and got hooked. The fast pace, the problem-solving, the international aspect – it all clicked for me. There's always something new to learn, some new challenge to tackle. One day you are figuring out how to secure the best freight, the next you are dealing with a global crisis, like the Suez Canal blockage. It’s never boring.

It can be stressful, sure. Lots of late nights, and keeping track of cargo across different time zones takes its toll. But at the end of the day, I feel like I’m actually contributing to something important. I am helping businesses to grow and consumers to get the product they need.

So yeah, that's the gist of it. No grand plan or anything, just stumbled into it and fell in love with the chaos!

Cheers,
John

email_chain.subject: Panama Canal Reopening Delayed
email_chain.body:
Hey everyone,

Just a quick update on the Panama Canal situation. Remember how they were planning to reopen it on March 30th? Well, that's been pushed back a bit. Now they are expected to resume operations on March 30, 2024.

According to authorities here in Torruk Heights, they're almost there, but they've run into some snags during the final stages. No specific details were given, but it sounds like unexpected issues cropped up during inspection.

Basically, they want to make sure everything is running smoothly before letting ships through again. Safety first, right?

So, keep that March 30th date in mind. I’ll send another update once I have more information.

Best,
The News Team

email_chain.subject: UAN Shipment Inquiry - New Orleans to Mersin
email_chain.body:
Hi Yasemin,

Hope you're well.

We have a potential shipment of approximately 4,600 MT of bulk UAN from New Orleans to Mersin, loading next week. Would this be something you could handle?

Also, do you foresee any additional bunker surcharges given the current market volatility?

Best regards,

Judith Anderson

email_chain.subject: Re: UAN Shipment Inquiry - New Orleans to Mersin
email_chain.body:
Dear Judith,

Yes, we can handle 4,600 MT of bulk UAN from New Orleans to Mersin next week.

Sincerely,

Yasemin
Mersin Shipping Ltd. Co.

email_chain.subject: Re: UAN Shipment Inquiry - New Orleans to Mersin
email_chain.body:
Dear Yasemin,

Thank you. I apologize, I should have included the target price. I need the price quote ASAP. Also, regarding my previous question, I needed an official statement to confirm there will be no additional Bunker Adjustment Factors at current rate for the time being. 

Best regards,

Judith Anderson

email_chain.subject: Re: UAN Shipment Inquiry - New Orleans to Mersin
email_chain.body:
Dear Judith,

Please see attached quote for the 4,600 MT UAN shipment from New Orleans to Mersin.

Sincerely,

Yasemin
Mersin Shipping Ltd. Co.

email_chain.subject: Re: UAN Shipment Inquiry - New Orleans to Mersin
email_chain.body:
Dear Yasemin,

I appear to have missed your prior email with the attachment. Would you mind resending it?

Best regards,

Judith Anderson

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for New Zealand Apples
email_chain.body:
Dear Mrs. Santos,

I hope this email finds you well.

Our company is interested in purchasing 5 tons of apples from New Zealand. Could you please provide us with availability and pricing information?

Thank you for your time, and I look forward to your reply.

Kind regards,
Marian

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for New Zealand Apples
email_chain.body:
Dear Marian,

Thank you for your email.

I've checked with our local supplier. Here's the contact information for a potential source of apples:

Name: Peter Zei
Mobile: 13888888888
Address: Zhangzhou, Fujian

Please contact him directly to discuss your requirements.

Best regards,
Deborah

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for New Zealand Apples
email_chain.body:
Dear Deborah,

Thank you for the contact information. I've checked with Peter Zei in Zhangzhou, but unfortunately, he doesn't have New Zealand apples in stock. 

However, I do have access to apples through the wholesale market. Please find the indicative pricing below:

Factory price: 50 USD per unit
Retailer's price: 60 USD per unit
Wholesale price: 100 USD per unit

To proceed, please provide your delivery address and specific purchase details (quantity and preferred pricing).

Thanks,
Marian

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for New Zealand Apples
email_chain.body:
Dear Marian,

Thank you for the update.

We are not interested in apples at those prices, as they are too expensive for our current needs. Could you possibly offer a more competitive price? 

Please let me know if you have any further questions.

Best regards,
Deborah

email_chain.subject: Inquiry Regarding Cargo Manifest - Container No. 07123
email_chain.body:
Good Morning,

Please send an updated cargo manifest for our container No. 07123. The current cargo description is listed as "Coal", but we require specific details regarding the type of coal. 

Yours Sincerely,
Yve Morgan

email_chain.subject: RE: Inquiry Regarding Cargo Manifest - Container No. 07123
email_chain.body:
Dear Yve,

Your request was received, and I have updated the cargo manifest as requested. I am forwarding a copy as an attachment, along with our proposal for the 100-car shipment of coal, to our export contacts in Quesling and your destination contacts in Pyongyang.

Please review the attached documents and let me know if you have any questions or concerns.

Best regards,
Shipping Department

email_chain.subject: URGENT: Error in Cargo Manifest - Action Required
email_chain.body:
Dear Shipping Department,

It appears there is an error in the cargo manifest you sent. Please re-check it before we proceed with delivery. The manifest indicates an unknown quantity of coal, but the container number has been deleted. We require the correct container number to begin moving the cargo.

Please provide the container number as soon as possible.

Yours Sincerely,
Marc Churchill

email_chain.subject: RE: URGENT: Error in Cargo Manifest - Action Required
email_chain.body:
Dear Marc and Shipping,

Thank you for your concern. The item in question is a drug, not coal. The incorrect description was a mistake, and I apologize for the confusion. Rectifying this will take some time, as our system is inflexible, but we are working on it.

I have noticed the cargo manifest lists a number of containers and cargoes. Would it be possible for your engineering team to create a list of the contents of each container?

Thank you,
Yve Morgan

email_chain.subject: RE: URGENT: Error in Cargo Manifest - Action Required
email_chain.body: The container number is not a mistake. It has been intentionally deleted from the manifest. Do you understand this?

email_chain.subject: RE: URGENT: Error in Cargo Manifest - Action Required
email_chain.body: No, I do not understand. Why has it been deleted?

email_chain.subject: RE: URGENT: Error in Cargo Manifest - Action Required
email_chain.body: I thought I had explained that I would not use a loaded container to transport coal, because it would not be able to fit everything that needed to be transported. So I requested a container with nothing in it to be used for the coal shipment. The cargo manifest is a copy of the *order*. I do not need a container number at the *order* stage, just the description of what is expected in the cargo.

email_chain.subject: RE: URGENT: Error in Cargo Manifest - Action Required
email_chain.body: The cargo manifest lists cargoes that are not in the containers you have sent. You must supply the correct containers.

email_chain.subject: RE: URGENT: Error in Cargo Manifest - Action Required
email_chain.body: How can you ask for cargoes if they have already been sent? I will check the numbers, but the cargo manifest has not been updated since you received it.

email_chain.subject: RE: URGENT: Error in Cargo Manifest - Action Required
email_chain.body: The cargo manifest has been updated. Please check.

email_chain.body:

We urgently need to ship 45,000 MT of coal from Lulu Island in Manila to Toba Inlet, Vamstaff. Could you please let me know the availability and cost for tankers as soon as possible?

Thank you,
Rohan

email_chain.body:
Hi Ms. Chen,

Following up on the coal shipment. 

Additionally, we are having difficulty finding transport for personnel from Lulu Island back to Vamstaff. Is it possible to arrange passenger transport on the vessels used for the coal shipment, or on separate boats? We need to move some people as quickly as possible.

Thank you,
Rohan

email_chain.body:

For internal transport, could you please arrange a boat to take me from Tahane 1 island to West Dock and vice versa? I need a reliable service for regular trips.

Thank you,
Rohan

email_chain.body:
Hi Ms. Chen,

Could you also organize a boat to transport personnel from Lulu Island to West Dock and back? This will be a regular service for crew changes and other essential personnel movements.

Thank you,
Rohan

email_chain.body:

We need to ship 32,000 kilograms of goods from our large warehouse to Toba Inlet. It can be loaded on any vessel capable of handling the cargo.

Thank you,
Rohan

email_chain.subject: RE: Urgent: Coal Shipment - Lulu Island to Toba Inlet
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Chen,

Just checking in again regarding the availability of a ship to transport 45,000 tons of coal from Lulu Island to Toba Inlet.

Thank you,
Rohan

email_chain.subject: Crude Oil Cargo Offer - Cyprus to Piraeus
email_chain.body:
Good morning Mr. Spears,

We have a cargo of approximately 18,000 MT of crude oil available for shipment from Cyprus to Piraeus. Loading is scheduled for September 8th. As per our usual procedure, we require a guarantee before proceeding. 

Can you confirm your intention to proceed?

Thanks,

Bob Miller

email_chain.subject: Re: Crude Oil Cargo Offer - Cyprus to Piraeus
email_chain.body:
Hi Bob,

Thanks for the offer! 

Could you please provide more details on the cargo's specifications (API gravity, sulfur content, etc.) to ensure it meets our requirements? Also, what are the draft restrictions at the loading and discharge ports?

We are definitely interested, especially if delivery to Piraeus can be guaranteed within 20 days of loading. We're looking for competitive terms. We would also like to offer $210 per tonne if that delivery time is assured.

Kind regards,

John Spears

email_chain.subject: Re: Crude Oil Cargo Offer - Cyprus to Piraeus
email_chain.body:
Dear John,

Regarding your inquiry, here's our firm offer for the crude oil shipment:

Delivery: Guaranteed within 20 days after loading (sea passage).

Payment: Our asking price is $220 per tonne.

I must inform you that this price is final according to my superiors, and is non-negotiable.

Please advise on your decision at your earliest convenience.

With best regards,

Thomas Jacobs

email_chain.subject: Re: Crude Oil Cargo Offer - Cyprus to Piraeus
email_chain.body:
Dear Thomas,

Thank you for the offer. Unfortunately, $220 per tonne is not acceptable for us. We will consider other options.

Regards,

John Spears

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: 2,500 MT Corn Oil to Xiamen

Edward Chen

email_chain.subject: Shipping Inquiry: 5,000 MT Wheat - Ashdod to Karachi
email_chain.body:
Hi Dr. Nakamura,

We have 5,000 metric tons of wheat ready for shipment in Ashdod and are looking to ship it to Karachi. Could you please send us the full shipping schedule for May 2024? Also, could you provide your best quote for shipping on that date?

Best,
Gracie Jones

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Inquiry: 5,000 MT Wheat - Ashdod to Karachi
email_chain.body:
Hi Gracie,

Thanks for your inquiry. To provide an accurate quote, could you please send me your complete company address with postal codes?

Regards,
Dr. Hiroki Nakamura

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Inquiry: 5,000 MT Wheat - Ashdod to Karachi
email_chain.body:
Hi Dr. Nakamura,

Our address is:

Unilever Pakistan Limited
"OPP Tower", State Life Building No.1, 2nd Floor
Abdullah Haroon Road, M.A. Jinnah Road
Karachi, 74000 Pakistan

Thank you very much!

Best,
Gracie Jones

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Inquiry: 5,000 MT Wheat - Ashdod to Karachi
email_chain.body:
Hi Dr. Nakamura,

Just following up on our previous emails. We are specifically looking for shipping details in May 2024. Are you looking at alternative dates?

Best,
Gracie Jones

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Inquiry: 5,000 MT Wheat - Ashdod to Karachi
email_chain.body:
Hi Gracie,

Thank you for your email. I am currently compiling the May 2024 shipping schedules and will get back to you with a quote as soon as possible. Thank you for your patience.

Regards,
Dr. Hiroki Nakamura

Note: I will be out of the office on vacation starting Nov 1st returning Dec 1st. Please expect a slight delay in responses during this time.

email_chain.subject: End of Year Party Invitation
email_chain.body:
Good afternoon,

As the year draws to a close, we'd like to invite you to our end-of-year party on December 20th, 2024. We'll have some amazing guests, so please confirm your attendance at your earliest convenience.

Thank you for your consideration.

Kindest Regards,
Hiroko

email_chain.subject: End of Year Party - Food and Drink Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Good afternoon,

Our party on December 20th is fast approaching. Have you finalized the food and drink selections? If not, we're still open to suggestions.

Thanks for your cooperation.

Best Regards,
Hiroko

email_chain.subject: Re: End of Year Party - Food and Drink Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Dear Hiroko,

I've made my selections for food and drinks for the party, which is now scheduled for December 30th. I've left the details for your approval.

Thanks,

Sent from a mobile device

email_chain.subject: Re: End of Year Party - Food and Drink Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Dear Hiroko,

Just to clarify, the party will be held on December 25th, not the 30th. I've also reviewed the food and drink details, and they look good. Please confirm.

Best Regards,

Sent from a mobile device

email_chain.subject: Re: End of Year Party - Food and Drink Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Dear Sender,

Thanks for letting me know about the date change (December 25th confirmed). I'll double-check the food and drink details you selected. Just need to confirm the final arrangements with the caterer.

Best Regards,
Hiroko

Sent from a mobile device

email_chain.subject: Re: End of Year Party Invitation
email_chain.body:
Dear Hiroko,

I'm in! Can't wait for the party.

email_chain.subject: RE: Freight Rate Inquiry - Gasoil Galveston to Santos

email_chain.subject: RE: Freight Rate Inquiry - Gasoil Galveston to Santos
email_chain.body:
Hi,

Please confirm the price for Gasoil (5,000 MT) Galveston to Santos for the month of March 2016.

email_chain.subject: Oil Gasoil

Hey Andrew,

Am I in line with your intended timeline?
Our Gasoil for March is USD 370.00 FOB VTS.

Hi Donny,

    If you can provide a price for this cargo in January, please provide the freight and laytime terms that will be applied.

    If you are unable to provide a price, please let me know.

Best regards,

email_chain.subject: Gasoil

Donny at Grupo Timsan is offering you 370fob Santos.
Please advise if we are in line with your intention. 
I guess that, if you are willing to buy it, it must be because you have already obtained a 1/1 cargo for January.

Best regards,

John

email_chain.subject: Gasoil

Would it be possible to arrange an online meeting at 0900 Sao Paulo on Monday?
If so, please provide your Skype number

Best regards,

John

email_chain.subject: RE: Gasoil
email_chain.body:
Hi John,

Yes, Monday at 0900 Sao Paulo works for me. My Skype number is [Skype number].

Best regards,

Andrew

email_chain.subject: Diesel Shipment Opportunity - 11,000 MT
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Ali,

We have a shipment of 11,000 MT of diesel available. We have several vessels that might be suitable for your project and are looking to secure transport. Would you be interested in discussing this in more detail?

Thanks,
Patrick

email_chain.subject: Re: Diesel Shipment Opportunity - 11,000 MT
email_chain.body:
Hi Patrick,

Yes, we are open to discussing the possibility of utilizing your vessel, provided it meets our operational specifications and compliance requirements.

Please provide the vessel name, owner's name, classification society, and a recent SIRE report. This information will allow us to perform due diligence and determine if we can move forward with further negotiations.

Kind regards,
Mohamed

email_chain.subject: Re: Diesel Shipment Opportunity - 11,000 MT
email_chain.body:
Hi Mohamed,

Please find attached a brief summary of the vessel's details as requested.

Would you have time for a quick call to discuss these details further? It would be helpful to clarify any questions you might have.

Thanks,
Patrick

email_chain.subject: Re: Diesel Shipment Opportunity - 11,000 MT
email_chain.body:
Hi Patrick,

Thank you for the vessel details. A call would be great. We can schedule a call for tomorrow at 4:30 pm GMT.

Kind regards,
Mohamed

email_chain.subject: Re: Diesel Shipment Opportunity - 11,000 MT
email_chain.body:
Hi Mohamed,

Unfortunately, we are unavailable at that time. Could we reschedule for 7:00 pm GMT instead?

Regards,
Patrick

October: 23, 24, 25, 26, 28, 29, 30

email_chain.subject: Shipment Ready for Pick-up - San Francisco Sugar

We are delighted to inform you that your shipment of sugar from San Francisco has been unloaded and is ready for pick-up at our warehouse in Cologne. We have calculated that the actual cost was $46,000 less than we expected. We will send an updated invoice shortly.

Kind regards,

Xavier Cortez

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipment Ready for Pick-up - San Francisco Sugar
email_chain.body:
Xavier,

Many thanks for the notification regarding our shipment. It is much appreciated.

Lilla Barnhill

email_chain.subject: Loading in Germany - San Francisco Sugar
email_chain.body:
Hi Xavier,

I am pleased to inform you that the shipment that arrived last week is ready to be loaded onto a vessel in Germany. Please confirm that the loading process will begin in the next 24 hours.

Lilla Barnhill

email_chain.subject: Re: Loading in Germany - San Francisco Sugar
email_chain.body:
Lilla,

Yes, that is what we were planning on doing. Xavier is supposed to call me today to give me an update. He seems to be on top of it, so I have faith it will go according to plan. Also, I’m getting ready to receive another shipment, but from Alabama. Thanks again.

Lilla Barnhill

email_chain.subject: Re: Loading in Germany - San Francisco Sugar
email_chain.body:
Xavier,

You are on top of things, sir.

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: 50MT Face Masks from Taipei to Dubai
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Hill,

We are looking to export 50MT of face masks from Taipei to Dubai. When do you anticipate opening your next Far East loading?

Thanks,
Brooke

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: 50MT Face Masks from Taipei to Dubai
email_chain.body:
Hi Brooke,

We will not be taking any new Far East loads for the next 6 weeks. We have been experiencing operational delays and require some time to recover.

Thanks,
Peter

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: 50MT Face Masks from Taipei to Dubai
email_chain.body:
Dear Peter,

Thanks for your reply.

Could you please advise when your next Far East import is scheduled?

Regards,
Brooke

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: 50MT Face Masks from Taipei to Dubai
email_chain.body:
Hi Brooke,

I apologize for the confusion. To clarify, while we aren't taking new loads for 6 weeks, our next Far East *discharge* is scheduled for Monday. We are also preparing for the Eid break next week, which will further impact our loading schedule.

Thanks,
Peter

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: 50MT Face Masks from Taipei to Dubai
email_chain.body:
Dear Peter,

Could you please confirm the earliest date you will be accepting new Far East loadings again?

Regards,
Brooke

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: 50MT Face Masks from Taipei to Dubai
email_chain.body:
Hi Brooke,

As previously mentioned, we will not be loading anything new for 6 weeks. Things should return to normal operations after the Eid break.

Thanks,
Peter

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: 50MT Face Masks from Taipei to Dubai - Update?
email_chain.body:
Hi Peter,

Any updates on when you'll be accepting Far East loadings again?

Regards,
Brooke

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: 50MT Face Masks from Taipei to Dubai - Update?
email_chain.body:
Hi Brooke,

We are loading a 50MT Far East shipment tomorrow morning, if you are interested. However, I'm afraid we are no longer accepting face masks due to a change in rate classifications.

Thanks,
Peter

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: 50MT Face Masks from Taipei to Dubai - Update?
email_chain.body:
Dear Peter,

Are you accepting any other commodity besides the container you're loading?

Thanks,
Brooke

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: 50MT Face Masks from Taipei to Dubai - Update?
email_chain.body:
Hi Brooke,

Yes, we have space for other Far East shipments. The 50MT shipment loading tomorrow is for other commodity.

Thanks,
Peter

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: 50MT Face Masks from Taipei to Dubai - Update?
email_chain.body:
Dear Peter,

Did you mean loading tomorrow, or after Eid? 

Regards,
Brooke

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: 50MT Face Masks from Taipei to Dubai - Update?
email_chain.body:
Hi Brooke,

Tomorrow is before Eid, so the current plan is to load tomorrow morning at 5AM.

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: 50MT Face Masks from Taipei to Dubai - Update?
email_chain.body:
Dear Peter,

Yes, I am interested. Kindly confirm availability and let us know next steps.

Thanks,
Brooke

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: 50MT Face Masks from Taipei to Dubai - Update?
email_chain.body:
Hi Brooke,

Yes, we have one last container space available. We are loading this morning (as in, in a few hours) and tomorrow at 5AM. I need confirmation immediately to secure your load. The container size will allow for another 50MT Far East shipment tomorrow.

Thanks,
Peter

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: 50MT Face Masks from Taipei to Dubai - Update?
email_chain.body:
Dear Peter,

We are interested. Kindly confirm that the spot is reserved and what supporting documents you require.

Regards,
Brooke

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: 50MT Face Masks from Taipei to Dubai - Update?
email_chain.body:
Hi Brooke,

Unfortunately, that spot is fully booked. Please keep in touch, as plans sometimes change.

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: 50MT Face Masks from Taipei to Dubai - Today?
email_chain.body:
Dear Peter,

Have you taken any Far East shipment today?

Regards,
Brooke

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: 50MT Face Masks from Taipei to Dubai - Today?
email_chain.body:
Hi Brooke,

We are loading a Far East shipment today at 5AM. I'm afraid we are fully booked and cannot take another load.

email_chain.subject: Sugar Inquiry - Durban to Jakarta
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Hutchinson,

We’re looking at a potential shipment of sugar from Durban to Jakarta. Could you confirm your demurrage rate for Jakarta?

Warm regards,
Holly

email_chain.subject: Re: Sugar Inquiry - Durban to Jakarta
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Hutchinson,

Following up on the sugar shipment, we're also considering another seller. Their sugar comes in a bigger bag size (see attached). The quality appears comparable. Would a larger bag size be acceptable for our end customer in Jakarta?

All the best,
Holly

(Attachment: Bag_Size_Spec.pdf - hypothetical)

email_chain.subject: Re: Sugar Inquiry - Durban to Jakarta
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Hutchinson,

Thanks for confirming the demurrage rate. 

Some further questions for you:

Are you planning to deliver to ports in South Sumatra as well? What would the cost be for trucking sugar into Palembang from those ports?

And do you know who is currently running the factory on the Kertosono Estate? If it's restarted, would it have a competitive price compared to Durban sugar? 

Thanks,
Holly

email_chain.subject: Demurrage Rates Inquiry - Indonesian Ports
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Hutchinson,

We have a few large sugar transactions on the agenda for Indonesia and need to find out the demurrage rates for the ports we are considering for delivery. They are:

*   Pelabuhan Umum Tanjung Priok
*   Pelabuhan International
*   Batamindo Batu Besi Port (near Batam Airport)
*   Pelabuhan Internasional Tanjung Priok, Teluk Gadung, Bekasi

For these ports, please could you confirm the following information for each:

*   Current monthly demurrage rate per twenty foot container
*   Average waiting time at each port (how long is the waiting queue? If there are waiting lists, do we need to be on it to secure our port slot?)
*   Estimated trucking distance and cost into Palembang or Jambi from these ports.

Thank you,
Holly

email_chain.subject: Re: Demurrage Rates Inquiry - Indonesian Ports
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Hutchinson,

Thanks so much for your fast response. That's very helpful.

Holly

email_chain.subject: Bitumen Enquiry - 12,000 MT - Durban
email_chain.body:
Hi Alya,

I just received a bitumen enquiry from a buyer in Durban. They are looking to purchase 12,000 MT for delivery in Q4 2023. Could you please provide me with a quotation for freight and advise on the estimated time of arrival (ETA)?

Thanks,
Giselle

email_chain.subject: Re: Bitumen Enquiry - 12,000 MT - Durban
email_chain.body:
Dear Giselle,

Hope all is well.

To provide you with an accurate quotation, could you please clarify the specific product requirements? 

Thank you,
Alyah

email_chain.subject: Re: Bitumen Enquiry - 12,000 MT - Durban
email_chain.body:
Hi Alyah,

The buyer is looking for 12,000 MT of bitumen, CIF Durban, for Q4 2023 delivery. We're currently unable to make a firm commitment as we don't have immediate product availability.

I'll email our product manager and have them provide you with the quotation. I will follow up once I have the details.

Thank you,
Giselle

email_chain.subject: Re: Bitumen Enquiry - 12,000 MT - Durban
email_chain.body:
That would be most helpful. Thank you Giselle.

Alyah

email_chain.subject: Bitumen Quote - 12,000 MT - Durban
email_chain.body:
Dear Alyah,

Please find attached our quote for 12,000 MT of bitumen.

Kindly review and revert to me.

Giselle

email_chain.subject: Re: Bitumen Quote - 12,000 MT - Durban
email_chain.body:
Dear Alyah,

Thank you for the quote and contract. I would like to kindly request that you review and confirm whether the offer meets the end client's requirements.

I can confirm that the offer has been passed onto our client for their feedback. If we receive confirmation and are able to issue a firm offer within two working days, we will inform you before the end of the day.

Thank you,
Giselle

email_chain.subject: Re: Bitumen Quote - 12,000 MT - Durban
email_chain.body: Please review and revert to me on the terms of payment.

email_chain.subject: Re: Bitumen Quote - 12,000 MT - Durban
email_chain.body: We have the above in both CIF and CFR terms. Please review and revert to me. We will not be able to process your offer until we receive feedback from the customer. We look forward to your response.

email_chain.subject: Re: Bitumen Quote - 12,000 MT - Durban
email_chain.body: The client wants the terms in the quote as well as the bank details. We will revert on the product and confirmation once we get feedback. We look forward to your response.

email_chain.subject: Re: Bitumen Quote - 12,000 MT - Durban
email_chain.body:
Could you please confirm that your product manager will provide the quotation with the below details:

20,000 MT bitumen for CIF delivery to Durban
Transportation by clean tanker
Insurance on board
Seller has marine cargo insurance that covers up to and including Durban
Letter of credit that has been negotiated in the amount of USD, (FOB amount) in addition to the CIF amount plus 5% for the buyers commission, and is valued at USD. and valid from 1 January

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: Vessel for Sulfuric Acid - Rotterdam to Venice
email_chain.body:
Hello Juan,

We're planning to move 6,000 tons of sulfuric acid from Rotterdam to Venice in mid-December. 

Do you have a suitable vessel available, and could you confirm if in-port fees will be charged?

Best regards,
Alex

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Vessel for Sulfuric Acid - Rotterdam to Venice
email_chain.body:
Hello Alex,

Yes, I received your email and have forwarded it to our chartering department. They will be in touch with you shortly.

Kind regards,
Juan

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Vessel for Sulfuric Acid - Rotterdam to Venice
email_chain.body:
Juan,

Just checking in on the vessel availability for the sulfuric acid shipment. Please let me know if your chartering department has any updates.

Alex

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Vessel for Sulfuric Acid - Rotterdam to Venice
email_chain.body:
Hi Alex,

Following up on Juan's email. Currently, we don't have any vessels immediately available in Rotterdam, and we don't anticipate any being free before the end of the month.

Kind regards,
Kees

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Vessel for Sulfuric Acid - Rotterdam to Venice
email_chain.body:
Alex,

Further to my previous email, we do have a vessel that will be free by the end of this month. However, its capacity is 5,000 tons.

Yes, we will be charging for in-port fees.

Kind regards,
Kees

email_chain.subject: Freight Inquiry - 4600 MT Grains Bangkok to Tanjung
email_chain.body:
Hello Ms. Sung,

We're firming up 4,600 MT of grains from Bangkok to Tanjung. Can you offer freight, and what kind of laytime are you offering?

Best,
Alex

email_chain.subject: Follow Up: Freight Inquiry - Grains from Bangkok to Tanjung
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Sung,

We previously sent you the following email from one of our clients but haven't received a response. Could you please review and provide your latest freight offer?

From: Charles <charles@client.com>
Sent: Wednesday, February 25, 2015 11:15 AM
To: 'melina sung' (mssung@bgl.co.th)
Cc: yamamoto@bioa.com
Subject: PROPOSAL INVOICE

Hi Ms. Sung,

It is our pleasure to introduce our company as a true export facilitator of agricultural products from Bangladesh to buyers around the world. With your kind consideration, we would like to serve you.

KINDLY CONFIRM THE FOLLOWING REQUIRED GRANULES FOR YOUR KIND CONSIDERATION AND DO LOOK INTO THEM.

1)

email_chain.subject: Rice Quote - Myanmar to China
email_chain.body:
I am asking for a quote for similar rice to ANAK from "Sung". This is for Myanmar to China. Rice HS Code: 10061010.

Any idea of this rice market in Myanmar to China?

email_chain.subject: Re: Rice Quote - Myanmar to China
email_chain.body: please quote this kind of rice, for this market (Myanmar to China).

email_chain.subject: FW: [SURABAYA] to LAO: 18,000 MT of Milled Rice
Lunar New Year Greetings from Sung Trading Co., Ltd.
email_chain.body:
Sung Trading CO, Ld.,
Wishes Your Company Well on the Blessed Occasion of the Lunar New Year

When we were children we used to wait for lunar new year with great excitement, waiting to play with fireworks and check our presents. Though the modern times have changed our lives to a large extent, the spirit of happiness, the passion for seeing family and friends that we experienced on those special occasions is still very much present with us.

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: Space for 500MT Steel Plates - Ulsan to Pusan - August 30th
email_chain.body:
Good afternoon,

We are looking for a vessel to transport 500MT of steel plates from Ulsan to Pusan, ready for shipment on August 30th. If you have available space on a suitable vessel, please send me a freight quote.

Many thanks,
Irina Volkova

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Space for 500MT Steel Plates - Ulsan to Pusan - August 30th
email_chain.body:
Good afternoon Irina,

Thank you for your prompt inquiry. To provide you with an accurate quote, I need some further information.

Could you please confirm the readiness date is indeed August 30th? Also, could you provide your company name and contact number?

I will then prepare a quote for the 500MT of steel plates for shipment on that date. Finally, can you confirm the dimensions of the steel plates? 

Regarding your question, we have regular sailings from Ulsan to Pusan and will check on availability for August 30th upon receiving your confirmation.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon,
Marcus Eberhardt

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Space for 500MT Steel Plates - Ulsan to Pusan - August 30th
email_chain.body:
Good afternoon Marcus,

Thank you for your prompt response.

Yes, the 500MT of steel plates from Ulsan to Pusan will be ready for shipment on the 30th of August. Our company name is 'Volkova Steel Trading' and our contact number is +1-555-123-4567. The approximate dimensions of each steel plate are 2m x 1m x 0.1m.

As mentioned in my previous email, I am interested in receiving a quote for 500MT of steel plates on the 30th of August. Could you also please confirm how often your vessels typically sail from Ulsan to Pusan and if you currently have available space on a suitable vessel for that date?

Looking forward to hearing from you soon,
Irina Volkova

email_chain.subject: Checking in: Thompson Exports - 2020
email_chain.body:
Good day Mr. Thompson,

I hope this email finds you well. I'm writing to check in on how Thompson Exports has been navigating 2020. I understand it has been a challenging year for many businesses, and I'm particularly interested to know how it has affected your exports to Japan.

Thank you in advance for your time and insights.

Many thanks,
William Wilson

email_chain.subject: Re: Checking in: Thompson Exports - 2020
email_chain.body:
Good day Mr. Wilson,

It was good to hear from you. 

Yes, it has been a difficult year. We are currently holding a considerable amount of inventory from last year that we were unable to ship due to disruptions. However, we have secured some orders for 2021, which is encouraging.

Thank you,
John Thompson

email_chain.subject: Shipping Inquiry - Timber from Skopje to Suez
email_chain.body:
Hi Tom,

How much would it cost to transport 20,000 MT of timber from Skopje to Suez, and what is your earliest possible departure date?

Thanks,
Farouk

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Inquiry - Timber from Skopje to Suez
email_chain.body:
Dear Farouk,

Thank you for your query regarding the transport of 20,000 MT of timber from Skopje to Suez. 

Based on current market conditions, the estimated cost is €3,040 (approximately $4,227 USD). The estimated time of arrival (ETA) in Suez is April 5th. Please note that these figures are subject to change pending a finalized booking.

We appreciate your interest in our services and look forward to hearing from you.

Sincerely,
Tom

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Inquiry - Timber from Skopje to Suez
email_chain.body:
Dear Tom,

Thank you for the prompt response. I'm pleased with the shipping costs and estimated arrival date. 

Could you please send me a detailed contract outlining the terms of the shipment? Also, I'd like to know the name of the vessel that will be used, its more precise ETA, and what paperwork will be required for customs clearance in Suez.  Finally, can you confirm the specific port facility in Suez where the shipment will be discharged?

Thank you,
Farouk

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Inquiry - Timber from Skopje to Suez
email_chain.body:
Dear Farouk,

Thank you for your continued interest. 

Please find attached a detailed contract outlining the terms of the shipment. The vessel assigned to this transport is the "Star of India," and its current ETA at the Port of Suez is April 3rd. The shipment will be discharged at the main container terminal within the Port of Suez.

Also attached is a preliminary list of the necessary paperwork required for customs clearance. Please review the contract and paperwork at your convenience.

We appreciate your business and look forward to your confirmation.

Sincerely,
Tom

email_chain.body:

*   BLS Chemicals (Singapore): US$34,000/MT for 5,000 MT, ex-works.
*   BLS Chemicals (Jebel Ali): US$30,000/MT for 7,500 MT, ex-works.

We also have some smaller orders to fulfill: 3,750 MT for the West Coast US and 1,250 MT for Hong Kong. These smaller orders can use space on M/T Baltic Summit and M/T Intrepid.

Would you be willing to offer $29,000/MT FOB Lagos?

Amber

email_chain.subject: RE: Charter Inquiry - 2500 MT Cargo Vessel
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Rossi,

Following your inquiry, I have arranged for the vessel ORIFLAMM to make a call at Bimini next week so that you may arrange a survey. 

Her current schedule is as follows:
Week 1: Load cargo in Houston, load fuel in New Orleans, voyage to Cuxhaven.
Week 2: Load cargo in Cuxhaven, voyage to Halifax, load more cargo in Halifax, voyage to Boston, offload cargo in Boston.

She will then proceed to Bimini where the survey can be arranged.

I will be in contact with you soon to finalize the survey details.

Sincerely,
Stella Jones

email_chain.subject: RE: Charter Inquiry - 2500 MT Cargo Vessel - Bimini Survey
email_chain.body:
Dear Stella,

Just a quick note to say thanks for the logistics of arranging the survey in Bimini.

I and my colleague, <first_name>, will have a flight to Bimini on Thursday and will be staying at the Grand Isle Bimini Bay Resort. We'll be ready to meet the vessel at the survey dock on Friday.

Sincerely,
Enzo

email_chain.subject: ORIFLAMM Survey Report - Bimini
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Rossi,

As promised, I have prepared a comprehensive analysis of the ORIFLAMM survey data, along with a list of repairs, ratings, and observations.

You may review this document and advise us whether you should proceed to purchase the vessel or not. There are a few issues with the vessel that are a cause for concern, however it should be possible to address these issues without significantly compromising vessel integrity.

The main concerns are a cracked main engine bearing housing and the state of some of the steering equipment. I will recommend that the buyer have these issues looked at by a professional marine surveyor at the earliest opportunity.

Sincerely,
Marine Surveyor

email_chain.subject: Commission Opportunity: Pakistan - Jeddah Trade
email_chain.body:
Hey Paul,

I received an inquiry regarding potential trade between Pakistan and Jeddah. This person is looking for shipping solutions for various commodities sourced directly from Pakistani manufacturers. They mentioned they can supply fresh fruits, vegetables, meat, and dairy products.

My concern is the viability of running a commission business with someone we don't know. What are your thoughts on the associated risks? Would a solid agreement with the seller adequately protect us?

Could you advise on the best approach? Also, would you be open to connecting with them to explore the meat trade opportunities?

Thanks,
Fardos

email_chain.subject: Re: Commission Opportunity: Pakistan - Jeddah Trade
email_chain.body:
Hi Fardos,

I've had some contact with Mohammed's associate and they seem professional. I'm happy to connect you with the contact in Pakistan so you can assess the potential and negotiate terms directly. The idea of shipping fresh produce from Pakistan to Jeddah, especially during peak seasons (April to September, as they mentioned), could be lucrative.

Given your expertise in the meat business, you might be able to secure favorable deals. The Jeddah market is substantial.

Also, in response to Mohammed's inquiry, I'm exploring vessel options for the 5,000 MT of DAP fertilizer from Karachi to Jeddah next week.

I'll reach out to you via Facebook to facilitate a direct introduction.

Best,
Paul

labels.commodity: DAP Fertilizer, Fresh Produce, Meat, Dairy

email_chain.subject: Regarding Recent Press Coverage of Mr. Abraham
email_chain.body:
Dear Friends,

First of all, I would like to thank everyone who has expressed their concern regarding the recent news that appeared in the press on July 6th concerning Mr. Abraham. The news reports do not accurately reflect the situation, and we have instructed Mr. Abraham's lawyer to take the necessary steps to address the inaccuracies.

The court in New York has issued an interim order prohibiting the publisher from publishing any further articles about Mr. Abraham in any newspapers, magazines, or any other form of publication.

Finally, I wish to thank you all again and to wish you all the best for your holidays.

Yours faithfully,

Mr. Edmund Taylor

email_chain.subject: Statement of Correction Requested: Article on Maurice Abraham
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir,

A recent article in the Irish Examiner by Mr. Eoghan Rice misrepresents the facts regarding the case of Mr. Maurice Abraham, who has been serving time in a U.S. federal prison for the last 5 years.

On July 6th, an article appeared in the Irish Examiner, written by Mr. Eoghan Rice, titled "Abraham wrote of tax fraud after release." The article claims that individuals using the names "H" and "O'Toole" wrote to "The Irish Independent" two weeks before the murder of Stephen Trew in 1998, and that these were the last two letters received from Mr. Abraham.

The article further stated that "It is believed that the Prison Authorities removed Abraham's ability to write when it was discovered that he was planning on writing...". We believe these statements to be inaccurate and request a correction.

Sincerely,
Taylor Law Legal Department

email_chain.subject: Clarification Needed: Article on Maurice Abraham - Potential Inaccuracies
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir,

I would like to point out that some of the information published in the Irish Examiner by Mr. Eoghan Rice regarding the case of Mr. Abraham has not been fully investigated and is, in our view, incorrect and misleading.

Specifically, the July 6th article titled "Abraham wrote of tax fraud after release" claims that individuals using the names "H" and "O'Toole" wrote to "The Irish Independent" two weeks before the murder of Stephen Trew in 1998, and that these were the last two letters received from Mr. Abraham. 

The article further stated that "It is believed that the Prison Authorities removed Abraham's ability to write when it was discovered that he was planning on writing an article regarding tax..."

We request that you review these specific points and provide clarification.

Sincerely,
Taylor Law Legal Department

email_chain.subject: Follow Up: Concerns Regarding Article on Maurice Abraham
email_chain.body:
Dear Sirs,

Following our previous communication, we reiterate our concerns that some of the information published in the Irish Examiner by Mr. Eoghan Rice regarding the case of Mr. Abraham has not been fully investigated and is, in our view, incorrect and misleading.

We refer specifically to the July 6th article titled "Abraham wrote of tax fraud after release." The article claims that individuals using the names "H" and "O'Toole" wrote to "The Irish Independent" two weeks before the murder of Stephen Trew in 1998, and that these were the last two letters received from Mr. Abraham. 

The article further stated that "It is believed that the Prison Authorities removed Abraham's ability to write when it was discovered that he was planning on writing an article regarding tax..."

We await your response.

Sincerely,
Taylor Law Legal Department

email_chain.subject: Freight Quote Request - Cargo Shipment
email_chain.body:
Greetings,

We have a cargo requirement of [Cargo Size] MT of [Commodity] from [Load Port] to [Discharge Port]. Could you please provide your best freight estimate for this shipment?

Will you charge any additional fees if we miss the laycan?

Kind regards,
[Sender Name]

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote Request - Cargo Shipment
email_chain.body:
Hello [Sender Name],

Unfortunately, we are experiencing a delay with your shipment. We were not initially provided with all the necessary documentation when the cargo arrived.

With this information, we would like to inform you that:

We are releasing the container (we will provide you with the B/L number and a copy of the B/L shortly) within 5 business days.

After this period, if the cargo is not picked up, it will be considered abandoned and subject to re-shipment as new cargo, which would incur additional charges.

The revised Estimated Time of Arrival (ETA) is October [Day], 2017.

We will send a re-booking confirmation to your agent to inspect and release the cargo once available.

Since there is currently no confirmed pick-up date from your carrier, we request your carrier to remain available at the station until the revised ETA. 

If your carrier is unable to wait, we can arrange for storage until the cargo's arrival. However, storage fees would apply.

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Oil Field Chemicals - Fos-sur-Mer

Dear Lina,

Thank you for your inquiry. 

Our forwarders in Marseille will collect the shipment directly at the port and handle the paperwork, as soon as we can provide them with all the relevant information. Marine Dubois

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Oil Field Chemicals - Fos-sur-Mer
email_chain.body:

Best regards,
Lina Rossi

email_chain.subject: RE: Inquiry for Oil Field Chemicals - Fos-sur-Mer - D6 Propylene Glycol Specifications
email_chain.body:
Dear Marine,

I hope you are well.

Regarding the KEPHNIT D6 Propylene Glycol, could you please confirm its availability? We need to verify if it matches our required specifications. The relevant substance list is on page 13 of the attached annex (GSO 3 document - previously submitted). The data sheets are on pages 14 and 15. We require an electronic version of these documents.

Is there any possible substitution for this product? Could you please provide the CAS number for KEPHNIT D6 Propylene Glycol?

If possible, could you send us an official quote? If not, please provide a timeframe for when we can expect one.

Thank you very much for your time and support. We are looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards,
Lina Rossi

email_chain.subject: RE: Inquiry for Oil Field Chemicals - Fos-sur-Mer - D6 Propylene Glycol Specifications
email_chain.body:
Dear Lina,

Thank you for your reply. We've received confirmation that the KEPHNIT D6 Propylene Glycol meets the standards of GSO 3 (page 13 of the document previously submitted). Would you need this confirmation in a specific format, or is the letter addressed to GSO sufficient?

Do you have the D6 Propylene Glycol in stock, or can you provide an estimated delivery date from the producer? Are there any substitutes available? If yes, could you please provide the name of the alternative product?

Regarding the official quote, could you please confirm when you can provide it?

Thank you very much for your time and support. We are looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards,
Marine Dubois

email_chain.subject: Charter Inquiry: Manila to Lagos - 6,000 MT Rice
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. García,

Our customer is interested in chartering a medium-sized vessel to ship 6,000 MT of rice from Manila to Lagos. Could you please provide a sample contract with your typical terms and conditions for review?

Thank you,

Hector Lopez

email_chain.subject: Urgent Request: Seeking Reliable Ship Broker - Greece to Rotterdam
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir/Madam,

I am writing to request your assistance in finding a reliable ship broker. I recently came across Voyaca.com and believe you might be able to help me with an urgent shipping matter.

A few years ago, I had a very negative experience with a ship broker from Thomas Hopkin & Co named Brian Hopkin. He brokered a vessel to ship produce from Panama to the West Coast of the USA. The vessel unfortunately ran aground and was a total loss. I subsequently discovered that Brian had misrepresented the ship owner and potentially engaged in fraudulent insurance practices related to the cargo loss. My company is still attempting to recover costs from that incident.

Could you assist me in finding a reputable ship broker to arrange a shipment of goods from Greece to Rotterdam? I require someone who can advise on the best route, avoid legal and insurance pitfalls, and ensure my company is adequately protected against potential mishaps and liabilities.

Thank you in advance for your assistance.

Best regards,

Cieran O'Brien

email_chain.subject: Re: Charter Inquiry: Manila to Lagos / Ship Broker Request
email_chain.body:
Hello Hector and Cieran,

Thank you for your enquiries.

Please find attached a draft of our standard Charter Party Terms & Conditions. We can tailor this to your specific requirements for the Manila to Lagos shipment.

Cieran, regarding your request for a broker, I would suggest contacting a specialist Ship Insurance broker. They can assess your risks and arrange appropriate coverage, especially considering your previous unfortunate experience.

Regards,

Miquel Garcia

labels.vessel: Medium-sized (for Manila to Lagos), Unknown (Panama to USA)

email_chain.subject: Email Composition Instructions
email_chain.body: 1) The email should be in the same style as emails A and B. 2) The opening greeting must be in French. 3) You will be asked to email both Marine Manager of Glencore and a Marine Broker, even though they are both based in the same office (in this case, a major city in China) 4) Your lead is 10,000 MT of Ammonium Sulphate and you are looking at another 30,000 MT of Fertilizer from Damietta to Qingdao. 5) The shipping line is a local line, named “China Ocean Shipping Company Limited” but nicknamed COSCO. 6) Please complete the email with an appropriate response (answers are provided below). 7) The English translation of the French greeting is “Dear Mr./Mrs. So-and-so”. Answer to 1)

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: Ammonium Sulphate & Fertilizer - Damietta to Qingdao

Thank you for your time and consideration.

Kind Regards,

Firstname Surname

Glencore International AG

Mr Firstname, the Marine Manager of Glencore, is the manager of the company I work for, Glencore, which specializes in the business of importing and exporting from various ports across the world.

The conference will focus on recent developments

email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Smith,

My company is ready to purchase 4,500MT of cocoa powder and ship it from São Paulo to Vancouver. Would it be possible to have the ship make a stop at one of our cocoa processing plants in New York to unload a portion of the cargo?

I look forward to hearing from you soon.

Sincerely,
Steve

email_chain.subject: Re: Cocoa Powder Shipment Request - São Paulo to Vancouver
email_chain.body:
Dear Steve,

We would be happy to pick up your cargo in São Paulo as indicated. To assess the feasibility of a stop in New York, could you please let us know the approximate quantity you'd like to unload there?

Also, when would you like to begin the booking process?

We look forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards,
Sally

email_chain.subject: Re: Cocoa Powder Shipment Request - São Paulo to Vancouver
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Jones,

As discussed, our factory in New York will accept approximately 1,500MT of the cargo. We are looking forward to receiving confirmation on the feasibility of this arrangement.

I will call you later this afternoon to discuss the matter further.

Regards,
Steve

email_chain.subject: Delivery Schedule Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Jones,

Following our call, I'm writing to confirm the schedule for the delivery in São Paulo. The vessel will arrive at the designated pick-up location on Thursday at 10 am. I trust you have received all the necessary paperwork, as mentioned in our previous correspondence.

Best,
Steve

email_chain.subject: Cargo Arrival Confirmation - New York
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Jones,

I'm happy to confirm that the 1,500MT of cocoa powder destined for New York has arrived at our facility and is safely stored at our dock. We have arranged for a team to meet the truck to transport the cargo to our processing plant at 12:30 pm tomorrow. Could you let me know if this time is convenient for your team?

Steve

email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Smith,

We are writing to confirm the pickup of the cocoa powder tomorrow. However, we've encountered a minor logistical issue in our New York warehouse. We were hoping to postpone the pickup to Monday at 10 am. Would this be feasible for you?

Thank you for understanding.

Sincerely,
Sally

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Arrival Confirmation - New York - Potential Delay
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Jones,

We will be more than happy to accommodate your revised schedule. Monday at 10 am works perfectly for us. We are looking forward to having the cocoa powder at our plant soon.

Best regards,
Steve

email_chain.body:

Our truck will be ready for pick up at 9 am tomorrow. Could you please provide the specific address or loading dock location for the cocoa powder pick up at your New York facility?

Steve

email_chain.subject: Following Up
email_chain.body:

Just following up on my previous email regarding the pick-up location. We are looking forward to hearing from you.

Sincerely,
Steve

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: Vessel for 1600MT Toasters - Plymouth to Rotterdam
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Green,

Could you please provide a quote for a vessel to carry 1,600 MT of toasters from Plymouth, UK to Rotterdam, Netherlands? We are looking for a vessel available to load around November 12th. 

Also, could you provide information on weekly demurrage rates?

Sincerely,
Renée

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Vessel for 1600MT Toasters - Plymouth to Rotterdam
email_chain.body:
Dear Renée,

Thank you for your inquiry. 

The estimated transit time from Plymouth to Rotterdam is approximately 10 days. Our initial quote is US$600.

Early loading in Plymouth is possible. However, please be aware that your buyer might incur demurrage charges if the vessel arrives early in Rotterdam and is unable to discharge promptly.

The weekly demurrage rate is US$100, and storage is US$25 per day.

Please let me know if this information is helpful and if you would like me to proceed with securing a vessel. 

Thanks,
Sam

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Vessel for 1600MT Toasters - Plymouth to Rotterdam
email_chain.body:
Dear Sam,

Thank you for the information. 

We need the vessel to be loaded by November 6th. Please send a proforma invoice to my boss by November 3rd so we can approve payment. This will also give us time to book space on an alternative vessel if your rates don't align with our budget.

Please let me know if you have any questions.

Thanks,
Renée

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Vessel for 1600MT Toasters - Plymouth to Rotterdam
email_chain.body:
Dear Renée,

Thank you for the quick reply. 

To confirm, you need the vessel loaded by November 6th, and require a proforma invoice by November 3rd.

I will work on getting this to you by the requested date.

Please let me know if you have any other questions. 

Thanks,
Sam

email_chain.subject: Potential Acquisition Opportunity
email_chain.body:
Rob,

We are interested in exploring a potential acquisition of your company. To begin our due diligence process, please send us your company's bank account information for verification purposes at your earliest convenience.

Jorge

email_chain.subject: Re: Potential Acquisition Opportunity - A Little Game
email_chain.body:
Jorge,

What are your favorite movies? What are your favorite web sites? Do you live alone? Have you ever dated someone older than you? Are you a cat or a dog person? Do you prefer chicken or beef? Have you ever used an online dating service? What is your favorite color? What kind of music do you like?

Disregard the actual questions; focus on the pattern.

So, can you tell me what they have in common?

Answer : they have the word LOVE in common

email_chain.subject: Re: Potential Acquisition Opportunity - Further clarification on the questions
email_chain.body:
*To the LOVE of my life,,
*may our life be filled with LOVE,,
*We shall find each other soon enough,,
*remember how it felt to be young,,
*and listen to love songs with me on the radio,,
*I don't know why we keep walking the same road,,
*our little room is very spacious,,
*our family will be,,
*sending their regards,,
*I hope you'll be happy with me,,
*It's getting more & more difficult,,
*our physical distance,,
*How can I still not hold you,,
*my beloved that's how we say,,
*I have an appointment with you,,
*I hope to keep my appointment with you,,
*But if that is not possible,,
*I still love you,,
*hope you are doing fine
*

email_chain.subject: Rate Request: Rotterdam to Antwerp Dry Cargo
email_chain.body:
Hi Fred,

I'm looking to ship some dry cargo from Rotterdam to Antwerp. If you can provide me with a competitive rate, I'll give you the business.

Thanks,
Eric

email_chain.subject: Re: Rate Request: Rotterdam to Antwerp Dry Cargo
email_chain.body:
Hi Fred,

Following up on my previous email, I've done some initial research. I've found a forwarder in Antwerp who can provide a quote.

If you'd like, I can share their contact information and a summary of the shipment details so you can send them a rate directly. Alternatively, I can connect you with our Rotterdam sales contact who might be able to assist you directly with your own quote.

Let me know which option works best for you.

Thanks,
Eric

email_chain.subject: Re: Rate Request: Rotterdam to Antwerp Dry Cargo - Antwerp Sales Rep Contact
email_chain.body:
Hi Fred,

Here's a link to our Antwerp Sales Representative: http://bit.ly/Antwerp-Sales-Rep

Feel free to contact them directly at +31 62776XXXX. They can help you with obtaining a rate.

Thanks,
Eric

email_chain.subject: Dry Cargo Rotterdam to Antwerp - Rate Inquiry
email_chain.body:

My name is Joe, and I'm responsible for shipping for Rob's division. Eric suggested I contact you.

If you have a rate you'd be willing to offer for dry cargo from Rotterdam to Antwerp, I'd be happy to consider your quote.

Joe
