email_chain.subject: Quotation for Granulated Sugar Delivery - Los Angeles to Seattle
email_chain.body:
Dear John,

Please find attached a quotation for the delivery of 4,500 MT of granulated sugar from Los Angeles to Seattle.

Our payment terms require a 30% advance payment of the total value, with the remaining balance due against presentation of the Bill of Lading (B/L). We require the initial 30% to be transferred via bank-to-bank transfer within three working days of the date of this offer.

Should you require any further details, please do not hesitate to contact me.

Yours sincerely,
Frank

email_chain.subject: RE: Quotation for Granulated Sugar Delivery - Los Angeles to Seattle
email_chain.body:
Dear Frank,

Thank you for your prompt response and the attached quotation. We are pleased to consider your services.

I want to confirm that the price of granulated sugar in Los Angeles is $2,600/MT and that our credit terms are a 30% deposit with the remaining 70% payable on sight against the bill of lading.

My colleague, George, is ready to finalize a formal contract and schedule the vessel upon agreement.

Looking forward to your confirmation.

Yours sincerely,
John

email_chain.subject: RE: Quotation for Granulated Sugar Delivery - Los Angeles to Seattle
email_chain.body:
Hi Frank,

Thanks for letting me know. Could you explain the insurance coverage in more detail?

Also, is there any flexibility in the payment terms? Would it be possible to pay 30% upfront and the remaining 70% upon loading of the vessel?

Best regards,
Kelsey

email_chain.subject: RE: Quotation for Granulated Sugar Delivery - Los Angeles to Seattle
email_chain.body:
Hello Kelsey,

Thank you for your email. Regarding the insurance details, please refer to section 5 of the attached quotation. If you require further clarification after reviewing that section, please let me know.

Regarding the payment terms, we are unable to change them at this time. The remaining 70% is due against presentation of the Bill of Lading.

Best regards,
Frank

email_chain.subject: RE: Quotation for Granulated Sugar Delivery - Los Angeles to Seattle
email_chain.body:
Dear Frank,

Thank you for clarifying the insurance and payment terms. As these details have already been discussed and are acceptable, we will proceed with the bank-to-bank transfer for the 30% deposit.

We look forward to doing business with you.

Regards,
Kelsey

email_chain.subject: MEG Inquiry - Houston to Oslo
email_chain.body:
Hi Alex,

My buyer here in Oslo needs 600 MT of MEG from Houston. Could you please give me a rate estimate for a spot voyage and advise on the signing of a charter party?

Cheers,
Kristina

email_chain.subject: Re: MEG Inquiry - Houston to Oslo
email_chain.body:
Hi Kristina,

Currently, the freight is in the $90s/ton (FOB NOLA). Rates are firm at this level due to limited tonnage availability. Given the port congestion in Houston, we would prefer to finalize the deal before signing the charter party. However, if the charter party includes a destination clause, we can sign it upon final confirmation of the cargo.

Regards,
Alex

email_chain.subject: Re: MEG Inquiry - Houston to Oslo
email_chain.body:
Hi Alex,

Understood. For our internal budgeting purposes, we're calculating based on Norwegian Krone (NOK). Therefore, based on the current exchange rate, our target price is approximately NOK 3,300,000 per MT (FOB NOLA).

A charter party can be drawn up to cover our terms. Also, if the MEG should arrive a bit early, we could potentially arrange for storage until we need it.

Best,
Kristina

email_chain.subject: MEG Shipment Comparison - Singapore vs. Your Quote
email_chain.body:
Hello Alex,

I received a FOB quotation from a Singaporean trader today, and I'd like to compare it to your estimate. The details are as follows:

12,000 MT of MEG FOB NOLA (delivery within 2 weeks).
Price: NOK 3,300,000/MT
Total FOB Price (in USD): USD 3,300,000
Estimated delivery cost: USD 20,000
Charter party fee: USD 200,000
Insurance: USD 350,000
Total: USD 3,870,000

The price includes a destination clause: "Bill of Lading to be issued 'Norwegian ports only'". So, how does your rate compare?

Best,
Kristina

P.S. A colleague mentioned that the port congestion in Houston is partly due to the aftermath of Hurricane Gustav.

email_chain.body:

Thanks,

Marco

email_chain.subject: Re: <SHIP NAME> – Grangemouth Slot
email_chain.body:
Dear Marco,

We are delighted to be able to offer the following slot for <SHIP NAME>’s voyage into Grangemouth:

Ship: <SHIP NAME>
IMDG No.: 2287

ETA Grangemouth: 21:00 (19/08/2020)

email_chain.subject: Re: <SHIP NAME> – Grangemouth Slot
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Barlow,

Could you confirm the slot booking for the next voyage? Also, I would like to discuss the appointment time and duration for the visit.

Marco

email_chain.subject: Re: <SHIP NAME> - Grangemouth Details
email_chain.body:
Thank you for your message.

Apologies for not replying earlier. I have just returned from 3 months leave.

This vessel would be loaded with Polymers and Visco polymer. Generally, the cargo would take up the whole of the space; however, as I mentioned earlier, we will accommodate smaller-sized cargo if this is possible.

Best regards,

Tony

email_chain.subject: Re: <SHIP NAME> - Grangemouth Details
email_chain.body:
Hello Tony,

Are you able to advise your normal laycan for this vessel? And your normal berth use? Is this vessel restricted to cranes that can handle 50 metric tonnes?

Many thanks

email_chain.subject: Re: <SHIP NAME> - Grangemouth Details
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Tosco,

Laycan-wise, this vessel is always flexible and will try to accommodate as much as possible. Berths are not usually allocated until 24 hrs prior to arrival (24-30hrs before, more so during peak season).

50 MT cranes are usually ok with any cargo carried on board.

Best regards,

Anthony

email_chain.subject: Re: <SHIP NAME> - Grangemouth Details - Laycan request
email_chain.body:
Hi Tony,

I have just received a request from other parties for a laycan between 19th and 25th August, within the same slot. I do not know who they are; they are represented by their broker only. Could I have a better laycan so we can satisfy them as well?

email_chain.subject: Re: <SHIP NAME> - Grangemouth Details - Revised Laycan
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Tosco,

This vessel will stay within laycan 14-19 August and will not change berth at Grangemouth.

Best regards,

Anthony

email_chain.subject: Re: Space offer - Grangemouth - POL Cargo
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Rook,

Thank you for the kind offer.

Some clarification is required on your kind offer:
1.  If you confirm the number of cubic meters that can be loaded. Maximum POL volume is 4900 cbm.
2.  If we load the full volume, how much POL can be loaded.
3.  How many cubic meters of POL can be loaded in the forward (viscopol) hold.
4.  If POL can be loaded, how much can be loaded.

Please confirm the following information:

1.  MCT: 40 tons
2.  Lead time to build a POL hatch: 24 hours from confirmation
3.  Access to MOORFIX for our inspection: pending on availability of the terminal

email_chain.subject: Bunkering Fuel Options

Hey there,

Kind regards,
Bridget

email_chain.subject: Freight Inquiry: Hamburg to Tehran
email_chain.body:
Hello Ms. Elsner,

Could you provide a 1,500 MT cargo of freight from Hamburg to Tehran before June 14th? Please share your typical demurrage and dispatch rates for that route.

Thanks,
Serafina Bianchi

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry: Hamburg to Tehran
email_chain.body:
Dear Serafina,

Thank you for your inquiry. We currently have limited direct capacity from Hamburg to Tehran. However, we have a vessel arriving in Hamburg from Manila that will then be proceeding to Istanbul on May 31st (ETERNAL DREAM). From Istanbul, we could potentially transfer your cargo to our vessel METAPHYSICS, which travels to Ahvaz with one stop en route, and then on to Tehran with another stop en route. This is dependent on available space after our Istanbul stop.

Our typical demurrage rate is $750 per 20' container, and our dispatch rate is $500 per 20' container.

Please let me know if this is an acceptable alternative.

Thank you,
Johann Elsner

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry: Hamburg to Tehran
email_chain.body:
Dear Johann,

Thank you for your offer, but the proposed route via Istanbul and Ahvaz is not suitable for our needs. We require a direct shipment from Hamburg to Tehran. Please let me know if you can accommodate this.

Thank you!
Serafina Bianchi

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry: Hamburg to Tehran
email_chain.body:
Dear Serafina,

Understood. We can transport the cargo to Istanbul with one stop on arrival. We have vessel ETERNAL DREAM departing from Hamburg to Istanbul on May 31st. We can then transfer your cargo from Istanbul to Ahvaz on our vessel METAPHYSICS, then proceed via Ahvaz to Tehran with one stop on arrival.

Thank you,
Johann Elsner

John.

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Tungsten Carbide Buttons - Bahrain
email_chain.body:

Could you please provide your best rate for supplying one thousand units of yellow tungsten carbide buttons to Bahrain on a CFR basis?

Kind regards,

Jacob Miller

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Tungsten Carbide Buttons - Bahrain
email_chain.body:
Dear Jacob,

Please see my company information below. I hope this is helpful.

Company: Spectra Corp
Tel.: +962-6-56XXXXXX
Mobile: +962-7-9XXXXXXX
Fax: +962-6-56XXXXXX

While we have a production facility in Bahrain, our exports are handled from Jordan. We typically export between 50 and 150 kg monthly. If you are interested in this quantity, I can provide an offer based on your budget and arrange shipment from Bahrain.

Regards,
Nevens

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Tungsten Carbide Buttons - Bahrain - Company Overview
email_chain.body:
Dear Jacob,

Spectra is an Amman-based importer and distributor of mining chemicals. Some of the product names we supply are CŁpim™ 41 (75% Sodium Cyanide), Satyam M3, Kengal ® M, TMAA (Tris (Methylamine) Ammonium Amines), DCTA (Diethylene Triamine Pentaacetic Acid), and Hexamine.

Most of our products are imported from Europe and supplied in bulk drums (50kg or 125kg) and in drums, jerry cans, and pouches for various end-user industries.

We also supply chemicals in bulk or tanker loads to other businesses and institutions that require their own specialized packaging and blending.

Our warehouse and offices are located in the Abdali area in Amman, within a 20-minute drive of both Queen Alia International Airport and King Hussein Bridge.

Regards,
Nevens

email_chain.subject: Base Oil Inquiry - Falmouth to Port Kembla
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Raith,

Following our phone conversation, we are interested in purchasing 12,500 MT of Base Oil for shipment from Falmouth to Port Kembla. Could you please provide a firm offer, including a full laycan?

Many thanks,

Hector Taylor

email_chain.subject: RE: Base Oil Inquiry - Falmouth to Port Kembla
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Raith,

I am writing to follow up on my previous email. We have received two offers for the Base Oil shipment from Falmouth to Port Kembla, both freight inclusive. Could you please clarify whether you prefer a FOB (Free On Board) or CIF (Cost, Insurance, and Freight) offer?

Many thanks,

Hector Taylor

email_chain.subject: RE: Base Oil Inquiry - Falmouth to Port Kembla
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Taylor,

Regarding your previous inquiry for the shipment of 12,500MT of base oil from Falmouth to Port Kembla.

We would be grateful if you could advise your quotation in the following manner:

1.  Name of the base grade:
2.  Quantity of the base grade:
3.  Basis of the quotation (FOB or CIF):
4.  Delivery period:
5.  Freight exclusive or inclusive:
6.  Details regarding MOA (Methanol-to-Olefins), HBA (Heavy Bottom Assay), and BAF (Bunker Adjustment Factor) - are these included in freight or quoted separately?
7.  Special terms and conditions (such as minimum annual contract volume, terms of payment, conditions of delay, etc)

Looking forward to your reply.

Regards,

Hannah Nair

email_chain.subject: RE: Base Oil Inquiry - Falmouth to Port Kembla
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Nair,

After speaking with our customer, they require a confirmation of laycan (Laydays Cancelling). They are looking for the following potential loading windows:

01 July, 15 August, 15 October, 15 December, 15 February, 15 April, 15 June, 15 August, 15 October.

The laycan dates are quite strict. No dates prior to the 1st of the month or after the 15th of the month in question will be accepted.

Can you advise if these dates will be acceptable?

Thanks,
Hector Taylor

email_chain.subject: RE: Base Oil Inquiry - Falmouth to Port Kembla - Laycan Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Taylor,

Thank you for the laycan information.

Please confirm whether the freight includes the BAF (Bunker Adjustment Factor), and if it is invoiced to the buyer monthly.

It would also be helpful if you could advise:

1.  Whether the load will be ready for lifting on 15th August (of which year)?
2.  Your Incoterms?

Looking forward to your reply.

Regards,

Hannah Nair

email_chain.subject: Base Oil Transaction - Terms and Conditions
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Taylor,

Thank you for your enquiry regarding base oil.

Please find attached our terms and conditions relating to the base oil transaction.

We await your comments.

Yours sincerely,

Brian

email_chain.subject: Iron Ore Shipment - Tianjin to Port Hedland
email_chain.body:
Mr. Li,

We plan to load approximately 2,000 MT of iron ore from Tianjin to Port Hedland next month. Could you please confirm your vessel position and berth availability at Port Hedland around that time?

Thanks,
Charlie

email_chain.subject: RE: Iron Ore Shipment - Tianjin to Port Hedland
email_chain.body:
Dear Charlie,

Thank you for your email. Regarding the iron ore discharge at Port Hedland, our yard is typically quite busy with steel sheet during that time of year. To help us assess berth availability, could you please provide a firm deadline for your vessel's arrival?

Best regards,
Tom

email_chain.subject: RE: Iron Ore Shipment - Tianjin to Port Hedland
email_chain.body:
Dear Charlie,

We are experiencing some congestion at the Port Hedland dock with vessels awaiting berthing. If a berth becomes available for your vessel, our shipowners are proposing a freight rate of USD 1.00/MT. They are also requesting extended payment terms of 60 days. Your advice on whether this is acceptable would be greatly appreciated.

Best regards,
Tom

email_chain.subject: RE: Iron Ore Shipment - Tianjin to Port Hedland
email_chain.body:
Dear Tom,

Our cargo loading is on schedule, and the loading port is planning to allocate a vessel berth to us as planned. Regarding the USD 1.00/MT freight rate, could you confirm if 'steel sheet is in the iron ore range'? We need to clarify this with the load port as it may affect their handling procedures.

email_chain.subject: RE: Iron Ore Shipment - Tianjin to Port Hedland
email_chain.body:
Dear Tom,

Following discussions with our shipowners, they have only agreed to a slight increase in the contract price of USD 0.10/MT. Could you please pass this counteroffer on to your shipowner? Also, we are still awaiting confirmation on whether the steel sheet falls within the iron ore range. We need to confirm this detail with the loading port to ensure appropriate handling.

email_chain.subject: RE: Iron Ore Shipment - Tianjin to Port Hedland
email_chain.body:
Dear Tom,

We accept your offer of USD 1.00/MT and the 60-day payment terms. Could you please provide and sign the Letter of Indemnity for our shipowners? Furthermore, our commercial team at the loading port has confirmed that the steel sheet is considered within the iron ore range, so no special handling is needed.

email_chain.subject: RE: Iron Ore Shipment - Tianjin to Port Hedland
email_chain.body:
Dear Charlie,

Great to hear! Just to confirm, our shipowners have agreed to offer the price of USD 1.00/MT with extended payment terms of 60 days. Please provide a signed Letter of Indemnity and the indemnity agreement for our shipowners at your earliest convenience.

Best regards,
Tom

email_chain.subject: RE: Iron Ore Shipment - Tianjin to Port Hedland
email_chain.body:
Dear Tom,

Please let us know if we have reached a final agreement on all points.

email_chain.subject: RE: Iron Ore Shipment - Tianjin to Port Hedland
email_chain.body:
Dear Tom,

We have prepared all the necessary documents and are sending them to you via courier today. Could you please confirm that you are expecting the delivery?

email_chain.subject: Freight Inquiry: 3,300MT Lubricants - Genoa to Haifa
email_chain.body:
Dear Charlene,

Thank you so much for taking the time to reply.

What I’m looking for is a fixed rate from Genoa to Haifa for 3,300MT of lubricants for delivery on 22 June. I had hoped to receive an offer before the end of the day yesterday, but the best offer I’ve received so far is a rate of US$80 per MT from WFS Energy and this was only received this morning.

I’ve heard a lot about your brokerage, and it would be great to work with your company, so I look forward to hearing your best offer.

Kind regards,

Sam Montgomery
Group Procurement Manager
John Robb Ltd

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry: 3,300MT Lubricants - Genoa to Haifa
email_chain.body:
Hi Sam,

Thank you for your email. To clarify the requirements, can you please confirm the following?

1.  Main cargo: lubricants
2.  Loading date: 21 June, but we can probably accept a few days either side of that.
3.  Discharge date: no earlier than 22 June.
4.  Trade: Genoa to Haifa.
5.  Vessel size: What range of vessels are you considering?
6.  Is there any flexibility in the loading port or discharge port?
7.  Bunker date flexibility: What are your preferred ranges?

Thanks,

Justine Smith
Vessel Procurement
Bolla Ltd

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry: 3,300MT Lubricants - Genoa to Haifa
email_chain.body:
Hi Justine,

Thank you for your email. I can confirm the following.

1. The main cargo is lubricants.
2. I can accept a loading date of 21 June.
3. The discharge date should be no earlier than 22 June.
4. The trade is Genoa to Haifa.
5. I would prefer a vessel that is no larger than 25,000 DWT.
6. We can be flexible with the loading and discharge ports.
7. The bunker date is 22 June.

Kind regards,

Sam Montgomery

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry: 3,300MT Lubricants - Genoa to Haifa
email_chain.body:
Hi Sam,

Thank you for your reply.

In that case, we would like to offer our client US$90 per MT for a bunker date of 22 June for a voyage from Genoa to Haifa.

Kind regards,
Justine Smith
Vessel Procurement
Bolla Ltd

email_chain.body:

Our port fees are as follows (per container, assuming standard sized containers):

1.  Security: $50 USD
2.  Terminal Handling: $150 USD

Krystyna

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: 200,000 MT MGO Shipment from Gijon to Japan
email_chain.body:
Hello Capt. Hu,

We are organizing a potential shipment of 200,000 MT of MGO from Gijon, Spain, to Japan. Given the large volume, we'd appreciate your insights.

In your opinion, are suppliers generally capable of fulfilling such a large order? Also, what would be a reasonable estimate for the loading time?

Many thanks,
Timothy

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: 200,000 MT MGO Shipment from Gijon to Japan
email_chain.body:
Dear Tim,

Thanks for your inquiry. While we haven't personally supplied a single order of that magnitude (200,000 MT MGO), our parent company has supplied 100,000 MT+ quantities to major trading companies previously, indicating the capability exists.

Loading time is negotiable between the supplier and buyer, depending on their facilities and available infrastructure. We typically provide shipping documents within 10-12 days of shipment and request payment in cash 4 weeks later. The buyer is responsible for the bank documentary charges within 2 weeks of the shipment date.

The primary challenge will be identifying a supplier capable of delivering this quantity in one go. You might consider splitting the order into two shipments of approximately 100,000 MT each.

Best regards,
Capt. Hu

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: 200,000 MT MGO Shipment from Gijon to Japan - Further Considerations
email_chain.body:
Dear Tim,

Following up on my previous email, I've just confirmed that the delivery vessel we were considering has a capacity limit of 130,000 MT. Therefore, two vessels would indeed be required. Splitting the order into two 100,000 MT shipments, as previously suggested, would align well with available vessel capacity.

There are numerous vessels available that can accommodate this cargo volume. The average delivery time for this type of shipment is approximately 45 days, though this can vary depending on the vessel's route and speed.

Shipping costs can range from USD 10 to USD 20 per MT, influenced by the size of the vessel, the chosen route, and the overall distance.

In summary, splitting the order into two shipments of around 100,000 MT each appears to be the most practical approach.

Best regards,
Capt. Hu

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: 200,000 MT MGO Shipment from Gijon to Japan - Supplier and Transport Options
email_chain.body:
Dear Tim,

Further to our discussion, I wanted to provide some guidance on locating suppliers and transportation companies for this shipment.

A good starting point for finding a supplier is to contact local trade associations or trade missions in your area. They can help identify local suppliers or refer you to relevant organizations in Japan if a local option isn't available.

Several types of vessels are suitable for this cargo, including bulk carriers, tankers, container ships, and Ro-Ro (Roll-on/Roll-off) vessels. Each type has specific advantages and disadvantages, which should be considered based on your needs.

The most common route is indeed from Europe to Japan. The distance is roughly 7,000 nautical miles, and the voyage can take around 30 days, depending on vessel speed and weather conditions.

Best regards,
Capt. Hu

email_chain.subject: Hamburg/Aarhus Fixture
email_chain.body:
Hi David,

Let’s assume our 4,500 MT fixture from Hamburg to Aarhus has settled for a free-out rate of $300/MT. Is that considered an all-in rate then?

Regards,
Robert

email_chain.subject: Re: Hamburg/Aarhus Fixture
email_chain.body:
Dear Robert,

I understand what you're saying. However, while the quotation has settled *with you* for $300/MT, the vessel owner is willing to accept $250/MT directly. This is an option you haven't considered. It's also worth noting if you don't agree to hire directly, they could potentially pay you $300/MT for not fixing with them.

Regards,
David

email_chain.subject: Re: Hamburg/Aarhus Fixture
email_chain.body:
Dear David,

I'm not sure I follow the logic here. 

As I mentioned, I'm not interested in dealing directly with the vessel owner. My position is clear – *our* all-in rate to *you* is $300/MT. If we agree to deal with the vessel owner directly at a lower rate, then *you* won't be paid the agreed $300/MT and that would be unacceptable to me.

Regards,
Robert

email_chain.subject: Re: Hamburg/Aarhus Fixture
email_chain.body:
Dear Robert,

Please reread our previous emails. You've chosen to present this issue in one specific way, but that doesn’t mean it’s the only possibility. You seem to think I'm pushing you to go a particular way. I'm not proposing anything. I’m simply pointing out that you're only considering one approach.

You are aware that the vessel owner is willing to consider different arrangements.

email_chain.subject: Re: Hamburg/Aarhus Fixture
email_chain.body:
Hi Robert,

Again, I'm not proposing anything. I'm not assuming anything. I’m merely stating that you have limited yourself to a certain approach. While this might be legally sound, it's very limiting for business. 

If you're interested, I'd be happy to jump on a call with you to talk through this in more detail.

Cheers,
David

Refinery Purchasing Department
Marseille Oil

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: Space Availability for Chemical Shipments - Shanghai to Colombo
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir/Madam,

We are seeking space for the shipment of the following commodities and would like to consolidate them for a single shipment from Shanghai to Colombo (approximately 20,000 MT total):

*   12,000 MT PS Foam Pellets
*   10,000 MT Diethylene Glycol
*   1,000 MT PTA
*   2,000 MT EVA
*   12,000 MT Benzyl Benzoate

Could you advise if you have availability or are aware of any competitors with suitable space? Thank you.

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Space Availability for Chemical Shipments - Shanghai to Colombo
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir/Madam,

Yes, we can likely provide the space for the movement of the commodities you mentioned. We are in the process of launching a new weekly service for the Middle East to Africa market. Could you please send me a copy of your updated shipping schedule so I can review it more closely?

Also, you might consider posting details of your requirements on relevant shipping mailing lists for wider visibility.

Regards,

Shah

email_chain.subject: RE: Inquiry: Space Availability for Chemical Shipments - Shanghai to Colombo
email_chain.body:
Dear Shah,

Thank you for your email. Please find attached our weekly schedule, commencing 2001-09-14. Please review and advise if you are able to assist us with any of the cargoes mentioned in our initial email.

Thanks & Regards,

M. Alagappan
Nexus Logistics
99 Havelock Road
Singapore 161990
Email: alagappan@nexuslogistics.com.sg
Fax: +65 6221 0226
Tel: +65 6221 0220

email_chain.subject: RE: Inquiry: Space Availability for Chemical Shipments - Shanghai to Colombo
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Alagappan,

Thank you for the schedule. Currently, we are handling the following movements, which may overlap with your needs:

*   Bangkok to Dhaka: 12,000 MT PS Foam Pellets
*   Dhaka to Mersin: 12,000 MT PS Foam Pellets
*   Mersin to Abu Dhabi: 10,000 MT Diethylene Glycol
*   Abu Dhabi to Alexandria: 2,000 MT PTA
*   Mombasa to Freetown: 10,000 MT EVA
*   Alexandria to Lagos: 12,000 MT Benzyl Benzoate

We do have available space and capacity for your shipments. Please advise on your specific space requirements for the Shanghai to Colombo route, and provide your target freight rate for these shipments. We look forward to hearing from you.

Regards,

Shah

email_chain.subject: Fenn Treasure Clues - A Possible Solution
email_chain.body:
Billionaire Fenn has not changed any of the 9 clues in the poem since 1990 except for the 5 clues in the ninth line.

Is the 9th Line a "trick question" code?

How can you figure out which of the remaining clues in the poem you need to use to decipher the remaining 2 lines?

No One Except Captain Nemo has ALL the answers to these 3 questions.

Note: If you know the answer to the 9th line, you can find the exit right now without a single travel clue.

email_chain.subject: A special $10 million stash Fenn allegedly buried in the Rocky Mountains—and why you might never get to find it.
email_chain.body:
Hello Felicia,

I just watched the Hidden Cash series on Netflix, and had to reach out to you. I believe there is a $10 million stash in the Rocky Mountains and I just found the clue to it in the Netflix series. To find the treasure, you must go to Wyoming and take a hike to the summit of the mountain on March 14, and find a rock with a spider web and a spider on it. There is a chunk of stone with the date 2014, then there is a map that was drawn by the Aboriginals in a nearby valley that shows where to go next. It is approximately 2 [units missing].

email_chain.subject: Re: Crude Oil Shipment Inquiry - New Orleans to Puerto Bolivar
email_chain.body:
Dear Felicia,

It's not often we receive inquiries about bunkering. While we don't offer bunkering services directly at our New Orleans terminal, we can potentially facilitate arrangements via our St. Johns, Florida terminal, which is along your route.  If you're interested in making a stop there, let me know and I can provide rates.

Regarding your demurrage question, our standard rate is [insert currency symbol] X per day or pro-rata.

Sincerely,
Alfred Fennell

email_chain.subject: Re: Fenn Treasure Clues - A Possible Solution
email_chain.body:
I will not confirm or deny that the above is related to any TATF clues. I will simply say that your well-constructed TATF clues are, and always have been, your own.

If, in fact, you choose to accept any $10,000,000,000+ treasure, and a check made out to you by the Bounty Board for $10,000,000,000+, be advised that the paperwork includes a clause that neither you nor your heirs can claim any part of that amount again. Upon confirmation by the Bounty Board of your claim, all of it is gone.

Thank you for your interest in my little game.

Mr. Fenn.

email_chain.subject: Re: Crude Oil Shipment Inquiry - New Orleans to Puerto Bolivar
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Fennell,

I want to hear all about the $10,000,000,000 treasure. Where is the Bitcoin miner that has the clues? I also want to know if there is still a $10,000,000,000 ransom payment for finding the $10,000,000,000 Bitcoin that has the clues.

Kind Regards,
Felicia Johnson

email_chain.subject: June Shipment - Dhaka to Tejing - Quick Questions
email_chain.body:
Hey Bruce,

Wondering if you can help with a few quick questions about our June shipment.

We have a 300 MT slot from Dhaka to Tejing on June 13th. When should we expect arrival at Tejing port? Also, what's the daily demurrage rate there?

Thanks!

Alex

email_chain.subject: Re: June Shipment - Dhaka to Tejing - Quick Questions
email_chain.body:
Hi Bruce,

Following up on my previous email. Could you let me know the estimated port arrival time for our June shipment to Tejing? We also need the demurrage rate at Tejing port.

Thanks,
Alex

email_chain.subject: Re: June Shipment - Dhaka to Tejing - Quick Questions
email_chain.body:
Hi Alex,

Thanks for reaching out! Happy to help.

Your container should arrive around June 29th. The demurrage is $500 per day.

As for the exact arrival time, it depends on when your truck arrives at the port and the port's efficiency. Considering the summer heat in China, arriving around 10-11 am might be best.

Let me know if you need anything else!

Best,
Bruce

email_chain.subject: Shipping Inquiry - Dhaka to China
email_chain.body:

We're looking to send more containers from Dhaka to China and exploring the best options. Could you provide information on the process?

I can provide specific shipment details so you can get back to me with estimated rates.

Thanks,
Ibraham
MT Logistics

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Inquiry - Dhaka to China
email_chain.body:
Hi Ibraham,

Thanks for reaching out!

Please let me know the size and location of the shipping, and I'll get back to you with a quote.

Best,
Bruce

email_chain.subject: June Shipment Update
email_chain.body:

Just a quick update on the June shipment. We need it delivered as soon as possible, so I'll be at Tejing port to coordinate the pickup.

Thanks,
Alex

email_chain.subject: Cargo Inquiry - [Cargo] - [Load Port] to [Discharge Port]
email_chain.body:
Dear Jane,

Could you handle a cargo of [Cargo] from [Load Port] to [Discharge Port] sometime in [Period]? 

Also, what would be your demurrage rate after 72 hours of laytime?

Regards,
John Doe

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Inquiry - [Cargo] - [Load Port] to [Discharge Port]
email_chain.body:
Dear John,

Thank you for your inquiry. We are interested in purchasing [Cargo] originating from [Load Port] and discharging at [Discharge Port] for shipment within the next 3 to 4 weeks.

We require you to act as the shipper and holder of the bills of lading, as well as disponent owners of the cargo onboard. Please provide a signed Letter of Indemnity (LOI) and the following information:

(1) LOI Validity: Three weeks.
(2) Basic Rate: Please provide the cost in accordance with the original liner tariff, including any amendment clauses applicable to short sea voyages.
(3) Premium (2nd or 3rd): If any premiums apply, please quote accordingly. If not, please confirm.
(4) Washtrade: If you wish to use our charterer's name and flag in the charterparty, please indicate this.
(5) Voyage details.

Thank you, and we await your prompt reply.

Regards,
Jane Smith

email_chain.subject: Naphtha Shipment - Houston to Santos - Mid June
email_chain.body:
Good morning Mr. Ullrich,

We’re considering a naphtha shipment from Houston to Santos in mid-June. Could you let us know your availability and if there are any opportunities to reduce the time that we’d be subject to demurrage?

Regards,
Alice

email_chain.subject: Re: Naphtha Shipment - Houston to Santos - Mid June
email_chain.body:
Good morning Alice,

The longer you can charter the ship for, the lower the rates will be. We do have several trips scheduled around that time which will include a berth in Santos. I’ll check with the terminal manager there to see what options are available regarding berth availability and potential demurrage reduction.

Best regards,
Michael

email_chain.subject: Re: Naphtha Shipment - Houston to Santos - Mid June
email_chain.body:
Morning Michael,

Thanks very much. And yes, I’m aware the rates are typically higher in June. However, we really need to depart Santos ASAP to make our next charter to the US. We’ll let you know once we’re further along with the prior leg of the trip and can confirm that we can provide the vessel with the right crude grades.

Regards,
Alice

email_chain.subject: Re: Naphtha Shipment - Houston to Santos - Mid June
email_chain.body:
Hi Michael,

Sorry for the delay in response, I was on vacation last week and just got back to the office. Unfortunately, I’m unable to go longer than

email_chain.subject: LPG Shipment Inquiry - Bahrain to Mina Al Ahmadi
email_chain.body:
Hello Adi,

We need a vessel for 6,900 MT of LPG from Bahrain to Mina Al Ahmadi. Our broker, MNTA, will organize the fixtures. Do you accept lumpsum deals?

Regards,

Anwa Duqar

email_chain.subject: Re: LPG Shipment Inquiry - Bahrain to Mina Al Ahmadi
email_chain.body:
Dear Anwa,

Thank you for your query. Kindly find attached our LPG price list for September 2003 (Note: This is a sample price list, and actual prices are subject to change).

Price is FOB.

To provide you with a specific quote, please provide the following details:

1. LPG Composition (e.g., Butane % and Propane %)
2. Quantity (MT)
3. Point of Discharge
4. Preferred Shipment Date/Month
5. Fixing Period
6. Target Price (if any)
7. Basis Price
8. Vessel Specifications (if any)
9. Estimated load port distance from Damietta (in nautical miles) - *This is for our internal logistics.* 
10. Main Engine Type
11. Main Engine Speed
12. GT (Gross Tonnage)
13. Cargo Pumps (Capacity)
14. Available days to next fixture (we need this in order to provide a quotation)

Please contact me if you have any questions or need more information.

Thank you.

Respectfully yours,

Adi Rashid
Liquid Petroleum Gas Division

Also, please confirm that the following information will be included in your quotation:

1. Grade of LPG
2. Quantity
3. Point of Discharge
4. ETA (Estimated Time of Arrival)
5. Price
6. Basis of Price
7. Vessel Specifications
8. Main Engine Type
9. Main Engine Speed
10. GT
11. Cargo Pumps
12. Available Days to next Fixture

Thank you.

Anwa Duqar

email_chain.body:

We are shipping a parcel of boric acid from Busan to La Guaira. Our cargo is planned to be loaded onto the M/V Mangrove, which is currently at anchorage in Busan and scheduled to load on October 27th.

Luca

email_chain.subject: Re: Boric Acid Shipment - Busan to La Guaira - M/V Mangrove
email_chain.body:
Dear Luca,

We handled a shipment of boric acid from Port Sudan via La Guaira, Venezuela, back in October 2019, also on the vessel "Mangrove". The ETA then was around November 18th, 2019.

We are interested in the details of your current shipment. Could you please provide the following information:

*   When was the shipment initiated?
*   Are you the owner of this shipment?
*   If not, who is the owner?
*   Can you provide a copy of the bill of lading?
*   If you are not the owner, can you provide the vessel name?
*   Is this shipment ultimately destined for the US?

If the answer to the last question is yes, please provide the vessel's name, call sign, and the following vessel details:

*   Dimensions
*   Gross Tonnage
*   Gross Registered Tonnage

Thank you for your assistance.

Best regards,

Andrea

email_chain.subject: Subject
Crude Oil Shipment - Houston to Tianjin
email_chain.body:
Mr. Taylor,

Can your vessel load 3,000 MT of crude oil from Houston to Tianjin by mid-May? Also, what kind of off-hire provisions do you typically include in the CP?

Best,
Andy

email_chain.subject: Re: Crude Oil Shipment - Houston to Tianjin
email_chain.body:
Hi, Andy,

Regarding point 2 of your letter, we hereby confirm our offer for a voyage from loading at Houston, USA, to discharge at Tianjin, China with the following details:

* Within the standard terms of RINA/PLA Form B, and;

Regarding the time, we have different criteria for arriving time and set the time before the actual arrival time we get, how about the time? How many days does the vessel take?

Please confirm if you are able to discharge the cargo with cargo.

Hope for your kindly reply.

Best Regards,
James

email_chain.subject: Re: Crude Oil Shipment - Houston to Tianjin
email_chain.body:
Hi, James,

As I am not familiar with the latest RINA/PLA form B, I guess you may refer to clause 3 of said form B?

My questions are:

1.  We shall discharge from a cargo vessel discharging alongside a cargo and/or bunker barge, subject to the cargo barge having open access to the New Territories Container Terminals to allow transfer of cargo to shore and the cargo barge being able to call at Tianjin to unload and subsequently discharge the cargo from the cargo barge.
2.  (from clause 3) i) cargo and/or bunker barge with bunker tanks be moored at the cargo vessel's hull side and connected to cargo vessel's tanks and hoses with through-water manifolds or other pipe fittings, (ii) discharging of cargo be from full cargo vessel's cargo tanks to cargo or bunker barge's empty tanks, and (iii) as long as cargo vessel's tanks are constantly filled, full loaded vessel shall remain alongside bunkering and/or cargo barge throughout the bunkering/discharging operation.

* As per point 2, we will provide that discharging of cargo be from full cargo vessel's cargo tanks to cargo or bunker barge's empty tanks, and that as long as cargo vessel's tanks are constantly filled, full loaded vessel shall remain alongside bunkering/discharging operation.

* The cargo vessel to be of chemical tanker type or similar design, capable of maintaining a barge alongside its own side for discharge in a full laden condition for up to a total of 24 hours. This requirement is subject to confirmation of arrangements with the cargo barge, bunker barge, and terminals concerned to ensure the cargo can be discharged without the cargo vessel moving to an alternative mooring. The foregoing is without prejudice to the cargo vessel's primary duties during the bunkering/discharging operation.

* The bunker and/or cargo barge will carry all necessary port, pilot, towing, and terminal dues for the port of Tianjin.

Best,
Andy

email_chain.subject: Re: Crude Oil Shipment - Houston to Tianjin
email_chain.body:
Regarding your following 2 questions:
How many days does the vessel take??

*This arrangement is acceptable to the Charterer, and as such, this will form part of the charterparty.

* The Vessel shall carry all necessary port, pilot, towing and terminal dues for the port of Tianjin.
Hope for your kindly reply.

email_chain.subject: Re: Crude Oil Shipment - Houston to Tianjin
email_chain.body:
Dear Andy,

Many thanks for your email. You mentioned that the cargo vessel will provide to ensure that our barge can carry out the task. However, I think that we can provide for it, so as to the vessel to offer that we shall ensure our barge.

Also, if we confirm on your offer, will you provide a set of documents?

Best regards,
James

email_chain.subject: Re: Crude Oil Shipment - Houston to Tianjin
email_chain.body:
Dear James,

Regarding the voyage time, we estimate approximately 30 days from Houston to Tianjin. And yes, upon confirmation, we will provide a complete set of shipping documents.

Best,
Andy

email_chain.subject: Urgent Inquiry: LNG Tanker from Lagos to Hong Kong
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Cheng,

We have an urgent requirement for a tanker to carry approximately 25,000 MT of LNG from Lagos, Nigeria to Hong Kong. 

Could you please provide your best freight rate for this voyage? We also need clarification regarding laytime. Specifically, do you allow for reinstatement of laytime exceeding 96 hours?

Thank you for your time and consideration.

Best regards,
Damian

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Inquiry: LNG Tanker from Lagos to Hong Kong
email_chain.body:
Dear Damian,

Thank you for your inquiry.

Our price is FOB USD 540.00 per MT. Please note that this price does not include lightering fees, which, if required (maximum 5,000 MT), will be charged at USD 300.00 per MT.

Estimated port time (in and out) is 4 days, and the estimated transit time is 27 days.

Regarding laytime reinstatement, any reinstatement for both arrival and departure is subject to our approval. We generally do not allow reinstatement of 48 hours once the vessel has departed our port, regardless of whether 96 hours have passed. Arrival time must be within 24 hours of the initially agreed ETA. If the vessel is delayed beyond this, we may consider reinstatement for up to 24 hours, subject to circumstances.

Should you wish to proceed and sign the Charter Party with us, please provide the following documents as soon as possible:

1.  Company profile, including scope of operation, address, fax number, and phone number.
2.  Certification of insurance.
3.  [Missing document details from original email]

Sincerely,
Alice Cheng

email_chain.subject: Methanol Shipment Inquiry: Mumbai - Osaka - Canada
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Ryan,

I have a potential methanol shipment originating in Mumbai, destined for Osaka, with a subsequent reshipment from Osaka to Canada. Is this something you can handle?

Regards,
Ulysses Ryan

email_chain.subject: Re: Methanol Shipment Inquiry: Mumbai - Osaka - Canada
email_chain.body:
Hi Ulysses,

Yes, I can handle the methanol shipment. Upon arrival in Osaka, please ensure you submit an SF-478 form (specifically referencing Item 16) and forward it to the PBO Warehouse. I will then coordinate the arrangements for its onward shipment from Osaka to Canada.

Regards,
Ryan S.

email_chain.subject: RE: Methanol Shipment Inquiry: Mumbai - Osaka - Canada
email_chain.body:
Ryan,

As far as I'm aware, methanol is classified as a hazardous material...

email_chain.subject: Re: Methanol Shipment Inquiry: Mumbai - Osaka - Canada
email_chain.body:
Ulysses,

You are correct; methanol is indeed a hazardous material and cannot be shipped via standard commercial channels. I will arrange for the shipment to be transported by the Military Sealift Command, which is authorized to transport military personnel and hazardous cargo.

Regards,
Ryan S.

email_chain.subject: Inquiry Regarding Truck Volume at LA and Long Beach Ports
email_chain.body:
Good morning Mr. Langley,

Hope you are well!

We are currently evaluating the operational capacity of both the Port of Los Angeles and the Port of Long Beach. We would appreciate it if you could provide information on the average number of trucks your system manages per week.

Additionally, are there any specific remarks you can share regarding efficiency and potential congestion issues at your terminals?

Thank you for your time and consideration. We look forward to your reply.

Regards,
Paul Miller

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry Regarding Truck Volume at LA and Long Beach Ports
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Langley,

I hope this email finds you well.

Further to my previous email, our group is following the current market dynamics. We would like to clarify that we are asking about the average weekly truck volume you manage at both port gates combined.

Any insights or suggestions you might have regarding operational improvements or current challenges would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you for your time and assistance.

email_chain.subject: Following Up: Inquiry Regarding Truck Volume at LA and Long Beach Ports
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Langley,

Could you please provide the average weekly truck volume your system manages? Also, any suggestions you have for our group concerning port operations would be very helpful.

Thank you for your reply.

Our firm is considering potential investments in both the Ports of Los Angeles and Long Beach. We are particularly interested in understanding the current operational capacity. Could you please share information on the number of trucks your terminal handles per week and per month?

Thank you in advance for your assistance.

Daniel Williams

P.S. We appreciate you sharing insightful information regarding port operations!

email_chain.body:
Hi,

I am just following up on previous email.

Thank you.

email_chain.subject: Client Intake Process Feedback
email_chain.body:
What information do you typically need from a client before starting a meeting? I found that sample email A and B are very formal. I'd like to make email C more casual, almost like an informal call, while still maintaining professionalism. Any tips for making my next email C better? Thanks!
+1 (870) 432-1609

email_chain.subject: Re: Client Intake Process Feedback
email_chain.body:
Hi Samantha!

Let's take email A as an example. "I wanted to follow up on our conversation yesterday, and to make sure you have everything you need to..."

email_chain.subject: Following Up - Your Photography Shoot
email_chain.body:
Hello <client name>,

We spoke yesterday, and I wanted to follow up on our conversation and make sure you have everything you need to book your upcoming shoot with me.

I am available on the following dates:
Wed, December 16: 12:30 - 4:30 pm
Thurs, December 17: 8:30 am - 12:30 pm
Friday, December 18: 12:30 - 4:30 pm
Wed, December 23: 8:30 am - 12:30 pm
Please let me know which time(s) work for you and your crew.

To book your shoot, we'll need:
1. A confirmed booking time for your crew and for the photographer
2. Any special equipment your crew will need
3. A list of any foods or props that need to be provided
4. A signed [document]

email_chain.subject: Following Up on Our Call - <blank> Services
email_chain.body:
Good afternoon,

I'm emailing to follow up on our phone call yesterday and to see if I can help you in any way. Please let me know if you have any questions.

Regarding our phone call:
On Wednesday, <month>, we spoke about your interest in <blank> services. You mentioned that you'd like to learn more about our services, and I'd love to help. Are you free for a short phone conversation?

Is Monday, November 2, 2020 at 12:00 pm a good time for you? If not, just let me know and I'd be happy to find another time that works for both of us.

You can reach me at <phone number>

Let me know if you need anything else!

email_chain.subject: Following Up on <blank> Services
email_chain.body:
Dear <client name>,

I wanted to reach out to you today because of our conversation yesterday. I know we talked about your interest in <blank> services and we went over the details, so I wanted to see if you had any questions.

email_chain.subject: Re: Client Intake Process Feedback
email_chain.body:
If I am able to answer your questions and address your concerns about working with me, I'd love to have a brief phone conversation on Monday at 12:00 pm.
If this doesn't work for you, just let me know and I'd be happy to find another time that works for both of us.
You can reach me at <phone number>

What do you think about this? Let me know!
Is this enough to cover it? If not, just let me know which topics you'd like to cover before we meet.

Sent from my iPhone

email_chain.subject: Phosphate Cargo Inquiry - Casablanca to Lisbon
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Johnson,

We are scheduling a 1,100 MT cargo of phosphates from Casablanca to Lisbon. Could you please provide a quote for a suitable vessel with laycan after the 20th of July? 

Regards,
Ethan Miller

email_chain.subject: Re: Phosphate Cargo Inquiry - Casablanca to Lisbon
email_chain.body:
Dear Ethan,

Thank you for your inquiry. We're happy to assist you with your phosphate shipment from Casablanca to Lisbon.

To provide you with an accurate quote, we require some additional information:

1.  **Loading Port:** Casablanca, Morocco
2.  **Discharge Port:** Lisbon, Portugal
3.  **Cargo:** 1,100 MT Phosphates
4.  **Specific Handling Requirements:** (Please specify if any)

In the meantime, could you also clarify what you mean by alternative shipping solutions offered by our affiliate?

We look forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards,

Julia Barlow
Administrative Director, Global Trading LTD
Global Commodity and Energy Traders

email_chain.subject: Re: Phosphate Cargo Inquiry - Casablanca to Lisbon
email_chain.body:
Dear Julia,

Good morning!

Apologies for the initial lack of clarity. The reason for the requested laycan *after* the 20th of July is that we are looking to subsequently reposition the vessel to Vung Tau, Vietnam, to load another cargo of similar size. We anticipate loading in Vung Tau around the 1st of August, or as soon as possible thereafter. I'm open to discussing pricing to secure a suitable vessel. 

To answer your implicit questions: No, we're not particularly interested in vessels from Russia or Lithuania. We just want a suitable vessel from any flag. Also we are exporting to Portugal. 

Let me know what further information you need.

Best regards,
Ethan Miller

email_chain.subject: Re: Phosphate Cargo Inquiry - Casablanca to Lisbon
email_chain.body:
Dear Ethan,

Thank you for the clarification regarding the subsequent voyage to Vung Tau. Our chartering department is reviewing available vessels that can accommodate your schedule and cargo. They will require confirmation of any special instructions for the 1,100 MT phosphate cargo during the Casablanca to Lisbon leg.

Best regards,

Julia Barlow
Administrative Director, Global Trading LTD
Global Commodity and Energy Traders

email_chain.subject: Re: Phosphate Cargo Inquiry - Casablanca to Lisbon
email_chain.body:
Dear Robert and Julia,

I have confirmed that all required information, including any special instructions for the phosphate cargo, is already on file with our company and has been provided to Global Trading LTD. Could you please provide a proposed schedule and a Letter of Maritime Order (LMO) at your earliest convenience?

Best regards,
Ethan Miller

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: Status of MS Radosta During Storm
email_chain.body:
Hi Bill,

Did MS Radosta manage to navigate away from the storm's path, or is she still affected? 

Please let us know her current status at your earliest convenience.

Yours,
Rachel

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Status of MS Radosta During Storm
email_chain.body:
Hi Bill,

Following up on my earlier email. We need to update our records and inform the client about the MS Radosta's situation. Any information you can provide is appreciated.

Yours,
Rachel

email_chain.subject: LNG Inquiry - Ras Laffan to Fujairah
email_chain.body:
Hey Mr. Poitras,

An old contact of mine at Total informed me that Total is sourcing 500MT of LNG from Ras Laffan to Fujairah. Any chance you have space for it?

Cheers,
Joe

email_chain.subject: Re: LNG Inquiry - Ras Laffan to Fujairah
email_chain.body:
Hey Joe,

Did you work with a Frank Serwinski? I just got an email from him about the same cargo...

Best regards,
Yves

email_chain.subject: Re: LNG Inquiry - Ras Laffan to Fujairah
email_chain.body:
Hey Yves,

Yes, we are in touch! How are you?

Cheers,
Joe

email_chain.subject: Re: LNG Inquiry - Ras Laffan to Fujairah
email_chain.body:
Hi Yves,

Following up on Total's loading at Ras Laffan. Do you want me to send you the loadout schedule from Ras Laffan?

Best regards,
Joe

email_chain.subject: Re: LNG Inquiry - Ras Laffan to Fujairah
email_chain.body:
Hello Joe,

If you can get the complete loadout schedule, it would be great.

Best regards,
Yves

email_chain.subject: Re: LNG Inquiry - Ras Laffan to Fujairah - Loadout Schedule Attached

As promised, I'm attaching the Ras Laffan loadout schedule.

Cheers,
Joe

email_chain.subject: Re: LNG Inquiry - Ras Laffan to Fujairah - Loadout Schedule Attached
email_chain.body:
Hey Yves,

Don't we still have time to take on more cargo at Ras Laffan?

Cheers,
Joe

email_chain.subject: Re: LNG Inquiry - Ras Laffan to Fujairah - Loadout Schedule Attached
email_chain.body:
Hi Joe,

I haven't seen an offer from you regarding the Ras Laffan cargo.

Best regards,
Yves

email_chain.subject: Re: LNG Inquiry - Ras Laffan to Fujairah - Loadout Schedule Attached
email_chain.body:
Hi Yves,

Is it still available?

Cheers,
Joe

email_chain.subject: Re: LNG Inquiry - Ras Laffan to Fujairah - Loadout Schedule Attached
email_chain.body:
Hi Yves,

Do you know if there is still cargo available?

Cheers,
Joe

email_chain.subject: Re: LNG Inquiry - Ras Laffan to Fujairah - Loadout Schedule Attached
email_chain.body:
Hello Joe,

The loading schedule is flexible.
We still have cargo available, but I'd rather not disclose the full amount to you. I don't want the whole market to know that we are still short of cargo...

Best regards,
Yves

email_chain.subject: Email Communication Training
email_chain.body:
This task aims to improve your professional email communication skills. You will respond to two email scenarios:

* Write two responses to the provided email enquiries.
* Practice using appropriate English email language.
* Ensure your emails have all the basic elements of an effective business email (subject line, greeting, clear message, closing).
* Understand what makes an email more effective than another.
* Use email correctly for different situations.
* Ensure your emails are grammatically accurate.
* Use these emails as a springboard to practice your English skills.

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: Shipping Plastic Pellets - Piraeus to Panama City
email_chain.body:
Dear Shipping Team,

I'd like to arrange a shipment of used plastic pellets with you. Is there any available space from Piraeus to Panama City? Please let me know ASAP.

Do you need any documents? Where should we send them?

Regards,
Laurence

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Shipping Plastic Pellets - Piraeus to Panama City
email_chain.body:
Dear Shipping Team,

Following up on my previous email, could you please let me know if you have available space from Piraeus to Panama City for my plastic pellets? Alternatively, can the shipment be combined with other cargo?

Where should we send our documents?

Regards,
Laurence

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Shipping Plastic Pellets - Piraeus to Panama City
email_chain.body:
Dear Shipping Team,

What specific information should I include in the documents for this shipment?

Are the container slots required to be open-top?

Also, what is the typical container capacity of your ships, and what is the availability for a shipment of my size?

Regards,
Laurence

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Shipping Plastic Pellets - Piraeus to Panama City
email_chain.body:
Dear Shipping Team,

Okay, I think we are ready to proceed with the freight. Can we send the documents directly to you, or should we send them to your local agent in Piraeus?

Also, do you require signatures on any of the documents?

Regards,
Laurence

email_chain.subject: Phosphate Cargo - Casablanca to Lisbon
email_chain.body:
Hi Ms. Morrow,

We have just received confirmation for a shipment of 3,200 MT of phosphates from Casablanca to Lisbon. Can you confirm your ability to handle this cargo at your facilities?

Regards,
Ishaan

email_chain.subject: RE: Phosphate Cargo - Casablanca to Lisbon
email_chain.body:
Hi Ishaan,

Please find attached our standard Confirmation of Arrival procedure. Could you please provide an estimated arrival date for this cargo?

Regards,
Sarah Morrow
[Attachment: Confirmation_of_Arrival_Lisbon.pdf]

email_chain.subject: RE: Phosphate Cargo - Casablanca to Lisbon
email_chain.body:
Hi Sarah,

The vessel is currently scheduled to arrive on October 6th. Will your team be ready to receive the cargo then?

Regards,
Ishaan

email_chain.subject: RE: Phosphate Cargo - Casablanca to Lisbon
email_chain.body:
Okay, we're all set! We'll be expecting the cargo on October 6th.

Regards,
Sarah

email_chain.subject: RE: Phosphate Cargo - Casablanca to Lisbon
email_chain.body:
Great! I'll inform the vessel. Talk to you soon.

Regards,
Ishaan

email_chain.subject: Sugar Shipment Inquiry - Saudi Arabia
email_chain.body:
Hello Claire,

We have a vessel arriving in Saudi Arabia around March 2nd, loaded with petroleum products. We're exploring options for a backhaul of 35,000 MT of refined sugar.

Do you have capacity for this shipment? If so, please provide your demurrage rates per day after 72 hours of laytime.

Regards,
Jenny

email_chain.subject: Re: Sugar Shipment Inquiry - Saudi Arabia
email_chain.body:
Dear Jenny,

Yes, we do have capacity for sugar shipments.

Our current sugar rates are USD 2.00/MT for demurrage within the ARA range. Demurrage beyond the 72 hours laytime is USD 3.00/MT.

To proceed, could you please provide a sample contract for this type of movement?

Warm Regards,
Claire

email_chain.subject: Re: Sugar Shipment Inquiry - Saudi Arabia
email_chain.body:
Dear Claire,

Thank you for your rates. 

Could you please clarify the geographical coverage included in your rates and advise what documents you would require for the export of the sugar shipment?

Also, is this a CIF or FOB deal from your side?

Regarding the sample contract request, we are the direct shipper, not a broker. Can you confirm you work with direct shippers?

Finally, do you have available time in the ARA region for loading onto a barge, and if so, how much time are we allocated to complete the loading process? 

Best regards,
Jenny

email_chain.subject: Re: Sugar Shipment Inquiry - Saudi Arabia
email_chain.body:
Dear Jenny,

Thank you for your questions. 

I will confirm the coverage details and loading time in ARA with our agent and get back to you shortly.

Also, could you still please provide a sample contract for this movement? It helps us understand the specifics of your requirements.

With regards,
Claire

email_chain.subject: Re: Sugar Shipment Inquiry - Saudi Arabia
email_chain.body:
Dear Claire,

Thank you for getting back to us. We are looking forward to receiving your answers. Specifically:

1. What is the duration of the time charter (for how long does your vessel remain available to us)?

2. Which of the following documents are required for sugar export (please check ALL that apply):
   * Certificate of Origin (CO)
   * Certificate of Export or License (CE or CE-L)
   * License from the exporter country
   * Exchange Control Permit (ECP)
   * Letter of Denial
   * Broker’s certificate

3. Is the quoted price for the port destination?

Best regards,
Jenny

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: 11,400 MT Feed Flour Haiphong to Singapore
email_chain.body:
Dear Ship Manager,

We have 11,400 MT of feed flour to ship from Haiphong to Singapore. Could you please let us know if you have a suitable vessel available in the next three days?

Also, could you share your standard policy regarding laytime extensions?

Sincerely,
Mandy Chen

email_chain.subject: RE: Inquiry: 11,400 MT Feed Flour Haiphong to Singapore - Revised Destination
email_chain.body:
Dear Ship Manager,

Please disregard the previous destination of Singapore. The correct details are as follows:

We would like to know if your vessel is available for the cargo details below:

Load Port: Haiphong
Discharge Port: Port Bellingham
Incoterm: FOB
Cargo: Wheat Flour
Freight Rate: US$240/MT
Moisture Content: 15%
Quantity: 11,400 MT

Thank you for your time and consideration.

Sincerely,
Mandy Chen

email_chain.subject: RE: Inquiry: 11,400 MT Feed Flour Haiphong to Singapore - Revised Destination and Quantity
email_chain.body:
Dear Ship Manager,

Further to my previous email, we are planning to load 11,400 MT of wheat flour at Haiphong port and discharge it at Port Bellingham under FOB terms.

The approximate draft for arrival at Haiphong is 14.5 meters (maximum draft 15.5 meters). We understand your vessel's capacity at Haiphong is approximately 11,900 MT.

Given the 500 MT difference between the initial contract quantity (11,400 MT) and your vessel's capacity, we propose adjusting the contract quantity to 11,900 MT. The invoice for 11,900 MT will be the net payable amount. We will confirm the exact draft upon confirmation.

Thank you,
Mandy Chen

email_chain.subject: Inquiry from [Company Name] - Request for Vessel Services & Quote
email_chain.body:
Dear Capt. Gong,

I hope this email finds you well.

We received an inquiry from [Company Name] who are looking for a supplier. They have requested information on your services, the availability of your vessels, and a price quote. Could you please provide an approximate timeline for a reply to this inquiry?

Thank you in advance for your time and attention to this matter.

Sincerely,
Alan

email_chain.subject: Following up: Inquiry from [Company Name] - Request for Vessel Services & Quote
email_chain.body:
Good afternoon,

This is a follow-up email regarding the inquiry from [Company Name] sent on October 26th. Could you please provide some insight or acknowledge receipt?

Regards,
Amit

email_chain.subject: Status Update Request: Inquiry from [Company Name] - Request for Vessel Services & Quote
email_chain.body:
Good afternoon,

Can you provide me with a status update on this inquiry? We have followed up multiple times since the initial email, and haven't heard back. 

Regards,
Amit

email_chain.subject: Urgent: Status Update Needed - Inquiry from [Company Name]
email_chain.body:
Good morning,

We have not yet received a reply to this email. Can you please provide us with information regarding this inquiry as soon as possible?

Regards,
Amit

email_chain.subject: Status Update Request - [Company Name] Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hello,

Could you please provide a status update on this inquiry? We would appreciate a response as soon as possible.

Regards,
Amit

email_chain.subject: Following Up: [Company Name] Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Good afternoon,

Can you please provide a status update on this inquiry?

Regards,
Amit

email_chain.subject: Final Request: Status Update - [Company Name] Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Good afternoon,

We have been trying to get a status update on this inquiry for quite some time, but we have not yet received a response. Please respond as soon as possible so that we can inform our client [Company Name].

Regards,
Amit

email_chain.subject: Palm Oil Shipment Inquiry - India to Italy
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Bravo,

We are interested in shipping approximately 21,000 MT of palm oil from India to Italy. We are currently working on securing US$ funding. Could you please advise on your next available laycan for this route? Also, do you consider lumpsum freight deals?

Best regards,
James

email_chain.subject: Long Term Charter Inquiry - Red River Beans
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Bravo,

We are exploring a long-term charter to load approximately 100,000 MT of Red River beans. Could you please send your Letter of Intent (LOI) for our review and discussion?

Best regards,
James

email_chain.subject: Vessel Charter Inquiry - General Questions
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Bravo,

We are considering chartering a vessel from your fleet. We have a few preliminary questions:

*   What are the typical weather conditions experienced on voyages with your vessels?
*   Is your crew experienced in navigating through reef areas?
*   Are there any restrictions on the types of goods that can be transported on your vessel?
*   What is the container capacity (TEUs) of your vessel?

Best regards,
James

email_chain.subject: Shipping Quote Request: 1500MT Cardboard - Gothenburg to Busan
email_chain.body:
We have 1500MT of cardboard to ship from Gothenburg to Busan. What's the best forwarder to use?

Best regards,
Blanca

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Quote Request: 1500MT Cardboard - Gothenburg to Busan
email_chain.body:
Hi Blanca,

This is going to be used for carton boxes, correct?

Can you please confirm whether this is import or export cargo for you (i.e., are you shipping *from* Gothenburg or *to* Gothenburg)? Also, have the containers already been loaded?

Best regards,
David

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Quote Request: 1500MT Cardboard - Gothenburg to Busan
email_chain.body:
Hi David,

Just to clarify, is the point of origin Gothenburg, Sweden, or Cartagena, Spain?

Best regards,
Lauren

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Quote Request: 1500MT Cardboard - Gothenburg to Busan
email_chain.body:
Thanks Lauren,

The cargo is from Gothenburg, Sweden.

Best regards,
Blanca

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Quote Request: 1500MT Cardboard - Gothenburg to Busan
email_chain.body:
Hi Blanca,

To provide you with an accurate quote, please clarify the following:

1.  What is the exact port of loading in Gothenburg?
2.  Approximately how many 20-foot containers will you require?
3.  Are you looking to have the cargo loaded and shipped out of the port as quickly as possible (i.e., expedited service)?
4.  Are you looking for a door-to-door quotation, or only port-to-port?
5.  What is the precise port of destination in Busan?

Best regards,
Lauren

email_chain.subject: Booking Confirmation: 5000MT White Paper - Shanghai to Krishnapatnam
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Anderson,

We have a confirmed booking for 5,000MT of white paper from Shanghai to Krishnapatnam. Our intended loading window is April 11-25.

Could you please provide the Estimated Time of Arrival (ETA) at Krishnapatnam and your proposed stowage plan?

Looking forward to your reply.

Best regards,
Zachary Miller

email_chain.subject: Re: Booking Confirmation: 5000MT White Paper - Shanghai to Krishnapatnam
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Miller,

We are pleased to confirm our booking for the shipment of 5000MT of white paper on the vessel you mentioned in your previous correspondence. 

Kindly confirm the Estimated Time of Arrival (ETA) at Krishnapatnam with Oceanlines.

Please also advise on the required packing specifications and any equipment requirements for this consignment.

We look forward to your confirmation.

Yours faithfully,
Mr. Yuan Chen

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: 13,000 MT Wheat - Pusan to Rio
email_chain.body:
Hi Ella,

Can you accept the loading of 13,000 MT of wheat from Pusan to Rio de Janeiro?

Best wishes,
Lucila

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: 13,000 MT Wheat - Pusan to Rio
email_chain.body:
By that we mean a new contract for 13,000 MT of wheat.

Regards,
Paul

email_chain.subject: Order Confirmation: 13,000 MT Wheat to Brazil
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir,

This email is to confirm that we have ordered 13,000 MT of wheat from your company. The sale of this wheat has been agreed for the price of 175/MT.

Delivery is to be made to Brazil, which is our main market. We will require the contract to be sent to us as soon as possible, once you confirm this order.

We look forward to hearing from you and dealing with your company in the future.

Yours sincerely,
Lucila

email_chain.subject: Re: Order Confirmation: 13,000 MT Wheat to Brazil
email_chain.body:
Dear Lucila,

This email confirms that we have received your order for 13,000 MT of wheat at $175/MT for delivery to Brazil. 

We are preparing the contract and will send it to you within 2 business days. 

Thank you for your business. We look forward to a successful transaction.

Yours sincerely,
Sales Department
WheatCorp

email_chain.subject: Contract for 13,000 MT Wheat to Brazil - DRAFT
email_chain.body:
Dear Lucila,

Please find attached the draft contract for the sale of 13,000 MT of wheat to be delivered to Brazil, as per our previous correspondence.

Please review the contract carefully and let us know if you have any questions or require any amendments.

Once we receive your confirmation, we will prepare the final version for signing.

Yours sincerely,
Sales Department
WheatCorp

email_chain.subject: RE: Contract for 13,000 MT Wheat to Brazil - DRAFT
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir,

Thank you for sending the contract draft. We have reviewed it and have a few minor amendments which we will forward to you shortly. 

Yours sincerely,
Lucila

email_chain.subject: Steel Cargo Availability - Kamsar
email_chain.body:
Good afternoon Mr. Smith,

We have 3,500 MT of steel available in Kamsar. Would you be able to accept the cargo on December 14th at 16:00? Also, would you mind if the cargo is transported in 4 lots of approximately 875 MT each?

Sincerely,
Daniel

email_chain.subject: Following up: Steel Cargo Availability - Kamsar
email_chain.body:
Good morning,

Hello Mr. Smith, could you please confirm if you have received my colleague Daniel's email regarding the steel cargo in Kamsar?

Sincerely,
Lucas

email_chain.subject: Urgent: Unanswered inquiries regarding steel cargo
email_chain.body:
Good afternoon,

email_chain.subject: Scam Email Chain Analysis
email_chain.body:
There are 47 emails that look like this, each filled with valuable information, contact info, and requests from scammers.

Following these scams' leads, investigators can map out the chain of people behind the scam, determine the next target, and watch them open suspicious links or respond to scam emails. An analysis of the replies to this chain of emails shows that four or more people are involved with creating and supporting these scams.

In a world of complex scams, one of the best methods of prevention is education. The more people who are aware of and reject a scam, the less impact it will have on those who don't know any better.

To this end, this data has been released to the public to help everyone understand the impact of mass marketing scams. A few highlights of this scam's attempt to fool millions of people include:

email_chain.subject: Shipping Inquiry: 700MT Pharmaceuticals - Riga to Dubai
email_chain.body:

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Inquiry: 700MT Pharmaceuticals - Riga to Dubai
email_chain.body:
Hello Grace,

Thank you for your inquiry. I can certainly give you an initial idea of the timeframe. My colleague has already shared the shipping route from Riga to Dubai with you, I believe.

Before I begin my search for available vessels, I need a bit more information about the shipment:

- Will the goods be shipped as Less than Container Load (LCL) or Full Container Load (FCL)?
- Could you please specify the exact nature of the cargo (e.g., specific pharmaceutical products)?
- Is sea freight the preferred mode of shipment?
- What is your expected date for the cargo to be ready for shipment?
- Is this an urgent shipment? If so, please provide any relevant documentation to support this.

Regards,
Max Miller

Max Miller

email_chain.subject: Vessel Status - Almarakib
email_chain.body:
Hi Sada,

What's the current status of the Almarakib? Any news you can share?

Best,
Nada

email_chain.subject: Re: Vessel Status - Almarakib
email_chain.body:
Hi Nada,

Here are the latest developments on the Almarakib.

It's outward bound. There are two main reasons:

1.  The Almarakib's Pakistani captain is looking to supplement his income. He's offering transport from our port to Pakistan to earn some quick cash. He's acting as a freelancer and is willing to take on extra jobs if the price is right, as long as he receives payment upfront.

2. He's asking for $30,000 upfront for this additional run. We can only cover this by taking out a loan, which we realistically can't afford. I'm forced to sell my share of the ship to repay it.

I'm writing this from the bank on my phone. I've unfortunately had to agree to let the bank have your share of the ship as well to completely cover the loan.

Regards,
Sada

email_chain.body:

*   Cargo name, weight (4,000 tons confirmed), and volume (in cubic meters)
*   Are there any hazardous materials associated with the polystyrene shipment?
*   Detailed cargo description (e.g., packaging type)
*   Cargo value
*   Specific lashing requirements for securing the cargo.
*   Any other special requirements, such as temperature control (reefer containers).

Also, what is the estimated time of arrival (ETA) of the cargo at Ningbo Port, ready for loading?

Once we have this information, we will promptly prepare a quotation for your consideration.

Alwin

email_chain.subject: Re: Turpentine Shipment - Durban to Alexandria
email_chain.body:
Just want to acknowledge that I received both emails (1 & 2) at the same time (23:42).

NB: I was sitting in my office in South Africa when the above email arrived. So no email delay, no delay in me seeing the email, no delay in me writing the email.

email_chain.subject: Re: Turpentine Shipment - Durban to Alexandria
email_chain.body:
Hi Andre,

Just to be clear: I did not write Email 2 – I did not exist at the time Email 2 was written.

Do you want me to believe that? Or would you like to apologize and admit you made a mistake regarding the sender of that email?

email_chain.subject: Re: Turpentine Shipment - Durban to Alexandria
email_chain.body:
Daniel,

Let me clarify. You could say, for instance, that I wrote email 3 in a hurry when I wasn't at my best.

As for your comment, "No, Daniel. I did not exist then. I could not have written it then.", we're aware that you were the one who wrote the email. There is no dispute about that. It's your name on the email. There's a distinction between the content of what you wrote and the action of writing it.

That's fair enough. My other reason for contacting you was to discuss the statement on our website, where it says: "We don't have access to the rest of the page of letters."

I just want to let you know, as I can see from your first response here (Response #1) that you received the initial email promptly.

email_chain.subject: Free 50ft Container - Last Call
email_chain.body:
Mr. Cuenca,

Last call to book space on a free 50-foot container moving from Ningbo to Savannah. I'd like to hear from you by the end of the day!

Regards,
Neeta

email_chain.subject: Re: Free 50ft Container - Last Call
email_chain.body:
Hi Neeta,

We did book the container space. We anticipate the cargo will be ready to go in approximately two weeks.

We also have a 20ft container going from Shanghai to Laem Chabang around the same time.

Regards,
Paul

Paul Cuenca
JDP Transportation Inc.
Tel: 604-557-3643 x225
Fax: 604-557-3644
Email: pcuenca@jdptransportation.com
Website: http://www.jdptransportation.com

email_chain.subject: RE: Free 50ft Container - Last Call
email_chain.body:
Paul,

Regarding the 50-foot container you 'booked' - it's unclear if we have an agreement in place for 50-foot containers between our companies. Asia-USA Logistics is primarily an origin-based forwarder. Typically, if such an agreement existed, you would have offered the container to us directly. Please clarify what you mean by 'book' in this context and confirm whether a formal agreement exists. We would typically be aware of any active agreement involving 50-foot containers, especially with a Canadian company.

Regards,
Neeta

Neeta Bhojwani
President
Asia-USA Logistics Inc
Ph: 604-568-1058

email_chain.subject: Re: Free 50ft Container - Last Call
email_chain.body:
Hi Neeta,

Understood. We will proceed as you wish regarding the 50-foot container.

Regarding the 20ft container to Laem Chabang, it will require an Out-of-Gauge (OOG) transfer from the mainline carrier to OOCL's mainline service. This transfer will necessitate moving the container to Keelung for OOCL to take possession. We had understood the destination port to be Kaohsiung. 

To clarify the destination of the 20ft container from Shanghai, could you please provide the original Bill of Lading (BL) or an amendment confirming the correct port (Laem Chabang)?

Thank you,
Paul

Paul Cuenca
JDP Transportation Inc.
Tel: 604-557-3643 x225

email_chain.subject: FW: Free 50ft Container - Last Call
email_chain.body:
Paul,

Before proceeding, please provide the agreement you referenced. Given the recent communication, we require verification of any existing agreements with JDP Transportation Inc. We have no record of being offered a 20-foot container arrangement with your company and request that you cease booking on our behalf until the agreement is produced. 

Regards,
Neeta

Neeta Bhojwani
President
Asia-USA Logistics Inc
Ph: 604-568-1058
