email_chain.subject: Urgent Shipment Request - Jeddah to Port Said
email_chain.body:
Hi Abdullah,

Could you please provide a quote for transporting the following materials from Jeddah to Port Said on short notice?

1. 100,000 MT of 92-octane gasoline
2. 1,500 MT of wax
3. 500 MT of acetone

Also, what would your demurrage rate be after 30 days of laytime?

Thanks,
Ramesh

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Shipment Request - Jeddah to Port Said
email_chain.body:
Dear Ramesh,

Our standard demurrage rate is 14,000 Saudi Riyals per day. This rate reduces to 10,000 Saudi Riyals per day after 30 days of laytime.

Your case would fall into this lower rate category. I will proceed with arranging the charter.

Thanks and regards,
Abdullah

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Shipment Request - Jeddah to Port Said
email_chain.body:
Abdullah,

Can you please deliver the shipment to Tehran instead of Port Said?

Ramesh

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Shipment Request - Jeddah to Port Said
email_chain.body:
Dear Ramesh,

Of course. I will provide a quote for transshipment to Tehran on short notice. Will you require ocean freight services in addition to transshipment?

Regards,
Abdullah

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Shipment Request - Jeddah to Port Said
email_chain.body:
Yes, please send us your quotation for both ocean freight and transshipment to Tehran.

Ramesh

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Shipment Request - Jeddah to Port Said - Quotation
email_chain.body:
Dear Ramesh,

The total price for ocean freight and transshipment to Tehran is 200,000 Saudi Riyals. Is this acceptable?

Regards,
Abdullah

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Shipment Request - Jeddah to Port Said - Quotation
email_chain.body:
Abdullah,

That price is too high. Please get back to me within 12 hours with a lower price.

Ramesh

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Shipment Request - Jeddah to Port Said - Quotation
email_chain.body:
Dear Ramesh,

I have reduced the price to 150,000 Saudi Riyals. Please confirm your acceptance by Monday night.

Regards,
Abdullah

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Shipment Request - Jeddah to Port Said - Quotation - ACCEPTED
email_chain.body:
Abdullah,

Thank you for your help. I have accepted your offer of 150,000 Saudi Riyals.

Ramesh

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Shipment Request - Jeddah to Port Said - Quotation - ACCEPTED
email_chain.body:
Dear Ramesh,

Thank you very much. I am waiting for the funds to be transferred. Please keep me informed about your progress.

Regards,
Abdullah

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent Shipment Request - Jeddah to Port Said - Quotation - ACCEPTED
email_chain.body:
Yes, of course. The transaction should take approximately one week. I have asked the bank to keep me informed about the transaction status.

Ramesh

email_chain.subject: Shipping Polymers from Rotterdam to Mexico City
email_chain.body:
Hello Anne-Marie,

I hope this email finds you well.

We need to ship some polymers from Rotterdam to Mexico City at the beginning of August. Could you please provide us with a rate?

Best regards,
Thor

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Polymers from Rotterdam to Mexico City
email_chain.body:
Hello Anne-Marie,

I've received a quote from another company for sea transport from Rotterdam to Mexico City. Can you review your rate and see if you can offer a more competitive price?

Best regards,
Thor

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Polymers from Rotterdam to Mexico City
email_chain.body:
Hello Thor,

When you receive an estimate from our system, it provides an approximate rate. The accuracy depends on the accuracy of the pickup and delivery dates, and the volume of goods shipped.

Our system provided you with an estimate based on a pickup date of July 10, 2017, a delivery date of July 20, 2017, and a volume of 25 CBM. If you wish to adjust these variables, please use the blue icon in the lower right corner of the estimate to change the preferred dates and volume.

For context, our base rate is $0.05 per CBM per day. The estimate you received included extra costs resulting from a ten-day transit, and a shipment of 25 CBM.

Do you have experience shipping polymers? 
Is the current rate reasonable?

Regards,
Anne-Marie

email_chain.subject: RE: Shipping Polymers from Rotterdam to Mexico City
email_chain.body:
Hello, Thor,

I believe my earlier reply did not include my contact information:

Contact: Anne-Marie
Cellphone: 314 567 345
Email: [email protected]

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Polymers from Rotterdam to Mexico City
email_chain.body:

I see that the quote you gave is based on July 10-20. My apologies for the error. The move is in August, not July. Can you please provide a new quote for shipment in August?

Best regards,
Thor

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Polymers from Rotterdam to Mexico City
email_chain.body:

Our quote is the same for the entire month of August. 

Regards,
Anne-Marie

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Polymers from Rotterdam to Mexico City

Thor

Best,
Tom

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Crude Palm Oil Medan to Manila - July 1st Week
email_chain.body:
Hi Tom,

Unfortunately, we have no available slots in the first week of July for 9,500 MT of crude palm oil from Medan to Manila.

Regarding demurrage, the initial offer is $100 per day, but the owners are looking to pay $70 per day.

How about the week of July 8th (week commencing July 3rd)?

Best,
Marco

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Crude Palm Oil Medan to Manila - July 1st Week
email_chain.body:
Hey Marco,

I will double-check with the charterers tomorrow regarding the week of July 8th and let you know.

Could you please clarify a few points regarding the cargo:

*   Who is the cargo consigned to?
*   Will the vessel be bunkered on board?
*   Is the cargo new or residue?
*   Is the cargo clean or oil-contaminated?

Best,
Tom

email_chain.body:

Thank you,

Galika

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry: Colombo to Port Hedland - 7,000 MT Cement
email_chain.body:
Dear Galika,

Following up on your inquiry, I've consulted with my colleagues regarding the current freight market.

The rate to Port Hedland is more favorable than initially anticipated. The current market rate to Port Hedland is approximately $10,500 USD, all in. We currently have two suitable vessels open to booking heading to Dubai, the SEABOURN PRESTIGE and the DOURO.

To assess the suitability of these vessels for your cargo, could you please provide your requirements regarding vessel age, safety certifications, and any specific technical aspects?

Thank you,

Terry

email_chain.subject: Re: Crude Oil Inquiry - Jingtang to Spain
email_chain.body:
Dear Tim,

Thank you for your inquiry. 

Our freight rate is USD 35 per metric ton. We have availability to load cargo at Jingtang Oil Terminal between December 12th and December 15th, with an estimated time of arrival (ETA) in Spain between December 17th and December 25th.

Please confirm your interest in chartering by the end of tomorrow.

Best regards,
Shipping Company Quotes

Customer

1.  How many days did it take for the ship to return?
2.  What was the length of the trip?
3.  What kind of vessel did you charter?
4.  What is the vessel name?
5.  What is the ETA of the vessel?
6.  What is the arrival time?
7.  How many days will the vessel be delayed?
8.  What will the delay charges?
9.  Which port will the vessel anchor to after discharging the last cargo in the Philippines?
10. What is the approximate duration it will take the vessel to reach our port?
11. What was the voyage of the vessel?
12. What is the gross...

email_chain.body:
Chris,

Please provide the information requested below:

December 15th.

email_chain.subject: Re: Tank Cleaning Inquiry - 20,000 MT Feed Oil

Shipping Manager

email_chain.subject: Dataset Decomposition Question
email_chain.body:
Let me make sure I understand correctly. Are you requesting that we decompose two decades of the same dataset into a more manageable number of, say, three to four datasets based on time ranges, so that I can apply this new algorithm to the entire dataset with more manageable storage?

I'm not quite sure what you mean by "decompose the first 10 years," but I'll guess that you're asking me to compress the first 10 years of data into a smaller amount. If that's your request, I'll note that the changes in the dataset have slowed considerably, so I would expect that the dataset for the 11th year would have a smaller compression ratio than the first ten years. Is that your intent?

email_chain.subject: Documents Required for Vessel Reservation
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Liang,

To proceed with reserving the vessel, please find below the list of required documents. Please provide one set of each:

1.  Bill of Lading
2.  P&I Club certificate
3.  A1 Tanker certificate
4.  Charter Party
5.  Release of any attachments or liabilities and other documents as may be requested by the mortgagee. A mortgagee's consent may be required.
6.  Master's account
7.  Draft survey
8.  Stability Certificate
9.  Safety equipment certificates
10. MCA Authorization to use electronic chart display and information system (ECDIS)
11. Oil record book
12. Third-party damage report and certificates
13. All maritime papers

Please let me know if you have any questions.

Best regards,

Jonathan Miller

email_chain.subject: Urgent: Matter regarding Wilson Family Cargo Detained in Liberia
email_chain.body:
Greetings!

My name is Mary Wells. As a financial advisor to the Wilson family, I am writing to you regarding cargo previously shipped on one of your vessels. 

The personal effects of my clients, Mrs. Glenda Wilson and Mr. Michael Wilson, were loaded onto your vessel (named MT "") and shipped from Southampton to Monrovia, Liberia, dated 10th May 2008. The goods, comprising one Rolls Royce and four pieces of household goods, have been detained by the Liberian authorities for the past three years. They claim that the customs documents were not properly filled.

This has forced Mrs. Glenda and Mr. Michael Wilson to incur significant demurrage and storage fees, which they are currently unable to pay.

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent: Matter regarding Wilson Family Cargo Detained in Liberia
email_chain.body:
Thanks for your email and apologies for my delay in replying.

I don’t believe the cargo is currently onboard our vessel. However, I have a scan of a document from the shipping line stating that they can assist with releasing the cargo. I'll forward it to you separately.

It seems there is a bureaucratic delay in Liberia, and you might need to employ a solicitor to assist. Do you have any contacts there?

Best regards,
Scott

email_chain.subject: Re: Diesel Oil Cargo - Rotterdam to Dakar
email_chain.body:
Ah yes, that explains a lot. We’ve not got any vessels available at present.

Regards,
Steve

email_chain.subject: Liberia Cargo Situation - Potential Solution
email_chain.body:
I have some information for you regarding what I’m sure will be your next job.

You need to visit Liberia. I’ve made an arrangement with the Liberia international trade and transportation secretariat to assist you with the release of the cargo for Ms. Wells's client.

I’ll send you a document of authority signed by the director of the importation department at the customs department of Liberia.

Do you have a representative there who will be able to pick it up on your behalf? If not, let me know, and I’ll contact the Liberian secretary.

Don’t worry about the rest; I’ll handle it.

Regards,
Steve

email_chain.subject: LPG Shipment Inquiry - Bahrain to Cairo
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Bluth,

We have 100 tons of LPG to ship from Bahrain to Cairo, Egypt. We are interested in your available 25,000 DWT vessel and would like to discuss laycan and ETA.

We would also like to know if your vessels typically carry clean or dirty goods to ensure compatibility.

Thank you,

Sophie Aubert

email_chain.subject: Re: LPG Shipment Inquiry - Bahrain to Cairo
email_chain.body:
Mr. Bluth,

Thank you for your reply.

Could you please provide an estimated FOB price and any further information regarding laycan, ETA, and IFO price? We are evaluating options for this shipment and while we might not require the earliest date you mentioned, we are also potentially interested in an earlier timeframe. The more details you can provide, the better.

Thank you,

Sophie Aubert

email_chain.subject: Re: LPG Shipment Inquiry - Bahrain to Cairo
email_chain.body:
Hello Sophie,

To provide you with an accurate quotation, could you please share the material specification for the LPG?

As a general rule, providing all necessary details upfront significantly reduces the back-and-forth communication and allows us to quickly determine if this opportunity aligns with our vessel capabilities and schedule.

Regards,

Michael Bluth

email_chain.subject: Re: LPG Shipment Inquiry - Bahrain to Cairo
email_chain.body:
Ms. Bluth,

Thank you for your reply.

The LPG specification includes the following headings: C3+ Headings 2711, 2712, 2903, 2905, 290

Thank you,
Sophie Aubert

email_chain.subject: Re: LPG Shipment Inquiry - Bahrain to Cairo - Material Specification
email_chain.body:
Sophie,

While those headings are helpful, we'll need a more detailed material specification to provide an accurate freight quotation. We cannot offer a binding quote without that document. 

Providing a detailed specification is standard practice and ensures we can meet your cargo's specific handling requirements. If you can provide a rough estimate based on the headings listed, please note that the numbers will update once we have the full material specs.

Regards,

Michael Bluth

email_chain.subject: Re: LPG Shipment Inquiry - Bahrain to Cairo - Material Specification
email_chain.body:
Thank you for your offer.

Please, add the insurance amount, insurance rates, and freight charges.

Thank you,

Sophie Aubert

email_chain.subject: Re: LPG Shipment Inquiry - Bahrain to Cairo - Material Specification
email_chain.body:
We would like to offer you a price of $100,000 as 5% deposit and $95,000 as 95% L/C at sight, plus $3,000 as insurance.

Please note that we do not include the freight charge in our offer because the shipper is responsible for freight.

email_chain.subject: Caprolactam Cargo Inquiry - Cotonou to Dover
email_chain.body:
Dear Geraldine,

We'd like to ship 300 MT of caprolactam from Cotonou to Dover. Could you please advise on the availability of after-hours berthing and if we can load onto a vessel berthed at the South Container Terminal?

Regards,
Pauline

email_chain.subject: Re: Caprolactam Cargo Inquiry - Cotonou to Dover
email_chain.body:
Thanks, Pauline,

I've checked the schedules. Are you referring to the Commodore? It's our weekly spot cargo service, primarily loading containers for France.

The Commodore typically berths at the South Container Terminal, but berthing there this week is unavailable due to full occupancy and the established berthing order.

The South Container Terminal berths are allocated in the following order: 5, 1, 2, 4, 7, 3, 6.

This week, the Commodore is arriving from Kingston on Wednesday. Berth 6 South is the first available slot for that vessel, and she is scheduled to sail to Cherbourg on Friday night.

I hope this information is helpful.

Regards,
Geraldine

email_chain.subject: Bulk Cargo Berthing Availability Next Week

email_chain.body:

email_chain.subject: Addressing Current Business Levels
email_chain.body:
Deidra,

I thought it would be useful to start a dialogue about our current business situation. Do you agree that January's performance levels are unsustainable? If so, what initiatives do you think would be most effective in increasing our business volume?

With best regards,

Teo

email_chain.subject: Re: Addressing Current Business Levels
email_chain.body:
Teo,

While I'm hesitant to commit to specifics immediately, I agree that addressing the January figures is crucial. One approach we could explore is strategically reducing prices to stimulate a significant increase in business volume. What are your initial thoughts on this?

With best regards,

Deidra

email_chain.subject: Re: Addressing Current Business Levels
email_chain.body:
Teo,

I'm not inherently against the idea of price reductions, but I need to be convinced it's beneficial for the business in the long term. We both agree January's levels are unsustainable, and I believe that reducing prices to increase volume is a better strategy than resorting to layoffs.

With best regards,

Deidra

email_chain.subject: Re: Addressing Current Business Levels
email_chain.body:
Teo,

Let's continue this conversation by jointly defining projected business levels in both the short and long term, specifically under a scenario of sustained price reductions. What is your current thinking on those potential outcomes?

With best regards,

Deidra

email_chain.subject: Steam Coal Shipment to Tocopilla, Chile - Inquiry
email_chain.body: Could you please provide your best rates for a 150 MT shipment of steam coal to Tocopilla, Chile? We require a complete quotation including all freight, brokerage, storage, and other relevant charges.

email_chain.subject: Steam Coal Requirements - Romco Mining Ltd.
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir/Madam,

My name is Douglas Brown, Director of Romco Mining Ltd. Romco is involved in the mining and export of various types of coal from different regions. Our requirements for steam coal are as follows:

Coal Specifications:

*   Sulphur: 1.5% max
*   Calorific Value: 6,000 kcal/kg min
*   Ash Content: 15% max
*   Moisture Content: 5% max
*   Volatile Matter: 23% max
*   Other Minerals: 18% max
*   Fines: 5% max

With quality standards like these, I am confident that you will have no problem selling your coal in any market, provided the price is competitive. Please send us your price per ton CIF Antofagasta. We will review it and get back to you.

Regards,
Douglas Brown
Romco Mining Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Re: Steam Coal Requirements - Romco Mining Ltd.
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Brown,

Thank you for your email and interest in our steam coal.

We look forward to receiving your offers at your convenience. In the meantime, we would like to invite you to visit our website at [insert website address here]. You can find detailed information about our company, subsidiaries, and staff there. You can also take a virtual tour to view our mining and processing facilities.

Our website has been recently updated for optimal viewing on mobile devices.

Regards,
Ron Skye

email_chain.subject: Re: Steam Coal Requirements - Romco Mining Ltd.
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Skye,

Thank you for the prompt response. I have reviewed your website. It is very impressive, with convenient navigation and an intuitive layout. The organization of all sections is excellent. I particularly appreciate the Product section, where I found data regarding your coal quality, the Quality section outlining the standards you meet, and the Health and Safety and Environment sections, which clearly demonstrate your commitment to worker conditions and operational safety – goals we strongly share.

The visual tour was also very informative, especially the mine and processing plant pictures.

Could you please send us your current prices and complete specifications for your steam coal product?

Regards,
Douglas Brown
Romco Mining Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Re: Steam Coal Requirements - Romco Mining Ltd.
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Brown,

Thank you for your complimentary feedback on our website.

Regarding your inquiry, we are unable to meet your requirement of a maximum of 18% for other minerals in our steam coal product. Please consider other offers.

Regards,
Ron Skye

email_chain.subject: Re: Steam Coal Requirements - Romco Mining Ltd.
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Skye,

Thank you for the quick reply. Could you provide some more detail on why your product cannot meet the maximum 18% "other minerals" specification?

Best regards,
Douglas Brown
Romco Mining Ltd.

email_chain.subject: Voyage Inquiry: 3,000 MT Motors Singapore to Colombo - ETA April 1st
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Batra,

We are planning to ship 3,000 MT of motors from Singapore to Colombo, aiming for arrival around April 1st. Would your vessel be available for a short-term voyage? We would also like to know your flexibility regarding ballast conditions for this route.

Best regards,
Ernest Chan

email_chain.subject: Re: Voyage Inquiry: 3,000 MT Motors Singapore to Colombo - ETA April 1st
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Chan,

The "Coastline" is currently berthed at Kakinada on the Indian coast. I expect to receive her draft survey report on or around March 25th. Her current charterers are assessing bunker requirements for a potential voyage to Singapore; however, we anticipate being able to release the vessel from her current fixture as early as March 26th for a repositioning voyage to Singapore.

Regarding ballast conditions, you could potentially contact "Coastline's" current charterers, "Sambalino" (same ownership as Coastline), as they will be completing a short-haul fixture and may be in a position to proceed immediately to Singapore in ballast. Alternatively, you may prefer Coastline to proceed in ballast and bunker in advance of loading.

Please let me know if you require any further information.

Best regards,
Arun Batra

email_chain.subject: Re: Voyage Inquiry: 3,000 MT Motors Singapore to Colombo - ETA April 1st
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Batra,

Could you explore the following options with your owners for our shipment? We're assessing the feasibility of using either the "Coastline" or the "Sambalino".

1.  Send the "Coastline" from Kakinada to *Colombo* to arrive in 6 days.
2.  Send the "Coastline" from Kakinada to *Colombo* to arrive in 10 days.
3.  Send the "Sambalino" from *Colombo* to the Singapore loading port to arrive in 6 days.
4.  Send the "Sambalino" from *Colombo* to the Singapore loading port to arrive in 10 days.

I will forward the draft survey as soon as it's received. Please let me know if you require any other information in the meantime.

Thanks,
Ernest Chan

email_chain.subject: Re: Voyage Inquiry: 3,000 MT Motors Singapore to Colombo - ETA April 1st
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Batra,

Thank you for sending the Sambalino draft survey. I am pleased to inform you that based on current scheduling, Sambalino would arrive in Colombo in 6 days (option 3 in my previous email). We expect to send you the draft survey of the Coastline shortly.

Best regards,
Ernest Chan

email_chain.subject: Vessel Availability and Cargo Opportunities
email_chain.body:
Respected all,

We are sometimes facing challenges in securing optimal voyages for our vessels due to tonnage requirements and delivery date constraints.

What is the recommended strategy in such situations? Is it preferable to prioritize keeping our vessels active, even with potentially less profitable cargoes, or to hold vessels awaiting better tonnage opportunities and more favorable delivery schedules?

I would appreciate your insights and experiences regarding this matter.

Regards,
Dinesh

email_chain.subject: RE: Freight Quote Request: 3,200MT Steel - Nagoya to Singapore
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir,

We have contacted PT. Tazkia Shipbroking Service regarding your inquiry.

The inquiry to the broker is:

"We have ship owners with two vessels available for charter, suitable for onvoy cargo, full charter. One vessel can carry 4,500 MT of Steel Plate JIS SGCC, and the other 3,000 MT of steel coil Grade SGCC, loading Nagoya to India and then India to Italy."

Please advise when your vessel is next available for such cargo.

Regards

email_chain.subject: Vessel Broker Information
email_chain.body:
Dear Col,

The above refers to a vessel broker who also has connections with an insurance company underwriter, which is associated with another insurance company. This arrangement dates back to 2006 (11/19/06).

However, we did not anticipate this broker working directly with the cargo owner. Please note that all IMO charges are included after prepayment.

Regards, team

email_chain.subject: Vessel Availability - Sohar
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir,

Our ship is currently berthed at Sohar, discharging a cargo of urea. Discharge will be completed within a few hours, and we will be seeking our next cargo.

If you have any cargo inquiries, please let me know your proposal.

We are ready to carry any type of cargo suitable for the vessel's capacity, with an estimated 40 days in ballast.

You are requested to send any cargo inquiries directly to the owner's email address. The owner will then be responsible for handling all inquiries related to that cargo.

Please advise all parties that there is no need to send cargo details through an agent. Dealing directly with the owner will save on agency fees for cargo discharge at the port.

email_chain.subject: DFRA Vessels - Cargo Negotiation
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Cullen,

I'm sorry that we couldn’t reach an agreement regarding the cargoes on the DFRA vessels.

I understand that if my offer of $5.25 per unit is not satisfactory, then freight should be negotiated at the price of an alternative vessel. I look forward to hearing your proposal.

Many thanks,

Ed

email_chain.subject: Re: DFRA Vessels - Cargo Negotiation
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Ed,

We regret that DFRA was unable to fulfill the commitment given to you by the master of the DFRA vessel and express our sympathy for the difficulties this must have caused your company.

If you would like to enter into discussions for a future contract, we will gladly take this up with you.

Regarding the cargoes already on board, a payment may be possible, but it will not be possible at a higher rate than the rate quoted for the passage itself, i.e., $5.25 per unit.

We await your instructions.

With best wishes,

Cullen

email_chain.subject: Re: DFRA Vessels - Cargo Negotiation
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Cullen,

I know you indicated that a rate higher than $5.25 wouldn't be possible, but I thought I would ask anyway. We've recently found ourselves in serious financial trouble and are struggling to make payroll next week.

I'm hoping you might be able to show some leniency in this situation. We know DFRA is a large and successful company. Perhaps you could allow us to use your vessel, and we would pay back the difference once we've had some time to recover financially. 

We appreciate your time and understanding. We trust you'll consider our request carefully.

Best regards,
Ed

email_chain.subject: Re: DFRA Vessels - Cargo Negotiation
email_chain.body:
Dear Ed,

I'm sorry to hear about your company's financial difficulties. However, I am not able to offer terms outside of our initial agreement. Our rules are strict, and we must adhere to the contract. 

I hope you're able to resolve your situation. 

Sincerely,
Cullen

email_chain.body:

email_chain.subject: URGENT: Outstanding Payment for Previous Shipping Agreement
email_chain.body:
Dear Peter,

A while ago, we agreed you would carry goods on my behalf to Durban, and I paid US$2800 as per our agreement. However, I have not heard back from you or your company since. 

Could you please provide an update on this matter? Have you received the money? Was it applied towards my shipment? Your swift response would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks,
Rudi

email_chain.subject: Re: URGENT: Outstanding Payment for Previous Shipping Agreement
email_chain.body:
Dear Rudi,

Thank you for your patience. I sincerely apologize for the delay in response and the lack of communication.

The reason for the hold-up is that a separate cargo shipment of ours encountered issues clearing customs in South Africa. As a direct result, I haven't been able to access funds necessary to fulfill outstanding obligations, including the payment related to our previous agreement.

We are working diligently to resolve this. I've been in contact with customs officials, and they've indicated a possible resolution where they can release our goods, despite a discrepancy in paperwork (the cargo is ours, but the paperwork lists a slightly different company name). If I can access those funds within the next few days, I will immediately remit the US$2800 to you and make arrangements to ensure you receive it promptly.

Again, I apologize for the inconvenience and appreciate your understanding.

Sincerely,
Peter

email_chain.subject: Re: URGENT: Outstanding Payment for Previous Shipping Agreement
email_chain.body:
Hi Peter,

Thank you for your email and explanation. I'm sorry to hear about the issues you're facing with customs. However, I'm a little unclear – could you elaborate on what you mean when you say your "money has failed to get through"? I'm keen to understand the exact nature of the problem you're encountering. Also, what's...

email_chain.body:
Hi Adam,

Good day!

Thank you for your inquiry. Our website is currently advertising a 6% discount on select services. Based on the information provided, here is a preliminary estimate for your shipment:

| Carrier | Ocean Freight (USD) | Cost Savings | Consignee/Port Load |
|---|---|---|---| 
| Sea Land | 1,862 | 3% | Long Beach |
|  |  |  |  |
| Shippers/Port Origin |  |  |  |
| Port | 1,858 |  | Westport |
| Amount | 362 |  |  |
| Port of Discharge |  |  |  |
| Long Beach |  | 6% OFF | Total in US $
|  |  |  | Payments |

Fine Print:

*   **Westport:** We do not have local agents at this port. We only ship out from LA, Long Beach, or Hueneme.
*   **Destination:** Long Beach

This means we cannot arrange local delivery pickups, nor can we handle heavy handling activities at the port. These arrangements must be made independently by the shipment owner or a third-party company.

email_chain.subject: Cargo Transport Request: Used Milkers - Lydenburg to Gaborone
email_chain.body:
Hi Jane,

We're interested in transporting a cargo of used milkers from Lydenburg, South Africa to Gaborone, Botswana. Could you please provide details for loading and unloading procedures at both locations, along with a comprehensive logistics and transport plan?

Thanks,
Karen

email_chain.subject: RE: Cargo Transport Request: Used Milkers - Lydenburg to Gaborone
email_chain.body:
Hello Jane,

Further to Karen's email, the milkers will arrive in Lydenburg from Cape Town by ship on July 28, 2016. We require road transport from Lydenburg to Gaborone, Botswana. 

Please provide your transport plan and associated costs.

Sincerely,
Aaron

email_chain.subject: RE: Cargo Transport Request: Used Milkers - Lydenburg to Gaborone
email_chain.body:
Hi Aaron,

Yes, we can handle the milkers from the ship in Lydenburg and transport them to Gaborone. We plan to use tippers and 40ft containers for the transport. We will receive the milkers in Lydenburg and deliver them to a designated location in Gaborone for your collection.

Our transport costs are as follows:

- Lydenburg to Gaborone: R7,000 per tipper
- Load, transport, and discharge at Gaborone: R12,000 per

Please let us know the exact arrival date and time of the ship in Lydenburg so we can finalize our collection plan.

Sincerely,
Bridget

email_chain.subject: RE: Cargo Transport Request: Used Milkers - Lydenburg to Gaborone
email_chain.body:
Hello Bridget,

Thank you for the logistics plan. The milkers will arrive on July 27, 2016, at 09:00. The ship will berth in Lydenburg at 09:00 but will be at anchor awaiting customs clearance and paperwork.

Please pick up the milkers from the ship at 09:00 as the captain plans to depart for Cape Town at 13:00 the same day.

Also, please confirm whether you prefer to transport the milkers from Lydenburg to Gaborone by tippers or trucks, and we will prepare an official order.

Regards,
Mark

email_chain.subject: Freight Rate Request - Rubber Shipment Guangzhou to Manila
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Shipper,

Could you please provide a freight rate for a 2,000MT shipment of rubber from Guangzhou to Manila?

Regards,

Drew Wong

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Rate Request - Rubber Shipment Guangzhou to Manila
email_chain.body:
Hi Drew,

Thank you for your email. To provide an accurate quote, please confirm the following details:

*   **From:** (Port/Location)
*   **Destination:** (Port/Location)
*   **Quantity:** (MT or other unit)
*   **Payment Terms:**
*   **Export License:** (Confirmation of availability)
*   **Desired Delivery Time:**

Thanks,

Ting

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Rate Request - Rubber Shipment Guangzhou to Manila - Details
email_chain.body:
Dear Ting,

Please find the shipment details below:

*   **From:** Guangzhou, China
*   **Destination:** Manila, Philippines
*   **Quantity:** 2,000MT (approximately 28,000 boxes, Gross weight approx. 2,400 tons. 1 box @ approx. 0.0857 tons)
*   **Payment Terms:**  The exporter shall arrange a Bank Letter of Credit to the order of Kimono Inc. (Korean Export Company). Cash / Bank Cashier Check in US Dollar at 60% of value in the Letter of Credit. The balance shall be paid in cash upon confirmation of inspection results at origin.
*   **Export License:** Appropriate customs and commercial licenses will be obtained.
*   **Delivery Time:** By sea, target is within 21 days ex-works. We can also explore air freight; estimated 15-30 days, subject to your recommendation and agreement.

Sincerely,

Drew Wong

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Rate Request - Rubber Shipment Guangzhou to Manila - Details
email_chain.body:
Dear Drew,

Thank you for the details. Please note the following terms and conditions:

1.  Your company shall provide a Letter of Credit in favor of Hapag-Lloyd (Shipping line) to cover freight charges.
2.  You will be responsible for all applicable taxes/duties (local, state, and federal) and associated costs.
3.  Your company will bear the cost of the shipment, including packing and insurance.
4.  Payment for the shipment is due on the 10th day of the last month of each quarter.
5.  Shipping schedules are to be agreed upon directly between your company and Hapag-Lloyd.
6.  Estimated delivery is 30 days after the shipment date.

Best regards,

Ting

P.S. Our estimated cost for 28,000 boxes is $70,000, equating to $35 per box or $35/0.0857 per kilo.

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: Lumber Shipment - Vancouver to Inverness
email_chain.body:
Hi Lyle,

We are considering shipping 35,000 metric tons of lumber from Vancouver to Inverness. Could you advise us on the import restrictions for pine into Inverness?

Warmly,
Logan

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Lumber Shipment - Vancouver to Inverness
email_chain.body:
Hi Logan,

Thanks for your email.

Unfortunately, the import of pine lumber from Vancouver to Inverness is currently prohibited due to import restrictions. I'm afraid we won't be able to proceed with this shipment as it stands.

Best regards,
Lyle

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Lumber Shipment - Vancouver to Inverness
email_chain.body:
Hi Lyle,

Thank you for the update.

Regarding the import restrictions, I am trying to understand the nuances. I came across information suggesting an alternative where the importer can certify compliance with U.S. law, rather than definitively proving it. My concern lies in differentiating between logs and lumber, specifically sawn vs. unsawn lumber. Would a commitment to a formal inspection be sufficient to satisfy customs requirements?

I'm also researching import/export certificates to ensure compliance. Would this be applicable in this case to assure the importing country that U.S. laws are followed?

Regards,
Logan

email_chain.subject: VLGC Cargo Booking Request - Fujairah to Rotterdam
email_chain.body:
Hi Jack,

I would be happy to book a 7,000 MT VLGC cargo for August from Fujairah to Rotterdam. We're looking to arrange bookings for 3-5 vessels as soon as possible. Could you please forward the broking team details and any further relevant information?

Thanks,
Vanessa

email_chain.subject: Charter Vessel Requirements - JP54, Asia to West Africa
email_chain.body:
Jack,

As mentioned previously, please find attached our company's standard terms and conditions, which we require you to sign and return. A similar request will also be sent to LME (your broker).

Regarding our booking requirements, as discussed, we're looking to book 5-7 vessels on a voyage charter basis for cargo sizes ranging from 1,000-10,000 MT, with the following specifications:

*   Commodity: JP54
*   Origin: Asia
*   Destination: West Africa

We require 1 or 2 vessels with either DAP or CIF incoterms for each cargo.

Additionally, we are interested in chartering other vessels on shorter routes for durations of 1-2 weeks each, with the same freight terms applying as above.

We would like to arrange these charters regularly, aiming to finalize bookings during June and July.

Looking forward to your response.

Best,
Vanessa

email_chain.subject: Follow Up: Charter Vessel Requirements & Signed T&Cs
email_chain.body:
Jack,

Just wanted to check if you had received and signed the attached Terms and Conditions. We have now received the signed copies from all your brokers, which will be forwarded to you soon.

Regarding the additional chartered vessels, as you can see from the attached schedules, there is some uncertainty in both Asia and West Africa, potentially making securing suitable vessels difficult. We will explore available options and provide you with details as soon as possible.

We have also prepared a preliminary list of cargoes we are targeting to book for each vessel in the first week of August (see attached).

Looking forward to your comments.

Best,
Vanessa

email_chain.subject: Urgent: Request for Cargo Options in Asia - No Response
email_chain.body:
Jack,

It has been over four weeks since our last email, and we have yet to receive a response. We urgently need you to provide us with options for some of the cargo originating in Asia. We previously requested this through your broker, LME, but have also received no response from them.

Please advise as soon as possible.

Regards,
Vanessa

email_chain.subject: Action Required: Charter Vessel Options & Cargo Information
email_chain.body:
Jack,

I am writing to you in your capacity as the owner of General Products, concerning our previous communications regarding chartered vessels. We have not received any response to our requests.

We are providing the attached information again, including the charter vessels we are considering and the corresponding cargoes. We have requested options for these cargoes previously, but unfortunately, we have not received any replies to our emails.

Please review the attached documents and provide us with suitable vessel options so we can proceed with the bookings.

As you are aware, timely responses are crucial in this market.

Regards,
Vanessa

email_chain.subject: Regretful Notice: Cancellation of Booking Arrangements
email_chain.body:
Jack,

It is with disappointment that I must inform you that we have had to proceed with another company to secure our required vessels. We are finding it increasingly difficult to meet our booking deadlines due to the extended time it is taking to receive responses from your team. We can no longer continue down this path.

Sincerely,
Vanessa

email_chain.body:

email_chain.subject: Re: Sugar Inquiry - Santos to Saudi Arabia
email_chain.body:

Thank you for your prompt response. I am looking for a vessel to ship 12,000 MT of sugar from Santos to Saudi Arabia, loading in June. If the vessel cannot accommodate 12,000 MT, please let me know what quantity your vessels can carry so that I may check internally. 

Best regards,
Victoria

Thank you for your email. To proceed with your sugar vessel inquiry, could you please provide the following details:

*   Specific port in Brazil (Santos has multiple terminals)?
*   Precise delivery/loading period in June?
*   Target freight rate (USD/MT)?

Regards,
Pedro

Regarding the berth in Santos, which berths are you able to work with? Knowing this will help determine if we can proceed.

email_chain.body:

Pedro, I am available by phone if you'd like to discuss this opportunity. Let me know when it's convenient.

email_chain.subject: Shipping Estimate Request - 7,000 MT Crude Oil - Dhaka to Miami
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Salter,

Could you please provide us with an estimate for shipping 7,000 MT of crude oil from Dhaka to Miami, including all necessary insurance charges?

Kind regards,

Brijesh

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Estimate Request - 7,000 MT Crude Oil - Dhaka to Miami
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Salter,

Brijesh here, following up on my previous email. 

You previously mentioned an estimate of $9,288. Is this a one-time charge or a recurring fee? If it is recurring, could we have a monthly breakdown of the charges? I would also appreciate it if you could share some recent examples of monthly costs for similar shipments.

Thanks again.

Have a good day!

Brijesh

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Estimate Request - 7,000 MT Crude Oil - Dhaka to Miami
email_chain.body:
Hi Brijesh,

Unfortunately, prices have increased slightly due to recent global economic turbulence. Our current estimated cost to ship crude oil from Dhaka to Miami is around $3,000. These prices are expected to be more stable after April 30th.

I hope you understand, and I apologize for any inconvenience this may cause.

Regards,
Rishi Salter

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Estimate Request - 7,000 MT Crude Oil - Dhaka to Miami
email_chain.body:
Hi Rishi Salter,

Thank you for clarifying the shipping details. I'm a little confused, though. My previous email referenced a prior estimate of $9,288, but your last email quoted $3,000. Could you please clarify the discrepancy?

Additionally, could you still provide a monthly breakdown of the prices charged for similar crude oil transportation routes? Recent examples would be very helpful.

Thanks!

Brijesh

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Estimate Request - 7,000 MT Crude Oil - Dhaka to Miami
email_chain.body:
Hi Rishi Salter,

Thank you for taking the time to help me with this matter.

In your previous email, you mentioned that the price would be more fixed after April 30th. Would it be possible to get an idea of what the new price might be after that date? I understand if providing a concrete number is not possible at this stage.

Also, could you please provide more details on the services your company offers for this specific shipping route (Dhaka to Miami)?

Best regards,

Brijesh

email_chain.subject: Re: Crude Oil Shipment Request - Saudi Arabia to Oman
email_chain.body:
Dear Mike,

Thank you for your inquiry. We can accommodate your 4,000 MT crude oil shipment with a freight rate of $15 per MT. 

Our standard laytime policy for oil tanker shipments is typically a maximum of 14 days. To finalize the scheduling and confirm the laytime details, could you please provide more specific information regarding the destination port and preferred delivery window? Also, let's discuss payment terms.

With regards,
Zachary

email_chain.subject: Re: Crude Oil Shipment Request - Saudi Arabia to Oman
email_chain.body:

I hope this message finds you well.

*   Destination: Shallow seaport in Oman

Sincerely,
Mike

email_chain.subject: Re: Crude Oil Shipment Request - Saudi Arabia to Oman
email_chain.body:

email_chain.body:

email_chain.subject: Legal Action Regarding Outstanding Payment for 4,000MT Unbleached Sulphate Pulp
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Chu,

Please be advised that I have now been compelled to refer your company to our solicitors in regards to the outstanding payment for the 4,000MT of unbleached sulphate pulp purchased in March of last year. This matter has been ongoing for nearly twelve months, during which time you have repeatedly promised payment but failed to deliver.

Your consistent failure to honor your commitments has resulted in a considerable waste of our time and resources. This is my final attempt to contact you directly. I strongly urge you to take this matter with the utmost seriousness, as our solicitors will be pursuing all available legal avenues to recover the debt.

Kind Regards,
Oliver Moussa

email_chain.subject: Re: LNG Freight Enquiry - 6,000 MT Mopan to Antwerp - July
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Manwell,

Thank you for your enquiry. We have provided you with a proposal for the movement of 6,000 MT of LNG from the US Gulf to Antwerp in July. 

The price for the cargo, as outlined in the attached proposal, is based on a fixed FOB rate. We can also offer this cargo with a freight cost neutral (FCN) option. This is calculated on the basis of a CBM charge of $1.20 per CBM, based on the CBM declared on the cargo.

In both scenarios, the CIF rate is fixed, and cargo would be delivered to the discharge port on the agreed-upon schedule. Regarding port rotation, this would be at the shipper's request and is subject to prior agreement between all parties.

Please review the attached proposal and send back a copy of the commercial terms (either C/P or C&F).

Best Regards,
Mr. Parkin

email_chain.subject: RE: LNG Freight Enquiry - Shell Concerns re: CBM Charge
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Dalschaert,

Further to our recent email communication regarding the LNG freight quote, I am writing to inform you that our chartering division has raised an enquiry with London regarding our agreement with their provisions in terms of the GCM/Voyage charterparty (as drafted by BIMCO).

This charterparty refers to a CBM charge of $1.20 per CBM as the basis of calculation for a FCN charter. This rate was introduced to reflect the charterer's ability to make a simple and accurate calculation based on the CBM's stated on their cargo. Our customer, Shell, has explained to us that they will not proceed with this arrangement for their LNG shipments unless the CBM charge is less than 90 cents/cbm.

We are also requesting that BIMCO changes the wording of the applicable provision of the GCM/Voyage Charterparty to ensure...

email_chain.subject: Proposed Amendment to GCM/Voyage Charterparty - CBM Charge
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Dalschaert,

In line with our previous email communication, please find attached a proposed amendment to the current GCM/Voyage charterparty draft that BIMCO has produced for consideration.

The proposed amendment is as follows:

/................/
18.30.1 Freight shall be calculated at $1.20/cbm based on the CBM declared by the cargo 
/................/

This would be effective for cargoes delivered after 1st January 2003.

Please let us know if you would be agreeable to this amendment, and, if so, we will pursue this with BIMCO.

With many thanks,
Best Regards,
David

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for 8,000 MT Dry Petcoke to Port Elizabeth
email_chain.body:
Greetings Mrs. Bird,

We are currently evaluating several tenders for an 8,000 MT cargo of dry petcoke destined for Port Elizabeth. We are uncertain whether the US Gulf Coast suppliers collectively possess enough readily available tonnage to meet our requirements for this particular shipment.

Could you please provide estimated available tonnages from your US Gulf sources? Also, please inform us of any other potential points of origin that could offer competitive pricing and availability.

Kind regards,
Lewis Brereton

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for 8,000 MT Dry Petcoke to Port Elizabeth
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Brereton,

Thank you for your inquiry. We are aware of the M/V Ostende's planned loading of petcoke from Grays Harbor, with delivery scheduled for early November. However, for the volume you require, the US Gulf is indeed the most likely origin.

We currently anticipate having sufficient petcoke available from the US Gulf to fulfill all our charterers' requirements. However, please ensure you present all required documentation (full set of Bills of Lading (BLs), your Charter Party, LPA Form 1, and your most recent IOPPCA, etc.) to obtain our booking approval.

The US Gulf typically produces three grades of petcoke: a very fine grade, a coarse grade, and a lamellar (wax-contaminated) grade. We can book all three grades on an as-available basis. Please specify the grade required in your booking request.

We will update our website shortly with the latest availability information.

Sincerely,
Mrs. Bird

email_chain.subject: Urgent: Lost Delivery Documents - Invoice Issue
email_chain.body:
Tom,

I am writing to you as I need your help. A couple of days ago, I received an email regarding an unpaid invoice. Apparently, the payment is being held up because the delivery documents are missing.

I've been asked to obtain a copy of those documents. I'm trying to contact the person in charge, but I haven't been able to reach them yet. I will try again later this evening.

This is a considerable amount of money, and I'm concerned. My contact mentioned that getting a copy of the documents might be difficult, but didn't elaborate. Do you have any idea what the potential problem could be?

I need to understand the urgency and potential complications.

Best regards,
Tomas

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent: Lost Delivery Documents - Invoice Issue
email_chain.body:
Good afternoon Tom,

I am very sorry for the delay in responding. I need some assistance with understanding this email. Could you please help me interpret it correctly?

Best regards,
Tomas

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent: Lost Delivery Documents - Invoice Issue - Analysis Needed
email_chain.body:
Tom,

Could you help me? I want to verify my understanding of the email I sent earlier. I need to know if my interpretation is correct.

It seems the email is primarily about the lost delivery documents. Therefore, the writer is asking for help in locating the documents, not necessarily about directly paying the outstanding amount.

Could you please review the email's content and give me your analysis?

Thanks for your help.

I've been reviewing the email again, and I believe the core issue revolves around the missing documents impacting payment. There might be a misunderstanding somewhere.

Dear Tom,

Could you please share the result of your analysis as soon as possible? I want to be absolutely certain my interpretation is correct.

Best regards,
Tomas

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent: Lost Delivery Documents - Invoice Issue - Contract Implications
email_chain.body:
Tom,

I would appreciate it if you could double-check the email to ensure I haven't misinterpreted anything. If the underlying issue is a potential financial loss due to the missing documents, I need to take immediate action, as it could lead to a breach of contract. I will be in the office next week to address this.

Regards,
Tomas

Thanks for your help.

I've received your last email and I am now more confident that I understand the content correctly, thanks to your insights.

By the way, I will be out of the office next week, with limited email access.

Best regards,
Tomas

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent: Lost Delivery Documents - Invoice Issue - Manager's Reluctance
email_chain.body:
I am still looking for a way to ensure that the documents were not lost. The manager of my company is furious and uncooperative; he doesn't want to give me any help. I do not understand it, given our past relationship. What should I do? Could you advise me?

Tom,
I am sorry to have disturbed you.

Regards,
Tomas

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent: Lost Delivery Documents - Invoice Issue - Manager's Reluctance
email_chain.body:
Dear Tomas,

Your email is about getting assistance with the missing documents, not about a personal financial loss. 

The email is asking for help locating the documents. It seems your manager has been informed about the problem and should be providing support. Try to explain to him that the mistake was an oversight, not intentional, and that you need his help to resolve it. He should then be able to provide you with the necessary documents.

Best regards,
Tom

email_chain.subject: Re: Urgent: Lost Delivery Documents - Invoice Issue - Manager's Reluctance - Resolved
email_chain.body:
Tom,

Thanks for your help.

Sorry for disturbing you.

Bye

Best regards,
Tomas

email_chain.subject: Seeking Advice - Company Transition
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Hernandez,

I hope you are doing well. 

I believe we briefly met at the last GM Conference, though I don't think we've spoken since. I'm writing to you today because I'm concerned about the current situation at my company.

As you may know, our CEO, Mr. Smith, is leaving, and there are strong rumors he's heading to JPS. The news had a significant negative impact on our market capitalization; our stock was down 8 percent on the day of the announcement.

The plan is to appoint an interim replacement while a thorough search is conducted for a permanent successor. Obviously, this isn't the ideal time to be undergoing such a significant change, but it seems unavoidable.

With that said, I'm looking for your advice on how best to navigate and potentially turn this situation around, given your experience.

Best regards,

Jeff Miller

email_chain.subject: Shipping Quote Request - Diesel from Singapore to Savannah
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Sterling,

Could you please provide a quote for shipping approximately 13,000 MT of diesel from Singapore to Savannah, Georgia? 

Also, what is your standard free discharge time?

Thank you,

Ben

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Quote Request - Diesel from Singapore to Savannah
email_chain.body:
Dear Ben,

Thank you for your inquiry. To provide you with an accurate quote, I need some additional information:

*   Is the 13,000 MT ready to ship as one lot or in smaller lots?
*   What type of vessel are you considering?
*   What is the approximate quantity per shipment?
*   Is this a single shipment or a continuous cargo arrangement?
*   Will this be a spot charter or a contract?
*   Will the cargo be shipped in drums or in bulk?
*   What are your payment terms? Do you require an L/C, or will you be paying with cash?
*   Would you prefer a Cost & Freight (C&F) or Free On Board (FOB) rate?
*   What is the earliest date the cargo can be shipped?
*   Are you interested in a freight guarantee?
*   Will you be applying for a bank guarantee? If so, what type of guarantee do you require? Some banks require confirmation.

I look forward to your response.

Sincerely,

Mr. Sterling

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Quote Request - Diesel from Singapore to Savannah
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Sterling,

Thank you for the prompt response. Some of your questions are better directed at the charterer or buyer, but I can provide some answers:

*   **Is the 13,000 MT ready to ship as one lot or in smaller lots?** I have between 8,000 and 12,000 MT ready for immediate shipment, and the full 13,000 MT will be available within the next three weeks.
*   **What type of vessel are you considering?** A 75,000 MT T1 Double Hull Tanker.
*   **What is the approximate quantity per shipment?** Between 8,000 and 12,000 MT at a time.
*   **Is this a single shipment or a continuous cargo arrangement?** It will be a continuous shipment, with one voyage at a time.
*   **Will this be a spot charter or a contract?** Contract.

I hope this information is helpful. Please let me know if you require any further details.

Regards,

Ben

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: Vehicle Transport from Jakarta to Gioia Tauro
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Wong,

Our client, Automaker XYZ, is evaluating Gioia Tauro as a potential port for handling shipments of Toyota Camry vehicles originating in Jakarta, Indonesia. We are seeking experienced logistics providers for this route. Could you please advise on your experience with transporting vehicles from Jakarta to Gioia Tauro?

Regards,

Davina

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Vehicle Transport from Jakarta to Gioia Tauro
email_chain.body:
Dear Davina,

Thank you for your inquiry. Gioia Tauro Ports has significant experience handling vehicle shipments from Jakarta to Gioia Tauro. We have been facilitating this route for over ten years; our previous contract recently expired, and we are actively seeking new partnerships.

Typically, the vehicles are transported by sea from Jakarta to Genoa on specialized car carriers and then transferred by rail to Gioia Tauro. We have historically handled an average of 250 cars annually.

We are very interested in cooperating with you on this project and look forward to the possibility of a long-term relationship.

Regards,

Massimo

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: Vehicle Transport from Jakarta to Gioia Tauro
email_chain.body:
Dear Massimo,

Thank you for your detailed response. We are impressed with your company's experience and proven track record in transporting vehicles on this route. While your fleet may not be the largest on the market, we have found that smaller, specialized companies like yours often provide a higher quality and more dedicated service.

We are optimistic about the potential for a successful collaboration and hope to build a long-term relationship with Gioia Tauro Ports.

Regards,

Davina

email_chain.body:
Hello Captain G,

Just saw your response. To proceed, can we have a formal charter party in place by this Friday? And can you confirm your vessel can be ready to load next Tuesday?

Separately, I've secured some other potential cargo: 20,000 MT of methanol from Jubail, 3,500 MT of jatoba by June 7th, and 5,000 MT of caustic soda by May 23rd.

Alex

email_chain.subject: Crude Oil Freight Inquiry: Panama Canal to Singapore
email_chain.body:
Can you please provide a rate for shipping 10,000 MT of crude oil from the Panama Canal to Singapore? Could you also tell us your minimum order size and monthly capacity?

Regards,
Thomas Rosenthal

email_chain.subject: Re: Crude Oil Freight Inquiry: Panama Canal to Singapore
email_chain.body:
Regarding your inquiry for a delivery of 10,000 MT of crude oil from Panama to Singapore, please note the following conditions:

To secure the shipment of 10,000 MT, a preliminary agreement for a larger volume of 180,000,000 tons to be loaded at the Panama Canal and discharged in Singapore is required. An advance payment of US $2,700,000 is required to initiate this larger agreement. 

Upon receipt of the advance payment, you are required to:

1.  Provide a packing list.
2.  Load the cargo onto 5 vessels provided by us within 15 days.
This step serves as confirmation of your intention to complete the transaction and your ability to fulfill your obligations. Upon completion of loading, you must notify us in writing within 3 days.

email_chain.subject: Re: Crude Oil Freight Inquiry: Panama Canal to Singapore
email_chain.body:
Following your written confirmation of cargo loading, the remaining balance will be transferred to your account.

Failure to provide confirmation of cargo loading onto our vessels within 5 days of the initial 15-day loading period will result in the forfeiture of the advance payment.

email_chain.subject: Re: Crude Oil Freight Inquiry: Panama Canal to Singapore
email_chain.body:
To proceed with this arrangement and facilitate the balance payment in advance, we require the following assurances and documentation:

1.  Confirmation that the cargo has been loaded onto the 5 specified vessels. Please provide full details for each vessel, including photographs, to verify loading and prevent potential issues.

2.  Confirmation that our office in Latvia will receive the following documents within 5 days of your receipt of the balance payment:
    *   A complete agreement on the contract of carriage between your company and the vessel charterer(s), signed by all parties.
    *   Complete shipping documents, signed by all parties.
    *   The document for [Incomplete sentence in original, preserving it]. Please ensure all documentation is sent to our Latvia office by the specified deadline.

email_chain.subject: Angular 2 Email Input Validation Help
email_chain.body:
Notice how the email itself doesn't go into the input? That's where everything gets tricky. If you're using input with the type of email, then you should just do the following:

For starters, if you're using Angular 2, you'll want to import FormsModule.

Like so: import { FormsModule } from '@angular/forms';
Next, you'll need to add FormsModule to the imports array in the @NgModule declaration.

Like so: imports: [ BrowserModule, FormsModule ],

And you'll need to add [email] to the input tag.

This will give you an input that looks something like this:

email_chain.subject: Refractive Index Equation in Nature Article
email_chain.body:
Dear Professor Wim,

I was interested in your article about reflective materials in Nature. You presented two equations for refractive index in the article. I am trying to find a proof or derivation of one of those (specifically, the one that relates refractive index to wavelength, lambda, and the refractive index itself, n) and wanted to see if you knew of a suitable reference for it.

Thank you,
Daniel

email_chain.subject: Re: Refractive Index Equation in Nature Article
email_chain.body:
Hi Daniel,

Thank you for your message. The equation n = 1 - sqrt(1-f)/2 is a general one and can be found in most textbooks on electromagnetism and optics. I cited the reference where I first encountered it in my Nature paper; please check page 3. You can also find it in more recent books on plasmonics, for example, in a book by Jain.

Best,
Wim

email_chain.subject: Re: Refractive Index Equation in Nature Article
email_chain.body:
Hello Wim,

Do you happen to have any notes or references for the derivation of the equation, f2 = 1-2n, when n = 4*Pi/lambda*d*n*d?

Thanks,
Daniel

email_chain.subject: Re: Refractive Index Equation in Nature Article
email_chain.body:
Hi Daniel,

While your question isn't directly related to my website's content, I'm happy to respond via email.

The only literature I can think of are two references you've probably already found:

(1) P. Drude, Handbuch der Radiologie, Leipzig: Barth, 1922 (p. 369)
(2) N. Jain, C. J. Kryzhanovsky, and C. H. Chen, Excitation and Detection of Surface Plasmons on Gold Films. In: T. Zimmermann, and A. Berger, eds., Coherence, Statistics, and Quantum Optics IV (Springer, 2005) 146-165

Drude's book is foundational for metallic materials.

Best,
Wim

email_chain.subject: Re: Refractive Index Equation in Nature Article
email_chain.body:
Hi Wim,

Thanks for your reply. I've found those references and have already read them. I was hoping for a clearer derivation that shows how the refractive index in that specific form (d*n/d) relates to the frequency, lambda, and the amplitude of the refractive index.

Thanks again,
Daniel

email_chain.subject: Re: Refractive Index Equation in Nature Article
email_chain.body:
Hi Daniel,

I'm not entirely sure there *is* a perfectly clear derivation of the specific form you're looking for. You might find alternative explanations in other books, but I suspect those derivations may also lack the clarity you desire.

Perhaps someone else in the research community can offer a clearer derivation of f2 = 1-2n.

Best,
Wim

email_chain.body:
Good morning, Mr. Evin,

How are you today?

Yes, I'm coming to your house to learn. But, it's raining. My parents and my brother, Arian, can't come. We're waiting for a better day.

It's a big problem.
It's about rain.

Thank you.
Yours,
Kevin

email_chain.subject: Question about English & Movie Recommendation
email_chain.body:
Good afternoon. Glad to hear from you. Hope you are doing fine. Thank you so much for the great video. There is no doubt it is very helpful for us.

One question I have is when I send a message by email, can I use "This is" to introduce myself? I saw a very interesting movie at the cinema. It is about a cat with a magic ability. What do you think about it? The movie is really enjoyable.

Thanks a lot.
Kevin

email_chain.subject: Re: Question about English & Movie Recommendation
email_chain.body:
Hello Kevin,

Thank you so much for sending us a lovely song. Your friend Kevin is a great singer. Your English is really good, too. I'm happy you wrote to us. You can use "This is" to introduce your message. You can say something like "This is a song my friend Kevin sings." "This is an email I sent my friend Kelly last week."

You can ask a question and talk about a movie like this: "How was the movie about the cat with a magic ability? It sounds interesting." Or you can say, "I'm glad you liked the movie about the cat with a magic ability."

I hope you have a great day. Be well!
Olivia and the Yip sisters.

email_chain.subject: Subject Unknown
email_chain.body: Dear ___________, _____ Kind regards, ____

email_chain.subject: Subject Unknown
email_chain.body:
Please give me until [date] to respond further to your email dated [date].

I appreciate your email dated [date]. We are still analyzing our options and have reached no final conclusion. The timing of our acquisition of the remaining 15% is part of that analysis. In the meantime, the rest of our business remains as before and the Board of Directors of [ABC] will continue to oversee its management.

RBC Capital Markets
Jason McGroarty
(416) 842-6293

email_chain.subject: RE: [ANOTHER EMAIL OF THE SAME SUBJECT MATTER] - REMOVAL OF ASSETS FROM CONTROLS OF ABC
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Flippo,

I was copied on your email yesterday to Mr. Frank and Messrs. Calloway and Vaughn. Please be advised that pursuant to Section 14.4 of the Purchase Agreement dated November 4, 2004, we have placed certain assets that are subject to the asset transfer agreement that you recently sent over to us in our depository at 15 York St., in Toronto, to await the return of those assets to ABC. These assets are detailed in a list attached to our email of December 14, 2004, (see attachment A). I assume these are the assets that are under your custody. If you have any objections to this deposit, you must advise us.

email_chain.subject: RE: [ANOTHER EMAIL OF THE SAME SUBJECT MATTER] - REMOVAL OF ASSETS FROM CONTROLS OF ABC
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. McGroarty,

Thank you for your email. Please be advised that we have no objections to the list you provided to us. However, the list in question has not been previously reviewed by the Board of Directors of ABC and therefore we are unable to provide you with any information regarding the specific assets. It is our understanding that our list does not conform to the requirements of the Sale Agreement, particularly since the list reflects that we are permitted to retain certain files and information despite the fact that we are prohibited from using or retaining any ABC Confidential Information, as set out in the Sale Agreement. This is a concern to our Board of Directors.

Please be advised that your proposal to place certain of our assets in a depository pending return to ABC is inappropriate and contrary to the terms of the Sale Agreement. Specifically, Section 2.1(a)

email_chain.subject: RE: [ANOTHER EMAIL OF THE SAME SUBJECT MATTER] - REMOVAL OF ASSETS FROM CONTROLS OF ABC
email_chain.body:
I just spoke with Martin but I was copied on the email below.
Today is December 17th, 2004 and we continue to have no approved and executed sale agreement. In the meantime, ABC is purging all of our assets and information, and sending same to various unidentified third parties and law firms.
We simply cannot accept these proposals in light of ABC's wrongful purging of our assets. All of the discussion contained in your email is irrelevant in light of the purging. Please provide us with a confirmed list of all assets that have been sent to third parties and their names.

email_chain.subject: RE: [ANOTHER EMAIL OF THE SAME SUBJECT MATTER] - REMOVAL OF ASSETS FROM CONTROLS OF ABC
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. McGroarty,

You must withdraw any claim that ABC has breached the purchase agreement. You are not our trading partner; you are our custodian, holding assets that belong to ABC until such time as the transaction is closed.

email_chain.subject: D2 Shipment from Singapore to Tozeur - Impact of Strikes
email_chain.body:
Good morning Joseph,

We're looking to move 500 MT of D2 fuel ex Singapore to Tozeur in early August. Do you have any insights into how the current strikes are affecting cargo movements out of Singapore? Any information you can provide would be greatly appreciated.

Kind regards,

Sally Fielding

email_chain.subject: Re: D2 Shipment from Singapore to Tozeur - Impact of Strikes
email_chain.body:
Hi Sally,

Yes, we've seen significant delays and some cancellations due to the industrial action at the port. It's impacting various types of cargo, including fuel.

Kind regards,

Joseph Miller

email_chain.subject: Re: D2 Shipment from Singapore to Tozeur - Impact of Strikes
email_chain.body:
Hi Joseph,

Thanks for the quick response. Do you have any idea how long these delays are expected to continue? We're wondering if it's worth waiting to see if the situation improves or if we should start exploring alternative routings to ensure timely delivery.

Best regards,

Sally Fielding

email_chain.subject: Re: D2 Shipment from Singapore to Tozeur - Impact of Strikes
email_chain.body:
Hi Sally,

Unfortunately, with the strikes still ongoing, it's difficult to predict when cargo movements will return to normal. I would advise that you consider alternative routings as a precautionary measure. The delays and cancellations are likely to persist in the short term.

Kind regards,

Joseph Miller

email_chain.subject: Contract Review: Rotterdam-Naples Freight Containers
email_chain.body:
Good morning Mr. Gonzales,

Our team has been reviewing the container freight contract for shipments between Rotterdam and Naples for the past few weeks. We're finalizing our market analysis and wanted to check if you had any further questions or suggestions at this stage.

Regards,
Christa Meier

email_chain.subject: RE: Contract Review: Rotterdam-Naples Freight Containers
email_chain.body:
Morning Christa,

If I remember correctly, the current contract specifies containers shipped only by steamship. I believe this is outdated, as modern container ships have largely replaced steamships for this route.

I'd like to amend the contract to include all types of modern container ships and to add an expiration date to the agreement.

Regards,
Hugo Gonzales

email_chain.subject: RE: Contract Review: Rotterdam-Naples Freight Containers
email_chain.body:
Hi Hugo,

I've been looking into the historical context. I found some documentation from the 1970s indicating that a significant number of containers were still transported by steamship, even though it was generally a less economical option. 

What are your thoughts on the relevance of this older data for our current agreement?

Regards,
Christa Meier

email_chain.subject: RE: Contract Review: Rotterdam-Naples Freight Containers
email_chain.body:
Hi Christa,

That's no doubt true that steamships were used. However, steamships pose significant risks to containers, even modern ones. The vibrations from the steam engines and potential leaks from the boilers can damage a substantial portion of the containers during transit. That's why we...

email_chain.subject: Ethylene Shipment Inquiry - Houston to Antwerp
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Edmonds,

We are planning to ship approximately 8,600 MT of ethylene from Houston to Antwerp. Could you please provide a freight quotation for this shipment?

Also, please advise on the flexibility of your vessels' scheduling windows for loading in Houston around late April.

Thank you,

Mariam Khan

email_chain.subject: Re: Ethylene Shipment Inquiry - Houston to Antwerp
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Khan,

Thank you for your inquiry. We understand you are seeking a vessel for an ethylene export from Houston, US Gulf Coast, to Antwerp, Belgium. We also understand that the chosen vessel may require bunkering in Houston or repositioning to Houston. 

Our initial assessment is based on a voyage from Houston to Antwerp, with cargo discharge expected within 21 days and loading to be completed within 24 hours of the vessel's arrival in Houston. The vessel should be available for loading up to April 25th.

To proceed with a voyage quotation, our ethylene specialists require the following documents:

- Bunker Delivery Note (for any recent bunkering)
- Documentation authorizing bunkering at Houston (if required)
- Vessel Details for identification (IMO number, full name)
- Recent Dry Dock Certificate
- Current SGS Dry Cargo Logbook

Please provide these documents at your earliest convenience, so we can expedite your quotation.

Sincerely,

Robert Edmonds

email_chain.subject: Software Engineer Interview - Preparation
email_chain.body:
Dear Candidate,

Thank you for your interest in the Software Engineer position. Please see below for a list of questions you may be asked during the interview. The maximum file size for uploading is 20 MB.

* How many software projects do you currently have under development?
* About how long have you been programming in Java?
* Have you developed any Java GUI application?
* What IDE do you use to develop Java GUIs?
* Have you been involved in any multi-threaded programming project?
* Have you developed any project in C/C++?
* Which C/C++ IDE have you used?
* How many software projects have you completed in C/C++?
* What do you think about C/C++ versus Java?
* What are the things you like most about Java?
* What are the things you like most about C/C++?
* What do you think about Java GUIs?
* What do you think about C/C++ GUIs

Sincerely,
HR Department

email_chain.subject: Freight Quote Request - T-Shirts from Shanghai to Paris
email_chain.body:
Hello,

We are looking to ship 200 cartons of T-shirts from Shanghai to Paris. Do you have available space this month, and could you please provide a price quote as soon as possible?

Regards,
Jean Dupont

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Quote Request - T-Shirts from Shanghai to Paris
email_chain.body:
Hi Jean,

Thank you for your email. To provide an accurate quote, I need some more details regarding your shipment of T-shirts:

1) What is the brand of the T-shirts?
2) What style of T-shirt is it? (e.g., Tank top, crew neck, long sleeve, short sleeve)
3) Are the T-shirts knitted or woven?
4) Do the T-shirts have any decorations (prints, embroidery, etc.)? If so, what type?
5) What is the fabric composition? (e.g., 100% cotton, blend) If a blend, what percentages?
6) What is the approximate weight of each T-shirt?
7) Do you require us to include the freight cost on your invoice, or will you be paying separately?
8) How many T-shirts are packed in each carton?

Please provide this information at your earliest convenience so I can prepare a quote.

Best regards,
Yue Chen

email_chain.subject: Freight Quote Request: 12,000 MT Urea - Pengerang to Las Palmas - September
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Walters,

We have a potential cargo of 12,000 MT of urea for shipment from Pengerang to Las Palmas in September. Could you please provide a freight quote?

Please note that the BAF (Bunker Adjustment Factor) is estimated to be around $120/MT, based on previous fixtures. However, this is subject to change. If a Guaranteed Daily Workrate (GdW) is used, please be aware that the final BAF calculation may impact the vessel's arrival time.

Thank you,
[Broker Name]

email_chain.subject: Urea Availability Update - Nanded
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Walters,

This is an update regarding urea availability from our vendors in Nanded. We are anticipating a firm price by the end of next week for up to 20,000 MT of various urea types.

As the available quantities can fluctuate daily, we would appreciate receiving a list of your specific urea requirements, including types and quantities, as soon as possible. We anticipate that the shipment may be split into three or four tranches.

I will call you later today to discuss this further and potentially arrange a trip to Mumbai to finalize the details. Please also provide a list of vessels you have available that are suitable for these types of shipments.

We look forward to speaking with you soon.

Regards,
Jane Doe

email_chain.subject: Petcoke Inquiry - Kandla to Mathura
email_chain.body:
Hi Liam,

Do you have available tonnage for 18,000 MT of petcoke from Kandla to Mathura? Could you please provide a market quote and the terms of the charter?

Cheers,
George

email_chain.subject: Re: Petcoke Inquiry - Kandla to Mathura
email_chain.body:
Hi George,

We're seeing some port delays going through Kandla. We only have tonnage currently fixed to Mumbai/Kochi. The next closest option is Chennai. Do you have any interest in loading at Chennai?

Best Regards,
Liam

email_chain.subject: Re: Petcoke Inquiry - Kandla to Mathura
email_chain.body:
Hi Liam,

Thanks for your reply.

How about Mumbai for delivery? That would be okay with us.

Cheers,
George

email_chain.subject: Re: Petcoke Inquiry - Kandla to Mathura
email_chain.body:
Hi George,

We only have one vessel in the Gulf that could arrive in Mumbai within your timeframes. It is currently in Lasbela (Mub) and is expected to complete discharge on the 11th of July (this is an example using date in base text, please ignore this). It can be ready to load around the 13th or 14th of July, with availability until the 17th of July. As it's currently under charter, a minimum berth time of 10 days would apply.

The vessel is currently loading cargo in Tamil Nadu. After discharge in Mumbai, it *could* theoretically sail directly to Mathura, avoiding a second call at Mumbai, if that simplifies things for your delivery. However, realistically, expect 1-2 days at anchor in Mumbai, plus time waiting for berth availability.

Best Regards,
Liam

email_chain.subject: Re: Petcoke Inquiry - Kandla to Mathura
email_chain.body:
Hi George,

Thank you for your interest. I've since received an enquiry for a different cargo type that the ship could load in Mumbai, and it seems like a better fit for their requirements. Unfortunately, that means the vessel is no longer available for your petcoke shipment.

Please let me know if you are still interested in securing a vessel for loading in the region, and I'll let you know if another ship becomes available.

Best Regards,
Liam

Wang
