email_chain.subject: Import Delivery - EXW Terms and Documentation
email_chain.body:
Hi Mr. Pal,

Could you please confirm if we can proceed with the delivery of your import under EXW terms?

If so, could you provide a copy of the bill of lading as soon as it is available? Also, please ensure a pre-arrival notification of the cargo is sent, including the owner's details, so that we can facilitate berth preparations and other necessary documentation.

Looking forward to hearing from you.

Best regards,
Yi-shen

email_chain.subject: Re: Import Delivery - EXW Terms and Documentation
email_chain.body:
Hi Yi-shen,

Yes, we can deliver the import cargo under EXW terms. Our suppliers can even sell under CIF terms, but the cargo is already loaded, and our transportation costs under CIF would likely be higher than ex-works.

Regarding the bill of lading, would providing a copy before arrival be a problem for you? Please advise.

As for the other documentation requirements, we're unsure how to complete them. We only supply high-technology components, and we understand your company is the final user.

Many thanks for your kind assistance.

Regards,
Terry

email_chain.subject: Re: Import Delivery - EXW Terms and Documentation
email_chain.body:
Hi Terry,

Yes, we absolutely require a copy of the bill of lading to be sent to us before arrival.

Regarding the final user, that's acceptable. However, we will need the final user's information included on the bill of lading. We also require the name of the manufacturer of the products, which you will need to provide.

Regards,
Yi-shen

email_chain.subject: Re: Import Delivery - EXW Terms and Documentation
email_chain.body:
Hi Yi-shen,

Thanks for your reply.

We are very sorry, but we cannot provide you with the final user's information, as the purchase of our product is strictly for internal use only. 

We are also unable to disclose the name of the manufacturer of the components, as that information is confidential.

We apologize for any inconvenience this may cause and regret that we cannot assist you further with this request.

Best Regards,
Terry

Lloyd

We've recently moved our headquarters to the U.S. While we handle a wide range of shipping services, I'd like to connect you with our specialized cargo team to determine if we can meet your specific requirements for transporting flammable solids.

I will forward your request to Han (han@hello.com), who leads that team. He will be in touch shortly.

All the best,
Wanjia

email_chain.subject: FISAI_22 - Instructions for Shipping Email Dataset Import
email_chain.body:
Dear Student,

To import the Shipping Email dataset:

1.  Select 'EMAILS' in the 'Model' section of the menu bar.
2.  Save your current progress (if any) by selecting the first tab in the bottom section of the view menu.
3.  Click the '+' button and select 'Import Dataset'.
4.  Download 'Shipping Emails.xlsx' from the FISAI_22 assignment page and select it for upload.

Once uploaded, each shipping email will be represented by the following elements:

(Value, Time of writing, Sender, Recipient, Port of Departure, Port of Arrival)

Example Format:

<Value>
<Time of writing>
Mr/Ms <Sender> [Hamburg]
Hi <Recipient>,
<Message>

Best regards,
The FISAI_22 Team

email_chain.subject: Re: FISAI_22 - Instructions for Shipping Email Dataset Import
email_chain.body:
Dear Student,

To import the Shipping Email dataset:

1.  Select 'EMAILS' in the 'Model' section of the menu bar.

3.  Click the '+' button and select 'Import Dataset'.
4.  Download 'Shipping Emails.xlsx' from the FISAI_22 assignment page and select it for upload.

Once uploaded, each shipping email will be represented by the following elements:

(Value, Time of writing, Sender, Recipient, Port of Departure, Port of Arrival)

Jeremy Smith

email_chain.subject: RE: Urgent: Crude Oil Shipment - Daesan to Aberdeen - Mid-April
email_chain.body:
Dear Jeremy,

I'm concerned about the previous shipment delays, seemingly due to adverse weather. Please ensure this doesn't happen again.

If securing a vessel for mid-April proves difficult and the timeline is at risk, explore alternatives like the Tuna, Excelsior, or Metal. While they're not ideal, operating at approximately 75% capacity is preferable to missing the deadline, especially considering we haven't yet finalized booking for the Africa/Metocean cargo.

Regards,
Tim Miller

email_chain.subject: Shipping Inquiry: 20,000 MT Steel - Paldock to Monrovia
email_chain.body:
Hello Ben,

We’re looking to ship 20,000 MT of steel from Paldock to Monrovia. Could you send us your FCL rate and ETA?

Also, is it possible to do a post-dated bill of lading?

Thanks,

Grace

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Inquiry: 20,000 MT Steel - Paldock to Monrovia
email_chain.body:
Hi Grace,

Please find attached our quotations for Paldock to Monrovia for your steel cargo.

Our standard payment terms require receipt of an irrevocable letter of credit in our London account before shipment, with cargo being sent within three days of receipt of the L/C.

Could you confirm that the steel can be shipped in containers? If not, do you have other requirements (such as barge?) Also, are there any specific requirements for the steel itself?

We can issue the bill of lading either to bearer or to the order of your bank, as you require.

If you would like us to issue the bill of lading to bearer, please let us know when we can expect the irrevocable letter of credit in our London account.

You will find our payment terms at the bottom of the quotations.

Please confirm your requirements and send us a draft irrevocable letter of credit to enable us to proceed.

Best regards,

Ben

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Inquiry: 20,000 MT Steel - Paldock to Monrovia
email_chain.body:
Thank you very much.

The cargo will be shipped in 20-foot containers, with 400 pieces per container. The cargo consists of steel bars.

Please deliver the bill of lading to bearer.

I have forwarded the irrevocable letter of credit to our bank for processing.

Best regards,

Grace

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Inquiry: 20,000 MT Steel - Paldock to Monrovia
email_chain.body:
Hello Grace,

We have received your confirmation and the notification regarding the letter of credit.

Our rate is USD 700 per 20-foot container.

We will proceed as follows:

*   We will issue the bill of lading to bearer.
*   We will send the bill of lading and other shipping documents to you within five days of the date that we receive the irrevocable letter of credit in our account in London.

Best regards,

Ben

* 1 stop in Chicago, return on September 1

With 2 stopovers:
* 1 stop in Chicago, return on August 30
* 2 stops in Chicago, return on September 1

5/13/14: Roundtrip ticket = $845.00
5/13/14: One-way ticket to Charleston = $430.00

email_chain.subject: Re: Price Inquiry: Chicago to Charleston - Follow Up
email_chain.body:
I just spoke with the airlines regarding multi-stop flights.

They cannot price out itineraries with more than 2 stops. When I asked if it was possible to price with 3 stops, they said: "I’m sorry to inform you but all airlines in the U.S. have a 2-stop maximum when pricing with multiple stops."

I also spoke with a colleague who suggested a stopover in Honolulu on the return for potentially better pricing, but he hasn't provided a new quote yet. I will forward that information to you as soon as I receive it.

RMA

email_chain.body:

Freight: $0.19/MT + $0.05/MT bunker surcharge

Key terms:
1. Standard charter party agreement
2. Cargo: Petroleum Coke - 2,000 MT (as per your request, though we can handle up to 20,000 MT if needed)

4. Sailing: November (flexible dates)
5. Route: Baku, Azerbaijan to Qingdao, China

Best Regards,
[name]

email_chain.subject: FWD: Charter Inquiry: Petroleum Coke Baku to Qingdao - Potential Catch
email_chain.body:
FYI, received the below quote. The rate seems suspiciously low, like an attempt to obscure the true cost of chartering. The bunker surcharge is a red flag. They're likely trying to make it look like a better deal than it is by focusing on the per-ton rate, especially with the specific decimal places.

It's classic bait-and-switch – they're advertising a low initial price ($0.19/MT) which is deliberately misleading and the bunker surcharge adds to the cost.

Best to be wary of this offer and double-check all the terms before proceeding.

1. Could you please re-confirm the cargo information (e.g. specific type of maize, packing)?

Daisuke

email_chain.subject: VOST E-commerce Project and Oyster Commitment
email_chain.body:
Mr. Hatfield,

[****] asked me to relay to you that he intends to stand by his commitment to you, with the oysters needed in one week from today.

I am one of the team members on the VOST e-commerce project. I will be forwarding information you request; however, the development of the site is a lengthy process and may not be completed within the timeline you suggest.

We are setting up a test environment that will allow us to provide a small group of clients with a customized website. Gathering the preliminary information you requested should take us no more than two days. Once we provide you with this information, you will have the opportunity to preview the site.

We will provide you with a list of benefits you can expect to enjoy from utilizing the VOST e-commerce site, and we will also explain why Safeway is working with us in an effort to gain increased efficiencies by using technology.

Our goal is to have this site operational in July, and we will be glad to make the website available to your organization during this time.

Please let me know if you need anything else.

Sincerely,

[****]

cc: Rufus Magwood, Rebecca Dixon
[****]

Attachments: image001.gif; doc1059.doc; doc1059.doc (word 98); doc1059.doc; doc1059.doc; doc1059.doc

(Note: The last paragraph about Lachlan Seward appears to be from a completely unrelated email and cannot be connected to the rest of the chain, so it has been omitted.)

email_chain.subject: Freight Inquiry: 4,000 MT Almonds - Port Pirie to Rio de Janeiro
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Pino,

We have a cargo of 4,000 MT of almonds from Port Pirie to Rio de Janeiro. We’d be interested in exploring alternative freight structures. Could you please share a lumpsum estimate to help us compare?

Regards,

Ian

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry: 4,000 MT Almonds - Port Pirie to Rio de Janeiro
email_chain.body:
Hi Ian,

Thank you for your inquiry regarding the shipment of 4,000 MT of almonds from Port Pirie to Rio de Janeiro. We appreciate you considering Luen Marine Shipping Company.

Could you please clarify what you mean by 'alternative freight structures'? We typically offer both lumpsum and per-ton freight options. Understanding your preferred structure will help us provide an accurate and competitive estimate.

Best regards,

Luen Marine Shipping Company

email_chain.subject: Re: Our offer for your shipment (Luen Marine)
email_chain.body:
All,

We are evaluating the offer from Luen Marine for the almond shipment. The initial terms look promising. Please review the attached draft contract to ensure it aligns with our shipment requirements and standard operating procedures. 

Please provide your feedback by January 20th.

Thanks,

Phil

email_chain.subject: Re: Our offer for your shipment (Luen Marine)
email_chain.body:
Dear Phil,

Before we can fully assess the contract, could you please request a more precise ETA (Estimated Time of Arrival) from Luen Marine? A broader timeframe will help us with logistics and planning.

Thanks,

Muffy

email_chain.subject: Re: Our offer for your shipment (Luen Marine)
email_chain.body:
Muffy,

Understood. I'll reach out to Luen Marine for a refined ETA.

Phil

email_chain.subject: Re: Our offer for your shipment (Luen Marine)
email_chain.body:
Dear Phil,

I spoke with Sunny regarding the Luen Marine offer. We've decided that it's best to wait until we have a more precise ETA. This will allow us to better negotiate with Luen Marine regarding vessel details and potentially explore chartering prices as well. 

Please let me know if you can secure a better ETA by tomorrow. If not, we may need to explore other options.

Best regards,

Muffy

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: 30,000 bags Urea - Panama to Liverpool
email_chain.body:

We are looking to move 30,000 bags of urea from Panama to Liverpool. Do you have any open slots on your current round voyage that might accommodate this?

Could you also confirm your usual LMA clause for such shipments?

Regards,

Kate Miller

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: 30,000 bags Urea - Panama to Liverpool
email_chain.body:
Hi Kate,

Apologies for the delay in responding; I just saw this now.

We are currently loading in Trincomalee on Sunday and our itinerary includes calls at Amsterdam, Rotterdam, and Aalborg before proceeding to Liverpool. Your cargo would be very welcome on board.

Our standard LMA clause is +$2.0/tonne, and we have favorable bunker prices available in both Aalborg and Rotterdam.

Looking forward to your confirmation.

Best regards,
Franco Rossi

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry: 30,000 bags Urea - Panama to Liverpool
email_chain.body:
Hi Kate,

Just a quick follow-up to see if you've had a chance to consider our offer. As our voyage commences this Sunday, we would appreciate it if you could finalize your booking decision this week.

Best regards,

Franco Rossi

Regards,

email_chain.subject: Coal Shipment Request - Richards Bay to Maputo
email_chain.body:
Hi Sheldon,

We require approximately 7,600 MT capacity for a coal shipment from Richards Bay to Maputo this weekend. Do you have any suitable vessels with available slots?

Regards,
Adrian

email_chain.subject: RE: Coal Shipment Request - Richards Bay to Maputo
email_chain.body:
Hi Adrian,

We have a vessel with 7,000 MT capacity available and can offer the following rates:

  *   Price FCA: US$150.00 per MT
  *   Price CIF: US$175.00 per MT

Terms:

  *   Subject to export Letter of Indemnity (LOI) and Bill of Exchange (non-negotiable).
  *   FCA price is inclusive of ocean freight.
  *   Vessel will load at Richards Bay Coal Terminal (RBCT). Cargo is packed in bags with tags, and wheelbarrows will be required for loading.
  *   Payment terms are 100% net 30 days from completion of loading at port.
  *   Vessel is scheduled to sail this Friday.

Please confirm if you would like to proceed.

Regards,
Sheldon

email_chain.subject: RE: Coal Shipment Request - Richards Bay to Maputo
email_chain.body:
Good morning Sheldon,

The cargo is ready to be loaded. Could you please provide the vessel details for loading at Richards Bay?

Regards,
Adrian

email_chain.subject: RE: Coal Shipment Request - Richards Bay to Maputo - Vessel Details
email_chain.body:
Hi Adrian,

We will load your cargo onboard the vessel *MV [Vessel Name]*. Please note the following:

  *   A Bill of Lading (BL) is required for booking and confirmation of the rate.
  *   The cargo will be discharged in Mozambique at your nominated port's berth. Your representative will be responsible for collection and delivery.
  *   Payment is via Telegraphic Transfer (TT), 100% prepaid upon receipt of the original invoice, which is based on actual consumption.
  *   All additional costs will be for your account. The container will be debagged at a pre-determined location (to be agreed upon with your nominated port).
  *   We can provide you with your nominated port agent’s contact details and will update you when your cargo has been loaded.

Please ensure all necessary arrangements are in place.

Regards,
Sheldon

Michael

email_chain.body:

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry: 2900 MT Cotton - Huangpu to Ghent
email_chain.body:
Dear Clark Chen,

Thank you for the update. We are flexible with the carrier selection. Given the current market, carriers are usually eager to secure bookings. Our cargo is containerized rather than transported in bulk, so it's crucial the containers are handled carefully.

Please let me know if you require any further information.

Henry Miller

email_chain.subject: Re: Sorghum Shipment - Abidjan to Rotterdam

2) The earliest date the sorghum is available to be shipped from Abidjan to Rotterdam.

Thank you for your assistance and your prompt reply.

Regards,
Andy

email_chain.subject: Re: Sorghum Shipment - Abidjan to Rotterdam
email_chain.body:
Dear Andy,

Thank you for your inquiry. Here are the answers to your questions:

1) USD $100 per MT
2) Available for shipment within 1 month from today.
3) Approximately 5,000 cubic meters
4) Total estimated cost: USD $100,000. This includes all handling, shipping, insurance, and related fees.
5) Estimated transit time is 20 days.

Thank you for your interest.

Regards,
Dominic

email_chain.subject: Re: Sorghum Shipment - Abidjan to Rotterdam
email_chain.body:

Andy

3) Please confirm your email address for our records is indeed: andy@importer.com
4) Please confirm your company address: Queen 1003, Hangzhou City, China.

Thank you very much for your attention to these details.

Regards,
Dominic

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Inquiry: 30,000 MT Rice from Vietnam to Mombasa
email_chain.body:
Thank you for your prompt response.

email_chain.subject: Crude Oil Request - New York to London
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Smith,

I am writing to you from American Fuel Corporation in New York. We are looking to receive 250 m3 of crude oil, loading in New York on July 25th, and discharging in London.

Could you please provide your demurrage rate if the vessel is one hour late?

Thanks.
Regards,
Lisa Anderson

email_chain.subject: Re: Crude Oil Request - New York to London
email_chain.body:
Hi Lisa,

Thanks for your email. To provide you with an accurate demurrage quote, please fill in the following blanks and return to me:

What is your loading port name? (e.g., New York Harbor) 
_________________________

How many m3 of crude oil will you be sending? 250 m3
_________________________

What is your loading date? July 25th
_________________________

What is your discharge port name? (e.g., Port of Tilbury, London)
_________________________

If the ship is one hour late, what demurrage rate are you anticipating? 
______________________

Regards,
John Smith

email_chain.subject: RE: Crude Oil Request - New York to London - Estimated Transit Time
email_chain.body:
Dear Lisa,

Just to give you some context while you fill in the information requested by John Smith, the approximate distance between New York and London by sea is 4550 nautical miles. At an average vessel speed of 100 nautical miles per day, it would take approximately 45.5 days (or 1092 hours) to reach London.

Therefore, if the voyage takes 1093 hours, the vessel would be approximately one hour late. Please use this information in determining the expected demurrage for the voyage. Please note that this estimation assumes perfect weather conditions and consistent vessel speed.

Regards,
Mark Johnson

email_chain.subject: **SECURITY WARNING** Possible Phishing Attempt - Contains Tracking Number
email_chain.body:
Subject: **SECURITY WARNING** <MD5 hash> <IP> <secret token>

This email was flagged as potentially malicious due to being from an unknown sender and originating outside of our trusted domains. The user profile associated with the sender is empty.

While sent through Rapid Mailer (Mandrill), it contains a tracking number related to a parcel reportedly sent from the USA, as mentioned in the preceding email chain. This suggests a potential automated mailer or spambot.

Attached files (in a zip archive) appear to be associated with a "GET mail spambot" or B2B mailing system. The archive contains numerous folders and files that do not appear to be executable, likely user data.

Recommended action: Exercise extreme caution and do not open any attachments or click any links from unknown senders.

email_chain.subject: RE: Parcel Delivery Inquiry from Norway

Sincerely,
Joe Parr

Iain Mitchell

Brownblazes & Smith

email_chain.subject: Freight Rate Analysis Portal
email_chain.body:
As requested, I am including a snapshot of our web portal as it appears today. It contains information about the markets in which you trade, and the freight rates for each trade. The portal also shows how certain factors, such as market volatility, can affect rates. Each sector displays a current snapshot of freight rates for each of the areas that you can trade, and a visual map indicating rate fluctuations. Also, freight rates appear in a moving graph which shows trends over the last 30 days. This is quite beneficial for traders who have to make decisions based on live market conditions.

Another important function is the ship and route selector. When a ship trader selects a specific ship, the system shows in green or red the rates and savings for that specific ship on each route. This helps traders determine which ship and which route to select.

Finally, a major aspect of the technology is the asset manager,

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Rate Analysis Portal
email_chain.body:
Thank you very much for the quick response and information.

Let me confirm my understanding: The screenshot shows the C/P from Damietta to Koper is 3.25/3.70 points lower compared to the CP for the same route from Rotterdam -> Damietta. This makes a total difference of 3.625 to 5.375 $/day (depending on the grade). Since the ship owner is not willing to fix the voyage for the entire laycan, but only until next week, I can't make any changes to the CP.

Regards,

Karen

email_chain.subject: Research Inquiry: Reverse Engineering the Brain
email_chain.body:
Dear Davy,

The question for our scientists is: can we reverse engineer a fully functional brain on a small scale? After all, we know the basic process: Light enters the eye through the lens and falls on the retina. Our neural pathways can recognize different light frequencies, decode them, and convert them into signals. But is it possible to create an organic working brain by synthesizing only those required ingredients?

Regards,
Research Department

email_chain.subject: Demurrage Rate Request - Bandar Mahshahr
email_chain.body:
Dear Operations Team,

Could you please provide the applicable demurrage rates for vessels calling at Bandar Mahshahr between February 2nd, 2015 and February 8th, 2015?

Relevant Vessel Information:

*   Vessel Area: Suez Canal or Suez Canal Area
*   Vessel Draft: 15.5 meters
*   Arrival Port: Bandar Mahshahr (Navigation Clearance Required)
*   Approximate Arrival Time: Friday, February 6th, 2015

Thank you for your time and assistance.

Sincerely,
Shipper

email_chain.subject: Re: Demurrage Rate Request - Bandar Mahshahr
email_chain.body:
Dear Shipper,

Thank you for your email regarding demurrage rates. We want to ensure that we provide the correct information. Please clarify if your request is for Bandar Mahshahr or Bandar Abbas.

We have the following information based on your email. Please confirm if this information is correct:

*   Date of Arrival: February 6th, 2015 (Original Email) / February 8th, 2015 (Subject Line)
*   Position of Vessel: Expected offshore of Bandar Mahshahr, awaiting tug assistance.
*   Type of Vessel: Crude Oil Tanker, approximately 105,000 DWT.
*   Draft of Vessel: 15.50 meters.

Regarding your request for demurrage rates for vessel delays waiting for assistance, such as tugs, our company does not apply demurrage charges in these cases. Thus, no rate is provided.

Regards,
Operations Team

email_chain.subject: Re: Demurrage Rate Request - Bandar Mahshahr
email_chain.body:
Dear Operations Team,

Referring to your email dated February 22nd, 2015, regarding our query for demurrage rates in the Bandar Mahshahr/Suez Canal area, I would like to provide additional information received from our principals.

The Authority of Iran Ministry of Maritime & Ports has indicated that if local vessels exceeding 120,000 MT deadweight and tugboats fail to fulfill their contractual commitments for navigational services, or if the services provided do not meet international standards, a local authority (such as KOTTE) at the port will be responsible for providing the services. 

Thank you for your time.

Sincerely,
Shipper

email_chain.subject: Re: Demurrage Rate Request - Bandar Mahshahr
email_chain.body:
Dear Operations Team,

Referring to your email dated February 22nd, 2015, regarding our query for demurrage rates in the Bandar Mahshahr/Suez Canal area, I would like to provide additional information received from our principals.

The Authority of Iran Ministry of Maritime & Ports has indicated that if local vessels exceeding 120,000 MT deadweight and tugboats fail to fulfill their contractual commitments for navigational services, or if the services provided do not meet international standards, a local authority (such as KOTTE) at the port will be responsible for providing the services as per the contract with the benefit of local vessels with a deadweight of less than 120,000 MT.

Thank you for your time.

Sincerely,
Shipper

email_chain.subject: Freight Inquiry: 8,000 MT EVA Resin - India to Turkey
email_chain.body:
Hi Nick,

We're trying to move 8,000 MT of EVA resin from India to Turkey. Would you have the space available? What's your freight rate for this shipment?

Best regards,
Andreas Meier

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry: 8,000 MT EVA Resin - India to Turkey
email_chain.body:
Hi Andreas,

Regarding your inquiry about 8,000 MT of EVA resin from India to Turkey, unfortunately, we don't have the capacity for that route at the moment. However, we are currently looking for cargo for a 15,000 MT shipment from India to Taiwan. 

Freight rate would be around $10.5/MT, but definitely not exceeding $11/MT.

Best,
Nick

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry: 8,000 MT EVA Resin - India to Turkey
email_chain.body:
Hi Nick,

That's interesting news about the 15,000 MT of EVA resin from India to Taiwan. It sounds promising.

However, there's been a development. I just learned that the customer in Turkey and the customer in Taiwan are actually the same company, just different offices. I doubt they'll need that much EVA resin in both locations simultaneously. If the order is for 15,000 MT total, I'm concerned they might cancel it altogether.

Best,
Andreas

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry: 8,000 MT EVA Resin - India to Turkey
email_chain.body:
Hi Nick,

I've spoken with my customer, and my concerns were valid. The secondary office in Taiwan operates somewhat independently, with a limit of 10,000 MT per location. We'll need to split the shipment between the two offices. Can we divide the shipment, sending some to Turkey and some to Taiwan? Also, would it be possible to lower the freight rate if we split the shipments? A more competitive rate would significantly help us secure the order.

Best,
Andreas

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry: 8,000 MT EVA Resin - India to Turkey
email_chain.body:
Hi Nick,

Thanks for your previous response and suggestions. We've decided to divide the shipment between the two offices. This means we'll likely need two vessels and more containers overall. Considering the increased complexity, could we revisit the freight rate? Is $10.5/MT still the best you can offer?

Best,
Andreas

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry: 8,000 MT EVA Resin - India to Turkey
email_chain.body:
Hi Nick,

It's a relief to know about the 10,000 MT limit per office. We are planning on shipping around 7,000 MT to Taiwan.

Best,
Andreas

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry: 8,000 MT EVA Resin - India to Turkey
email_chain.body:
Hi Nick,

That sounds good. We are going to change the quantity to 7,000MT. Let's get your customer's thoughts on this, they didn't seem convinced last time.

Best,
Andreas

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry: 8,000 MT EVA Resin - India to Turkey
email_chain.body:
Hi Nick,

Great, 7,000 MT. But one more small adjustment. The buyer in Taiwan has informed me that they only have storage capacity for 6,000 MT. Could we potentially get a slightly better rate if we ship just 6,000 MT to Taiwan?

Best,
Andreas

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry: 8,000 MT EVA Resin - India to Turkey
email_chain.body:
Hi Nick,

Yes, let's discuss the freight rate again, considering the 6,000 MT of EVA resin from India to Taiwan. One last thing: our shipper needs to know the specific port in Taiwan.

Best,
Andreas

email_chain.subject: Re: Potential Voyage: Galveston to Qingdao - Corn Oil
email_chain.body:

Best,
Jane

email_chain.subject: Re: Potential Voyage: Galveston to Qingdao - Corn Oil
email_chain.body:
Hi Jane,

Could you please provide the contact details for your appointed agent in Qingdao? We would like to contact them directly.

Also, a discharge commencement date of May 19th is not acceptable. We cannot accept a vessel lying idle for 10 days in Qingdao. If discharge cannot commence before May 18th, please provide a counter-offer.

Thank you.

Best,
Chris

email_chain.subject: Re: Potential Voyage: Galveston to Qingdao - Corn Oil
email_chain.body:
Dear Chris,

We have appointed JPT International Co. Ltd. as our agent in Qingdao. Their contact information is as follows:

JPT International Co. Ltd.
Address: Block A, Room 802, No.10 DongHaiNan Road, Qingdao, 266061, P.R.China.
Phone: 86-532-80780378/80780379
Fax: 86-532-807803

email_chain.subject: Re: Potential Voyage: Galveston to Qingdao - Corn Oil - Discharge Delay & Voyage Estimate
email_chain.body:
Dear Chris,

Our voyage estimate has been prepared and sent to your office. Please note that, as per the contract, the charterer is responsible for any costs associated with shifting between berths.

It is our pleasure to accommodate

email_chain.body:

I'm glad to hear you're ready to proceed. Please find attached the details of what I need. Specifically:

I expect that these requests will be handled professionally.

Yusang Kim

email_chain.subject: Re: Rate Request: Isopropanol - Houston to Cartagena - Container Details
email_chain.body:
Dear John,

Thank you for your inquiry. I am attaching a quote for your review regarding the shipment of isopropanol from Houston to Cartagena.

To secure the space on the vessel, we require a 25% deposit. Once the deposit is received, we will provide you with our bank details for the remaining payment, as well as the full details of our cargo insurance policy and the instructions for creating each bill of lading.

Our next step will be to forward the cargo insurance declaration forms to you. This is required to initiate the insurance coverage. After the insurance has been set up, the shipment process will begin, and we will provide you with all necessary documentation.

email_chain.subject: Charter Inquiry: 4,000 MT Wheat Flour - Australia to Bangkok
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir/Madam,

Technical Coordinator

email_chain.subject: Re: Charter Inquiry: 4,000 MT Wheat Flour - Australia to Bangkok
email_chain.body:

Thank you for your inquiry. We currently have the vessel WS562 en route to Australia. However, after its arrival, its next scheduled delivery is to London, approximately one week after arrival in Australia. While this likely doesn't align with your needs, I'd be happy to discuss alternative options if you are flexible with timing.

Sincerely,
Zane Griffin
Assistant to Sales

email_chain.subject: Re: Charter Inquiry: 4,000 MT Wheat Flour - Australia to Bangkok

Chartering Manager

Assistant to Sales

email_chain.subject: Transition of Brokering Contract
email_chain.body:
Dear Felicia,

Please note that Dr. Alexander will be leaving our brokering firm at the end of the month. I will be taking over your contract and would be happy to meet to discuss this further.

Are you available early next week?

Many thanks in advance and best regards,
Angela Meier

email_chain.subject: Re: Transition of Brokering Contract
email_chain.body:
Hi Angela,

Thanks for your quick reply. We just recently set up a meeting with Patrick Winkelmayer.

The Winkelmayer account? I hope that's him. As far as I remember, he is the one who liked our portfolio so much.

I would like to know what he has planned for the future and how he sees the possible collaboration. Patrick recently sent me an e-mail with a proposal. I am including it here for you to get familiar with what he's looking at.

Best regards,
Felicia Schneider

email_chain.subject: Feedback on Proposal from Paul Spangler's Firm
email_chain.body:
Dear Patrick,

I received the proposal from Paul Spangler's firm. As discussed, please find my comments below:

1) Regarding the number of projects in the proposal, we would like to reduce the number for which we would like to engage your firm. This isn't a reflection of your ability to broker deals, but we'd prefer to initially focus on a smaller scope to assess the partnership. The deal with the American electronics firm is our first priority.

2) Regarding the electronics deal, we would appreciate it if you could consider accelerating the timeline. It has become clear that American firms are increasingly interested in working with British firms to take advantage of competitive tax rates. Moving the deal forward would make us a more attractive partner.

3) Finally, regarding the rate you quoted for the electronics firm, I [message incomplete in original text].

Best regards,
Felicia Schneider

email_chain.subject: Regarding the Electronics Firm Deal
email_chain.body:
Dear Patrick,

I am sorry to say that we will not be able to continue working with you on the electronics firm deal. During negotiations, you seem to be pushing the company to consider elements they aren't ready to address. Therefore, we will have to cease our collaboration on this matter.

It was a pleasure working with you.

Sincerely,
Felicia Schneider

email_chain.subject: Freight Estimate Request - Bauxite from Port Beni, Peru
email_chain.body:
Good morning Mr. Brown,

We have a load of Bauxite coming out of Port Beni, Peru, approximately 40,000MT, FOB. Please advise your best freight estimate.

Sincerely,
John Paul

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Estimate Request - Bauxite from Port Beni, Peru
email_chain.body:
Hi John,

I'm assuming you're with Sigi Sanaa Shipping Corp. If that is correct, your freight estimates are as follows:

*   Hong Kong (HK): USD 2.20/MT
*   Tanzania (TZ): USD 3.40/MT
*   South Korea (SK): USD 1.10/MT
*   Curacao (CW): USD 2.00/MT
*   Rhodes (RH): USD 0.90/MT
*   Jordan (JO): USD 1.90/MT

As per custom clearance, cargo will be delivered at Sidong railway/terminal. Freight includes custom and railway charges depending on load and transportation, which will be included at spot rate. This is subject to railway cooperation and availability of wagons, which cannot be guaranteed until we receive your instructions to load.

This is a FREIGHT estimate. Let me know if you want a FOB-CIF estimate for cargo destined for a specific port.

Best regards,
Roger Brown

email_chain.subject: RE: Freight Estimate Request - Bauxite from Port Beni, Peru
email_chain.body:
Hi Roger,

I need this information by close of business, 20 Mar. 2006. Are you available then?

Regards,
John Paul

email_chain.subject: RE: Freight Estimate Request - Bauxite from Port Beni, Peru
email_chain.body:
Dear Roger,

Thank you for your email on March 22, 2006. I agree to your price of USD 3.40/MT for Tanzania (TZ) only. I was wondering if there will be an additional charge to include another 11,600 MT of the same Bauxite to our freight.

Also, we have another similar shipment at the same rate as above to FRSA, Hook with FOB of May 29th 2006. Please advise.

Sincerely,
John Paul

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Estimate Request - Bauxite from Port Beni, Peru
email_chain.body:
Hi John,

Sure, no problem.

Would you please send a proforma invoice and send the original to Sigi Sanaa Shipping Corporation in Manila?

Best,
Roger Brown

email_chain.body:

email_chain.body:

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Quote Request: 300MT Fertilizer - Dalian to Nassau - Price List
email_chain.body:

Best regards,
Molly

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Quote Request: 300MT Fertilizer - Dalian to Nassau - Price List
email_chain.body:
Dear Molly,

I'm currently evaluating FOB versus CIF. Would it be possible to get a CIF price quote for comparison? Also, based on your experience shipping to Nassau, do you have a recommendation on whether CIF or FOB is generally better in my situation?

Thanks,
Hannah

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Quote Request: 300MT Fertilizer - Dalian to Nassau - Price List
email_chain.body:
Dear Hannah,

Whether CIF or FOB is better depends on your location and preferences. Generally, a CIF price is more comprehensive and can simplify the process for you.

For a more detailed explanation of the differences between CIF and FOB, please see this article: http://www.costpacific.co/cif-vs-fo...

Best regards,
Molly

[Account Name]

email_chain.subject: Re: Quote for Corn Starch Shipment - Bangkok to Haiphong - Payment Received

email_chain.subject: Re: Quote for Corn Starch Shipment - Bangkok to Haiphong - Change of Destination
email_chain.body:
Dear Al,

I need to change the delivery point to Ho Chi Minh City (HCMC) instead of Haiphong. The new booking number for the shipment is [New Booking Number]. I received this booking number in a separate email from [Source of Booking Number - e.g., our internal logistics department].

Please confirm if this change is possible.

Sincerely,
Zara

email_chain.subject: Re: Quote for Corn Starch Shipment - Bangkok to Haiphong - Change of Destination
email_chain.body:
Dear Zara,

We're having a hard time switching the delivery point. I've talked to the shipping line, and their only solution at this point is to send the shipment back to Bangkok so it can be re-shipped to Ho Chi Minh City. Unfortunately, the cost of this is very high, and I don't think it's a viable option for you.

I'm exploring other possibilities and will update you as soon as I have more information.

Sincerely,
Al

email_chain.subject: Re: Quote for Corn Starch Shipment - Bangkok to Haiphong - Change of Destination - Update
email_chain.body:

I've spoken with the shipping line again, and they have agreed to make the necessary changes to the shipment so it can be delivered to Ho Chi Minh City instead of Haiphong. However, the cost of this change is still quite high, and I'm afraid it will impact the final price.

I will send you an updated quote reflecting these changes shortly.

Sincerely,
Al

email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Li,

We have a cargo of 6,000 MT to be loaded in Malabo and delivered to Cape Town by May 11th. Would your company be interested in submitting a tender for this shipment?

Thanks,
Kris Jones

email_chain.subject: Re: Tender Request: 6000 MT Cargo - Malabo to Cape Town
email_chain.body:
Dear Kris,

Thank you for your inquiry. Our current rate for this shipment is USD 1,500 per MT.

Looking forward to your reply.

Sincerely,
Alice Li

email_chain.subject: Re: Tender Request: 6000 MT Cargo - Malabo to Cape Town
email_chain.body:
Dear Alice,

Thank you for the quote. The rate is acceptable, however, the transit time presents a potential issue. Could you please confirm the estimated time of arrival (ETA) for our customer? We are willing to consider a higher rate if an earlier arrival is possible.

Thanks,
Kris Jones

email_chain.subject: Re: Tender Request: 6000 MT Cargo - Malabo to Cape Town
email_chain.body:
Dear Kris,

Unfortunately, meeting the May 11th ETA is uncertain at this time. While our vessel maintains a good speed, ballasting to Malabo would take approximately 16 days. If the cargo is already available in Malabo, it will still require waiting for our vessel to arrive.

We will keep you updated if any changes occur to our vessel schedule that may allow us to meet your desired delivery date.

Sincerely,
Alice Li

email_chain.subject: Bitumen Transport Request - 6,000 MT IADC to Maputo
email_chain.body:
Dear Sir,

We have 6,000 MT of bitumen to transport from IADC to Maputo. Could you please share your available transport windows and any dispatch incentives you offer?

Best regards,
Harry

email_chain.subject: Re: Bitumen Transport Request - 6,000 MT IADC to Maputo
email_chain.body:
Dear Harry,

Thank you for your inquiry. We primarily provide transportation services for internal refinery needs and are not agents for other refineries. Our truck fleet is dedicated to our own business development and is generally unavailable to carry goods for external parties.

Thank you for your understanding.

Regards,
Jelena

email_chain.subject: Re: Bitumen Transport Request - 6,000 MT IADC to Maputo
email_chain.body:
Dear Jelena,

Good afternoon. I apologize if my previous email was unclear. We are the buyers of the bitumen from IADC, and the delivery point is Maputo. The CIF price offered to us includes transportation to Maputo. Therefore, the arrangement is solely between IADC and us.

Sincerely,
Harry

email_chain.subject: Re: Bitumen Transport Request - 6,000 MT IADC to Maputo
email_chain.body:
Dear Harry,

Greetings.

Following up on our previous emails, I'd like to clarify our position. We are not a refinery; we are an oil services company with our own truck fleet. We have recently entered into a contract with the IADC refinery to ship 6,000 MT of bitumen to Maputo, and we are exploring potential buyers in that location. Are you interested in purchasing this bitumen on CIF Maputo terms?

Regards,
Jelena

email_chain.subject: Freight Estimate Request - Ethanol Maceió to Houston
email_chain.body:
Good morning,

Could you provide a freight estimate for 3,900 MT of ethanol from Maceió to Houston in late August? Also, is laytime counted on arrival or upon NOR (Notice of Readiness)?

Thanks for your help,
Jane

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Estimate Request - Ethanol Maceió to Houston
email_chain.body:
Hi Jane,

Are you sure of your MT (Metric Tonnes) reading? Or is this based on MBBLs (thousand barrels)? These readings seem off. It will probably be several months until the ethanol has finished being stored in the tanks. Please double-check the quantity and let me know. 

Thanks,
X

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Estimate Request - Ethanol Maceió to Houston
email_chain.body:
Hi Jane,

I just looked up ethanol prices in Houston from Singapore, Brazil, and Egypt. They are all pretty much the same, within a $3 USD range. In July, Brazilian ethanol was cheaper, but now in August, Egyptian ethanol is slightly cheaper. But, as you know, that can change quickly.

After checking all options, I'm going to revert to an estimated $1 USD/MT delivered from Maceió for now, and maybe try again later. Please confirm the correct MT readings, I'm going ahead with the provided amount. I need this to estimate if the sale will be profitable.

Thank you for your help.

Best,
X

email_chain.subject: Freight Estimate Request - Ethanol Maceió to Houston
email_chain.body:
Hi Zoe,

Could you estimate freight for 2,500 MT from Maceió to Houston in late June/early July? Also, would you be willing to cover the 10% buyer's commission?

Best,
Aimee

email_chain.subject: Cotton Shipment - Santa Cruz to Newark
email_chain.body:
Hi Sam,

We're interested in proceeding with the second cotton shipment, under a 50-ton container, for direct sail from Santa Cruz to Newark. Will the new Charter Party (C/P) incorporate the New Panama Canal toll?

Thanks,
Ian

email_chain.subject: Re: Cotton Shipment - Santa Cruz to Newark
email_chain.body:
Hi Ian,

Where can I find this 'new C/P' you mentioned? I'm not aware of any changes. I have the latest Panama Canal Treaty documents, and they don't refer to a new Charter Party. Could you please clarify which agreement you're referring to?

Best regards,
Sam

email_chain.subject: Re: Cotton Shipment - Santa Cruz to Newark
email_chain.body:
Hi Ian,

Following up on my previous email, I've reviewed the Canal Treaty again and can't find any mention of a new C/P, or anything related to rates for that matter. It may include information on how the current toll method is structured. 

I did find this addendum which might be relevant:

http://www.panamaxmaritime.com/AG/Panama%20Canal%20Tolls%20Agreement.pdf

[Addendum to Panama Canal Treaty]
[Letter of understanding and agreement.] It seems to apply more to container ships, not other vessels such as your DWT (Deadweight Tonnage) which sail through. Unfortunately, this is outside of my control.

Since the signing of the Neutrality Treaty between the United States of America and the Republic of Panama of 1926, the Panama Canal has been operated as an interoceanic highway in a manner which has been equitable and impartial to all the merchant vessels of all nations, and in a manner consistent with the operation of other interoceanic waterways. The tolls for the use of the waterway have been established in the Treaty at rates which would be consistent with the tolls charged to vessels.

Regards,
Sam

email_chain.subject: Re: Cotton Shipment - Santa Cruz to Newark
email_chain.body:
Hi Sam,

I suspect we'll have to hire a cargo lawyer. I think we should make a formal complaint regarding potential discrimination, and see if the Secretary of State for Transport can provide a legal opinion. Alternatively, we could engage a private firm to challenge the Canal Authority directly.

With a guaranteed doubling of revenue, they might not be interested in the finer details.

At a minimum, get them to explain the 'adjusted and equitable tolls' arrangement.

Thanks,
Ian

email_chain.subject: Re: Cotton Shipment - Santa Cruz to Newark
email_chain.body:
Hi Ian,

I suspect you're right about the lawyer. Unfortunately, we won't be challenging this, as upper management are quite averse to legal involvement. 

Regards,
Sam

Ariel

email_chain.body:
If you do not know how to do a survey, find someone who can.

Regards
Larry

email_chain.subject: Re: Cargo Survey Request - 4,000 MT Cornstarch - Salem to Djibouti
email_chain.body:
Ariel,

We are not familiar with cornstarch cargoes, so I don't have the expertise to conduct a proper survey for this shipment. 

I recommend that you try to find a surveying company that specializes in handling agricultural commodities, particularly cornstarch. If that fails, you might consider obtaining cargo insurance, but please be aware that the insurance company may also require a specialized survey or have limitations on coverage due to the lack of readily available survey data.

Thanks for asking.

Regards,
Brian

email_chain.subject: Shipping Inquiry - Grains from Sydney to Seattle
email_chain.body:
Hi Rob,

I am enquiring as to your ability to transport grains from your Sydney port to ours in Seattle. We would want to use your containers to ship approximately 40,000 tons of grain.

Could you advise me of the approximate cost and timing of delivery? Could you also supply me with a copy of the relevant carriage conditions? Please also include a contact number, name, and fax number.

Thank you.

Regards,
Jill Slater

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Inquiry - Grains from Sydney to Seattle
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms Slater,

Thank you for your enquiry on the transport of grains from Sydney to Seattle.

As you requested, I have enclosed a schedule and conditions of carriage. 

The estimated cost for the shipment of 40,000 tons from Sydney to Seattle is as follows:

Container service: $55,000.00
Insurance of goods: $25,000.00
Total: $80,000.00

This total is for the cost of the shipping as well as for the cost of insuring the goods.

For insurance purposes, we do need a complete list of the goods to be shipped, together with an approximate value of the goods and an approximate quantity. We can then insure these goods for a fixed price. To clarify, this does not include a freight charge; the freight charge is paid by you directly to the shipper.

The insurance company can then quote you for the insurance of the goods.

We use the following insurance company:
A Insurance, New York.

Also, the estimated time of arrival is 1 month from the date of departure.

If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact me.

Regards,
Sally

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Inquiry - Grains from Sydney to Seattle
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms Slater,

Thank you for your request for a quote for shipping 40,000 tons of grains from Sydney to Seattle.

Unfortunately, we are unable to supply a firm price at this stage due to certain missing details. Specifically, the goods to be shipped are not specified, and no approximate value has been provided.

Also, no fixed quantity has been advised.

Once you provide us with these details, we will be able to give you a firm price.

Please provide this information at your earliest convenience.

Regards,
Sally

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Inquiry - Grains from Sydney to Seattle
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms Slater,

We are pleased to advise you that we can offer you the shipping of 40,000 tons of grains from Sydney to Seattle.

The approximate cost of shipping the goods, inclusive of insurance, is $50,000.

To ship these goods, a quantity must be specified.

email_chain.subject: HFO Discharge Schedule and Grades - Feb/March

Best regards,
Leo

email_chain.subject: Re: HFO Discharge Schedule and Grades - Feb/March
email_chain.body:
Jin,

Thank you for your quick reply. We appreciate your cooperation and support.

Regarding the oil price and potential discounts, I understand you have different commission rates associated with the 0.5% discount offered to buyers. Could you please confirm that if we sell the oil to buyers who utilize that discount, our commission will be 5% instead of the standard 7%?

If you can confirm this commission structure for discounted sales, I will focus on finding buyers who can take advantage of the discount.

Best regards,
Leo

email_chain.subject: Enquiry for Iron Ore Transportation - Dampier to Yuan Island
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Chen,

We have an urgent requirement for a vessel, approximately 50,000 dwt, with proven experience in dry bulk and/or ore carrier transport, for the movement of 20,000 to 25,000 MT of iron ore from Dampier to Yuan Island.

Please confirm the availability of a suitable vessel, its draft and size specifications, and whether it currently has ballast water on board. Also, what is the earliest date your vessel can be ready to sail? Finally, does the vessel have the capability to offload (dump) cargo in the event of a strike at the discharge port?

We would appreciate a detailed specification of your vessel, including crew details, safety records, and insurance policy information, by August 7th.

We will contact you regarding further details after this date.

Yours faithfully,

Richard Vernon

email_chain.subject: Re: Enquiry for Iron Ore Transportation - Dampier to Yuan Island
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Vernon,

Thank you for your enquiry.

We are pleased to inform you that we have an 87,000 dwt ocean-going ore carrier available. The vessel is 12 years old and has successfully passed all required safety inspections.

She has been on charter to an oil company for the past three months and is now available from August 15th. The vessel is equipped with the capability to offload cargo in the event of a strike.

To proceed further, we require information on the load port, discharge port, estimated cargo quantity, expected loading time, and the estimated number of stevedores required at both the loading and discharging ports.

We look forward to hearing from you soon.

Yours faithfully,

Jin Chen

email_chain.subject: Re: Enquiry for Iron Ore Transportation - Dampier to Yuan Island
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Chen,

Thank you for your swift reply.

Please find enclosed an outline of the proposed charter party agreement, covering the period from September 10th to October 31st, 2011.

In addition, I have attached a Letter of Inquiry, which we have sent to Dampier Iron Ore and Port Walling.

I would be grateful if you could review these documents and advise on any corrections or amendments you require.

I trust that the agreement meets with your approval, and I look forward to your response.

Yours faithfully,

Richard Vernon

email_chain.subject: Re: Enquiry for Iron Ore Transportation - Dampier to Yuan Island
email_chain.body:
Dear Richard,

I have reviewed your letter and the attached documents. I confirm that our vessel will be ready to sail by August 15th, making your preferred dates acceptable.

Regarding the charter party, the only adjustments I require are to the amounts and unit prices for port dues, pilotage/lights, and insurance, as well as specifying the percentage of each of these costs that are to be deducted from the charter hire.

I trust that these amendments are agreeable to you.

I will revert with formal confirmation and the insurance policy documents once we have reached mutual agreement on all terms.

Yours faithfully,

Jin Jing

email_chain.subject: Re: Enquiry for Iron Ore Transportation - Dampier to Yuan Island - Charter Agreement
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Chen,

The amendments to the charter party agreement are acceptable.

Please find enclosed a signed copy of the charter agreement, along with a draft of the insurance policy.

I would appreciate confirmation that the vessel will be ready for loading by August 17th.

Yours Faithfully,

Richard Vernon

email_chain.subject: Shipping Inquiry - 1100 MT Shoes from Rotterdam to Boston
email_chain.body:
Hello Mr. Jones,

We are looking to ship 1,100 MT of shoes from Rotterdam to Boston. Can you confirm your earliest available sail date and whether you have a regular sailing schedule for this route?

Kind regards,

Anne Miller

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Inquiry - 1100 MT Shoes from Rotterdam to Boston
email_chain.body:
Anne,

We would be happy to assist with your shipment. Our regular weekly sailing is on the 23rd of each month. However, we can accommodate this shipment on the 25th of March. 

Please confirm the final delivery address in Boston. Do you have any further questions?

Best regards,

Don Evans

email_chain.subject: Re: Shipping Inquiry - 1100 MT Shoes from Rotterdam to Boston
email_chain.body:
Hi Don,

That timeline works for us. The final destination for the goods is Boston, MA. We will be clearing the goods through customs at Port Newark, NJ.

Thank you for your help!

Anne Miller

email_chain.subject: Following up on Rotterdam to Boston Shipping
email_chain.body:
Hi Don,

I'm following up regarding the shipping to Boston, MA. I spoke with our customs broker, who mentioned they prefer the shipment originates in New Jersey. Can you let me know if that's a problem?

Thanks,

Anne Miller

email_chain.subject: Re: Following up on Rotterdam to Boston Shipping
email_chain.body:
Hi Anne,

Shipping via NJ is not a problem. The vessel will depart from Rotterdam and make stops in Houston and New Jersey before arriving in Boston. The final destination for the cargo is indeed Boston, and you can clear customs in Boston, so that shouldn't be an issue with the routing. 

Please let me know if you have any further questions.

Don Evans

email_chain.subject: Re: Following up on Rotterdam to Boston Shipping
email_chain.body:
Anne,

The carrier for this shipment will be ZIM Lines. The vessel will export from Rotterdam and call in Houston before sailing to Boston. Please note that all shipments are delivered FCA (Free Carrier) Rotterdam. This means you are responsible for all costs and liabilities after the goods are loaded onto the vessel in Rotterdam, including freight, insurance, duties, and import procedures.

Please let me know if you have any further questions.

Regards,

Ed Smith

email_chain.subject: Regarding your shipping quote - Rotterdam to Boston
email_chain.body:
Anne,

Can you please let me know if you have any questions about our quote? We've already used our weekly allocation, so securing space at the initially quoted rate may no longer be possible. We'll need to check current market prices.

Regards,

Don Evans

email_chain.body:

As you probably know, we currently purchase your hazelnuts, walnuts, and almonds sourced from Turkey and export them to China for our business partner. We handle a significant volume of sales with their clients.

From now on, for future quotations, please send them to me directly.

If you have any questions, please contact me at any time.

Kind Regards,
Emine

email_chain.subject: Methanol Discharge - Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hello Aziz,

Our vessel is scheduled to discharge approximately 11,000 MT of methanol in Saudi Arabia. Your FOB pricing looks promising. Do you also accept CIF terms? Additionally, are there any charges associated with net tankering?

Best regards,
Abhiraj

email_chain.subject: Re: Methanol Discharge - Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hello Abhiraj,

Greetings from Saudi Arabia!

Our agent will handle the lift-booking and transportation of the methanol from the Red Sea to Yanbu. In addition to your FOB price, do you foresee any additional costs related to the transport, such as bunker charges for the inland transportation?

Cargo safety is our top priority. However, in the unlikely event of spillage, our liability will be limited to the cleaning costs only. Let's discuss this further.

Yours,
Aziz

email_chain.subject: Re: Methanol Discharge - Inquiry
email_chain.body:
Hello Aziz,

Thank you for your swift response. We are concerned that a 3-day road transit from the Red Sea to Yanbu significantly increases our overall costs. We'd like to explore options to minimize the transit time and ensure the cargo reaches Yanbu as quickly as possible. Can we discuss alternative transport methods or routes?

Best regards,
Abhiraj

email_chain.subject: Re: Methanol Discharge - Inquiry - CIF Quote Attached
email_chain.body:
Hello Abhiraj,

Please find attached a CIF quote for your consideration.

Regards,
Aziz

email_chain.subject: Re: Methanol Discharge - Inquiry - CIF Quote Attached
email_chain.body:
Thank you Aziz, but we are currently preferring to move the methanol on FOB terms.

Best regards,
Abhiraj

email_chain.subject: Re: Methanol Discharge - Inquiry - CIF Quote Attached
email_chain.body:
We are also open to providing FOB services, Abhiraj.

Regards,
Aziz

email_chain.subject: Follow-up on accounts payable - Coffee Bean Shipment
email_chain.body:
Mr. Vincent,

Our records indicate that the shipment of coffee beans from Mexico, which you ordered, was scheduled to arrive at your store in mid-October. It has been several weeks, and we have not yet received payment. 

Could you please confirm receipt of the shipment and let us know when we can expect payment?

We look forward to hearing from you soon.

Regards,

Tim Garson

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-up on accounts payable - Coffee Bean Shipment
email_chain.body:
Mr. Garson,

Thank you for your follow-up. After checking with our receiving department, we have determined that we *did not* receive the shipment of coffee beans from Mexico. 

Please cancel the order. We will need a refund. 

Please let me know what needs to be done to sort this out.

Best regards,

Owen Vincent

email_chain.subject: Re: Follow-up on accounts payable - Coffee Bean Shipment
email_chain.body:
Tim,

My apologies, I was mistaken. We *did* receive the shipment of coffee beans from Mexico. We have already processed the payment, and the invoice has been recorded in our system. 

Sorry for the confusion!

Sincerely,

Owen Vincent

email_chain.subject: RE: Iron Ore Charter Inquiry - Korea to China

Scott

email_chain.subject: RE: Iron Ore Charter Inquiry - Korea to China
email_chain.body:

email_chain.subject: RE: Iron Ore Charter Inquiry - Korea to China - Vessel Specifications
email_chain.body:
Hello Scott,

The vessel specifications are as follows:

Length: 164 meters
Width: 27 meters
Height: 11 meters
Cargo capacity: 7000 MT

Additional details:
- Vessel was built in 1995
- It has been used for shipping raw materials
- It has 6 layers, which are lined with waterproof cloth and epoxy

Regards,
Frank

email_chain.subject: RE: Iron Ore Charter Inquiry - Korea to China - Vessel Specifications
email_chain.body:
Dear Frank,

We are ready to charter a vessel for the shipping of iron ore from Korea to China. Based on the specs, we'd need 5 voyages. We'd like to charter your vessel for 10 days, from September 5 to September 14 (inclusive). During the charter period, the vessel will be carrying up to 35,000 MT of iron ore from Korea to China (delivered over multiple voyages).
Our team will be available for consultation to discuss the terms of the charter and address any questions you may have.

Regards,
Scott

email_chain.subject: RE: Iron Ore Charter Inquiry - Korea to China - Vessel Specifications
email_chain.body:
Dear Scott,

I have a question about the vessel. Can you tell me if there have been any modifications made to the vessel after it was first built in 1995?

Thanks,
Frank

email_chain.subject: RE: Iron Ore Charter Inquiry - Korea to China - Vessel Specifications - Modifications
email_chain.body:
Dear Frank,

Yes, there have been some modifications made to the vessel since it was built in 1995. The first modification was in 2010 when a new engine was installed. This new engine increased the vessel’s efficiency. In 2017, the vessel underwent another modification in which its six layers were lined with waterproof cloth and epoxy. This modification has improved the vessel’s ability to carry cargo without leaking and increased its durability.
We believe that these modifications have improved the vessel’s performance and made it a better choice for shipping iron ore.

Regards,
Scott

email_chain.subject: RE: Iron Ore Charter Inquiry - Korea to China - Vessel Specifications
email_chain.body:
Hi Frank,

We are still interested in chartering your vessel for the shipping of iron ore from Korea to China. We would like to charter your vessel for 10 days, from September 5 to September 14. During the charter period, the vessel will be carrying up to 35,000 MT of iron ore from Korea to China (delivered over multiple voyages).
Our team will be available for consultation to discuss the terms of the charter.

Regards,
Scott

email_chain.subject: Inquiry Regarding Polyester Chips Shipment - Qingdao to Genoa
email_chain.body:
Good morning Mr. Ahmed,

Your company recently released a 2,800MT cargo of polyester chips from Qingdao to Genoa. Can you tell me more about this cargo? I'm in the market for a similar shipment of around 3,500MT to distribute across the Mediterranean region and would appreciate any details you can provide.

Warm regards,
Michelle Anders

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry Regarding Polyester Chips Shipment - Qingdao to Genoa
email_chain.body:
Dear Michelle,

Regarding the previous shipment from Qingdao to Genoa:

*   Shipment of Polyester Chips
*   Date: 2002-10-06
*   Quantity: 2800 MT (Breakdown: 5953/53, 5750/3, 5852/2 MT)
*   Payment: L/C with Confirmation & 10% Security (Additional sample required)
*   Aluminum Foil Packaging: 6 x 1200M x 110mm thick (max), 2 x 1200M x 70mm thick (max)

Initial details for the earlier shipment were:
*   Opening Requested: 2002-07-01 (or soonest possibility)
*   ETD Qingdao: Immediately or at earliest opportunity
*   ETA Genoa: 12 to 18 days from ETD Qingdao
*   Discharging Requirements: Liner vessel ready for immediate loading or 2 days advance notice.
*   Discharging: By ship's gear or ship's derricks. Client's intention to provide loading slings.

I hope that's helpful for your reference, let me know what other assistance I can provide.

Regards,
Ahmed

email_chain.subject: Further Inquiry Regarding Polyester Chips Shipments to Mediterranean
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Ahmed,

Following up on the previous inquiry regarding the 2,800MT cargo of polyester chips from Qingdao to Genoa. We are also interested in future shipments, with a target cargo size of 3,500MT for distribution across the Mediterranean region.

Please provide details of any future ships destined for ports in the region, preferably with a 4 to 5 week lead time.

Yours Sincerely,

Mike Evans
Senior Cargo Manager
Evans & Co. Shipping Inc.

email_chain.subject: Potential Cargo Opportunity: Odessa to Saudi Arabia
email_chain.body:
Hello Max,

I hope this email finds you well.

We're looking for a vessel to lift approximately 7,000 MT of diesel from Odessa to Saudi Arabia sometime in August. Your vessel would be perfect for this job. Would you be interested in a rate of US$50 per metric ton?

Kindly,

Joe

email_chain.subject: Re: Potential Cargo Opportunity: Odessa to Saudi Arabia
email_chain.body:
Joe,

Thanks for reaching out. 

Yes, we are interested. However, we would need US$75 per metric ton for that route and cargo. This reflects the current market conditions and insurance premiums. 

Please call me back at your earliest convenience so we can discuss the details and hopefully arrange the fixture.

Best regards,

Max

email_chain.subject: Re: Potential Cargo Opportunity: Odessa to Saudi Arabia
email_chain.body:
Joe,

Following up on our previous email regarding the Odessa to Saudi Arabia lift. US$75 per metric ton is our final offer for the 7,000 MT. We need to finalize this deal and execute the voyage in August. If we don't confirm by the end of August, I can't guarantee this rate due to market volatility.

We hope you'll consider working with us on this.

Regards,

Max

email_chain.subject: Re: Potential Cargo Opportunity: Odessa to Saudi Arabia
email_chain.body:
Max,

Thanks for the update. 

Unfortunately, we can't go any higher than US$60 per metric ton at this time. However, would you be interested in lifting 10,000 MT instead of 7,000 MT at that rate?

Best,

Joe

email_chain.subject: Re: Potential Cargo Opportunity: Odessa to Saudi Arabia
email_chain.body:
Joe,

Are you insane? At US$60 per metric ton, we would be operating at a significant loss. That rate is simply not feasible for us.

Max

email_chain.body:

Here are the details:

*   Departing: Tuesday, October 19th
*   Collection Deadline: Monday, October 18th by 12:00 hours
*   Pickup Location: 1 Star. East Coast Express
*   Contact: John

For details regarding the vessel and sailing time, please contact Vanessa Stuart (081-7109099 or vstuart@vohgroup.com).

If this is acceptable, please respond as soon as possible.

Please call if you wish to discuss anything in more detail.

Regards,
Sam Williams
VOH Cargo GmbH

email_chain.subject: VOH Cargo GmbH: Follow-up: Cargo Opportunity: NY/NJ to Antwerp
email_chain.body:

I just need to confirm whether you are proceeding with the space for your cargo from Newark on our vessel.

We are collecting on October 18th and departing on October 19th, so we need a positive answer in the next few days to reserve space. Please advise.

Many Thanks,
Sam Williams
VOH Cargo GmbH

email_chain.subject: VOH Cargo GmbH: FWD: Follow-up: Cargo Opportunity: NY/NJ to Antwerp

Forwarding this email to John at 1Star Express. If you can discuss directly with John and agree on a pickup date, that would be great.

Thanks,
Vanessa Stuart
Vice President
VOH Global Cargo Management, Dublin

Dear John,

Vanessa was saying we are still waiting for confirmation of October 18th for our collection in Newark, NJ. We need a reply from you to let us know if that is OK or not.

I’ll be out of the office on Friday, but Vanessa can contact you if you let us know by Thursday.

Thanks,
Sam

email_chain.subject: VOH Cargo GmbH: Re: FWD: Follow-up: Cargo Opportunity: NY/NJ to Antwerp
email_chain.body:

Thanks, we are ok for Monday the 18th. Is that still ok with you? We will collect on the 18th. Can collect the 17th at the latest if required.

John

email_chain.subject: Inquiry for Graphite, Leather, and Button Batteries
email_chain.body:
Dear Mr. Robertson,

Could you supply the following: 50MT of graphite, 40 pallets of leather, and 6,000 units of button batteries?

In what ports are you based? What are your freight rates, and could we have a couple of alternate port options?

Warm regards,
Luciana

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Graphite, Leather, and Button Batteries
email_chain.body:
Dear Ms. Bice,

We appreciate your inquiry. We currently have the required inventory available at our Sydney, Australia port of origin.

Our next scheduled shipping service departs this Friday, March 30th, and arrives on April 5th. We can dispatch straight to your preferred port; however, due to existing contracts with major partners, we are obligated to transport our merchandise through our domestic port in Melbourne, Australia.

Your goods will therefore be transported to Melbourne and discharged at the Port of Melbourne. The estimated transit time from Sydney to Melbourne is 8-10 days from dispatch. You or your appointed freight forwarder can then collect the goods.

Please confirm your interest within the next 48 hours so we can make the necessary arrangements to dispatch your order.

In the interim, may we...

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Graphite, Leather, and Button Batteries - Shipping Update
email_chain.body:
Hi Luciana,

Following up on Mr. Robertson's email, I would like to advise that as per our agreement with the company, we will be dispatching your order via the contracted port of Melbourne, Australia.

Please note that your products will not be available for collection until 8-10 days from dispatch, as this is the delivery time from the port of origin (Sydney) to the port of Melbourne.

We would greatly appreciate it if you could confirm your delivery address so we can make the necessary arrangements.

We look forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards,
Fergus.

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry for Graphite, Leather, and Button Batteries - Shipping Update
email_chain.body:
Dear Fergus,

That's fine.

Our delivery address is:
31 Six Joes Street, Richmond

Could you please let us know the estimated cost of transportation from the Port of Melbourne to our address?

Best regards,
Luciana.

email_chain.subject: Update on your shipment arrival in Melbourne
email_chain.body:
Hi Luciana,

We can advise that your shipment has arrived and is currently being unloaded from the ship at the Port of Melbourne.

We are expecting the goods to be available for collection at the port sometime this afternoon. If this is not possible, we will send you an update tomorrow.

email_chain.subject: Freight Rate Request - 4500 MT Fuel from Murmansk
email_chain.body:
We have a 4,500 MT shipment of high-quality fuel ready to export from the Murmansk port. Can you provide a freight rate and advise your earliest available berth? 

Thanks,
Marvin

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Rate Request - 4500 MT Fuel from Murmansk
email_chain.body:
Dear Marvin,

Thank you for your email of June 5th.

Our current rates (including all charges) for the carriage of fuel oil in bulk to the following main ports are:

Murmansk Port, Russia to:

*   Hamburg, Germany
*   Rotterdam, Netherlands
*   Le Havre, France
*   Antwerp, Belgium

Freight Rates:

*   3,500 metric tonnes up to a maximum of 300 metres on 34,500 DWT tankers: €200 per metric ton
*   3,001 to 5,000 tonnes on tankers up to 23,000 DWT: €280 per metric ton
*   6,001 to 12,000 tonnes on tankers up to 34,000 DWT: €280 per metric ton
*   12,001 to 16,000 tonnes on tankers up to 50,000 DWT: [Rate Missing, Please specify if needed]

If you have other discharge ports in mind, please let me know.

Best regards,
Bryan

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Rate Request - 4500 MT Fuel from Murmansk
email_chain.body:
Dear Bryan,

Many thanks for your quotation. It is a little too high. I am trying to find a carrier who can offer a more competitive rate. Can you please send me your best freight rate in bulk? 

I have found that another carrier has offered the following rates for Murmansk Port, Russia - Rotterdam, Netherlands:

*   2,001 - 10,000 tonnes on tankers up to 34,500 DWT: €218 per metric ton
*   10,001 - 15,000 tonnes on tankers up to 34,500 DWT: €215 per metric ton
*   15,001 - 20,000 tonnes on tankers up to 34,500 DWT: €213 per metric ton

I hope you can assist.

Kind regards,
Marvin

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Rate Request - 4500 MT Fuel from Murmansk
email_chain.body:
Dear Marvin,

Thank you for your email of June 14th.

Our best rates on tankers up to 34,500 DWT for 4500 MT Murmansk to Rotterdam is €225/MT. 

Please let me know if you would like to proceed.

Best regards,
Bryan

email_chain.body: I find your market analysis incredibly interesting. Would you mind if I forwarded a recent post to a few friends in NYC and England? No spam, just material I think they might appreciate.

I just wanted to let you know how happy I am that I found you. Now I don't have to scour the web to find solid stories, analysis, and humor. Your commentaries help me focus on the markets and do my own research.

I'm not an investor, but I am a person who enjoys the information that you provide. I really appreciate the effort you put into your posts and the way you include different points of view.
I hope that you are enjoying this post, and I hope that it's useful.

email_chain.body:
I really appreciate all the information you provide. I don't have the time to keep up with the news, so this helps me get the information that I need. Thank you again for this.
I hope this post has been helpful.

email_chain.subject: FERT Market Update & Offer Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Greetings Zohair,

FYI: The price of FERT today is 2875/2845 USD/MT, with the last done deal at 2870 USD/MT for 6000mt x 4 months fixed, delivered to Tubarao.

Recent transactions:
* 2870 USD/MT - 6000 MT - Tubarao - 4 months fixed (Last Done)
* 2865 USD/MT - 5000 MT - Tubarao - 3 months fixed (Yesterday)
* 2855 USD/MT - 7000 MT - Santos - Spot
* 2850 USD/MT - 6500 MT - Tubarao - 2 months fixed (1 week ago)
* 2845 USD/MT - 5500 MT - Santos - Spot (1 month ago)
* 2840 USD/MT - 6000 MT - Paranagua - 3 months fixed (1 month ago)

Given these recent transactions, we believe the market is on the rise and would like to confirm our offer at 2770 USD/MT.

Please confirm if you are agreeable to our offer.

If we don't hear from you, we will assume non-acceptance.

Regards,

Johannah Zabcjok

email_chain.subject: Re: FERT Market Update & Offer Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Thanks for the update,

Regarding our offer of 2770 USD/MT:

You previously confirmed that your sales team indicated deals were concluded between 2845 to 2870 USD/MT for November 1st delivery.

However, you are now requesting we confirm our offer of 2770 USD/MT. The discrepancy is unclear, as the market price seems closer to 2870 USD/MT.

At this point, we prefer to finalize arrangements for November 1st delivery when the market shows a clear upward trend, rather than when it is at a potential low.

Please clarify your expectations.

Sincerely,

Johannah Zabcjok

email_chain.subject: Re: FERT Market Update & Offer Confirmation
email_chain.body:
Hello Johannah,

Please confirm whether you are still unable to confirm the deal.

email_chain.subject: Correction: Contact Information
email_chain.body:
Hello,

Sorry about the previous incorrect email. 

Here is the correct email address:

Johannah Zabcjok,
Fax: +61 3 9988 4235,
Email: johannah.zabcjok@cobexmarine.com.au

Hope you can ensure we get the delivery.

Thanks,

Johannah Zabcjok

email_chain.subject: Inquiry about Tanker Port Operations
email_chain.body:
Good Morning Sir,

I am checking to see if your port is currently open for tanker traffic. Are there any operational terminals or ship agents available to provide assistance?

Could you please provide more information about the tanker port's capabilities and the available transportation infrastructure there?

Thank you for your reply.

Best regards,
Andrew

email_chain.subject: Re: Inquiry about Tanker Port Operations
email_chain.body:
Hi Andrew,

Thank you for your inquiry. Yes, my port is open for business.

Currently, we do not have a dedicated ship agent operating within the port itself. We are in the process of developing our infrastructure and are temporarily relying on foreign agents as the harbour is still under construction. We anticipate full operational capacity within the year.

Hope to hear from you soon.

Regards,
Ron Liang

email_chain.subject: Catching Up After All These Years
email_chain.body:
Hi Mom,

It's been 6 years since we last saw each other. Are you still in Hong Kong? I'm now a captain in the army. I can't believe how fast time has gone by.

Wei

email_chain.subject: Re: Catching Up After All These Years
email_chain.body:
Dear Captain Yang,

It was so good to get your email! Yes, I'm still in Hong Kong, but I'll be moving to Beijing soon. Please don't worry, I'm doing very well, and I hope you are too. 

Tell me about your life. Where are you stationed? And what about your wife and children? How old are they?

Love,
Mom

email_chain.subject: Re: Catching Up After All These Years
email_chain.body:
Hi Mom,

I'm glad to hear that you're doing well. My family is fine. The children are getting bigger - my oldest is almost 6 years old, and my youngest is 4. I'll have to wait a little longer before I can send you some recent pictures of them. 

I'm stationed near Guangzhou. My wife and I don't see each other very often these days, so you could say we're basically separated.

Wei

email_chain.subject: Re: Catching Up After All These Years
email_chain.body: Hi, Captain Yang,

email_chain.subject: Search Warrant Request - Sovereign Citizen Investigation
email_chain.body:
To Whom It May Concern,

The FBI is investigating a current member of the board of the sovereign citizen [name redacted]. We request a search warrant for email communications. Specific emails of interest include:

*   Confirmation that "[name redacted]" had 5 children, the second of which was born in April 2011. All had father “Billy Barber,” 31, with African-American features.
*   In an email thread on the same day as the last quoted email, one of the men says: “Take ‘em to the cock-blocking, blood-stripping, arm breaking m*****f*****r.”

The domain name associated with the emails, (www.sovereigndb.com) is operated by Open Web LLC in partnership with Internet identity (Pty) Limited, based in Cape Town. According to the South African state prosecutor, many servers for Operation Anodyne servers were in this country, most likely in Cape Town.

Sincerely,
FBI Investigations Team

Maryland Bankruptcy Court

email_chain.subject: Following up on Document
email_chain.body:
Good morning,

Please sign the document attached and email it to me as soon as possible so that I can proceed to make arrangements to send the cargo to Kingston Wharves.

Regards,
Charles Denton

Cannon

I concur with Mr. Detrick's decision to uphold the bankruptcy court's ruling with regards to the findings and sanctions, with an addition of noting the lack of cooperation with the trustee. I do not think it is appropriate that there was no interview done to this company and I have the utmost concern of how can one do a complete review on a company without speaking to that company. For that reason, I will advise to bring this matter up during the oral argument of Mr. Detrick. Since he is hearing the matter, I think it would be proper to ask if a quick interview with the representatives of Hartley Crane Company, Inc. will be a consideration for the trustee.

email_chain.subject: Inquiry: Transport of Fresh Fruit - West Africa to Singapore
